Pricey but very good.  The wild mushroom pita was very flavorful with a mix of fun mushrooms and super soft pita.  I would have preferred tahini instead of sour cream and it wasn't as spicy as advertised so a little more kick would have been great.  But a nice mix of options for vegetarian and meat eaters alike.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Casher is so rude, and the food is not good and salty. Don't even think about eating this food. Ordered Ribeye Pita.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious food: we had a luscious lamb kebab and fragrant falafel burger! And very quickly prepared by the kitchen.
No comment

So good I don't know where to start the food or the service?  Shak & Megan are the absolute Dream Team. Went with my BFF last Sunday afternoon & we were treated like royalty!  We were there for over 2 hours. The food is incredible; you can tell how much pride they take in their work. Had the falafel burger, cauliflower, green beans (obsessed with them) & a chocolate mousse. Also a cocktail or 2... so yummy!  As a vegetarian I'm pretty much an expert on falafel & this was the best!  Not only the food but the presentation & Shak & Megan & everyone so welcoming & friendly. Please drop this place near Ft. Lauderdale soon!  But Shak & Megan have to come

The service and food was Great! I loved the classic yet homey experience the restaurant was! The water that they provided was very clean and refreshing! I tried both their wild mushroom pita and ratatouille pita! Both were super flavorful and the quality of food was great! The prices were around $15-17 for the pita when I went! I absolutely also adored the tomato on the table as well! We also got a spicy pepper included with our food! Here's how the ambiance and food looks like! I would recommend it to anyone who's at Hudson Yards!
No comment
No comment
No comment

So this place is super cool. Focuses on Israeli food all the sides that come with your meal you can have as much as you want! They are incredibly delicious so come with a big appetite. I was crazy about the sausage It was a bit dry for me but my friend got a different meat (forgot which but also lamb I think) and it was super good!
No comment
No comment
A great fast casual Mediterranean street food place. All of us order something different and every tray was cleaned after. No complaints here. A definite go!

My husband and I stopped at this little Israeli place at Hudson Yards. We both enjoyed our food with was falafel's, sweet potatoes and bottled water. We took our to go to sit in the area right outside the establishment.  We loved our food very much it was very authentic since we both are very familiar with Israeli food.  The falafel was moist and favorable, with fresh salad.  The sweet potato was perfect myself accompanied by some sour cream basic and yummy.    I recommend this little restaurant all to enjoy.

The rotisserie broken chicken pita is probably the best pita sandwich I've ever tasted. The wait staff was also incredibly friendly, and I found seating almost immediately, despite the relatively small size of their Chelsea Market storefront. This is a must-try if you're shopping in Chelsea Market!
No comment

Went to check out the shops at Hudson Yards for the first time and after much browsing we needed some fuel so stopped at Miznon. First time here, I liked that the menu was simple and not overwhelming. It is self-proclaimed street style Mediterranean food. We got two pitas to try, the folded cheeseburger + rotisserie broken chicken. Although it was quickly prepared, the food was piping hot when it came out which made it feel more like a true sit down dining experience. I am not huge on chicken, but was pleasantly surprised by the tenderness and flavoring of their chicken pita and had a few more bites than I normally would. We enjoyed it so much, we plan on making our own za'atar chicken at home! Perfect amount of food for lunch.
No comment

I'm not from New York, and I was staying at the hotel across from Hudson Yards and found this place while shopping one day. All I gotta say is that it was definitely one of the highlights of my visit, and that's saying a lot! Their chicken wrap is soooo delicious! I'll never forget it! I'm currently craving it right now, and it hurts me that I'm back home all the way in the other side of the country.
No comment

Miznon is a terrific Israeli restaurant in Hudson Yards. The weekend brunch is outstanding. Everything is wonderful, from the potato latkes to the French Toast Steak. The arak cocktail (a licorice mojito) is both unique and delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great lunch spot in the Hudson Yards mall. I've been twice and both times ordered the rotisserie broken chicken pita which is so delicious! The pita is STUFFED with lots of tender juicy chicken and seasoned so perfectly. I love to ask for more tahini and green pepper sauce to eat with it. Warning that it does get quite messy to eat with oils dripping out so would highly recommend a fork. $15 is a bit pricey but it's NY after all and at least you won't leave hungry!

hands down one of my favorite things i ate in new york. i got the folded cheeseburger and the pita was SO chewy and thick and the meat was SO tender and juicy. the cheese in the meat literally melts in your mouth and the extra crispy layer of cheese they put in your pita is so crispy and rich. i am drooling right now as i type this. the workers are so quick in making your order and the inside is such a bustling vibe!
No comment
No comment

We came to eat at The Shops & Restaurants at Hudson Yards before going to The Edge. We found this little spot, Miznon, while walking around the mall. They call it Israeli street food. I ordered the folded cheeseburger in a pita. I didn't know what to expect but I have to admit it was really good! If you are looking for something a little different, definitely check them out. I loved it!

Holy smokes this place is divine!!!! If you're looking for a lunch or dinner that is insatiably delicious but also feels clean and somewhat healthy, go here!!! The chicken pita was grilled to perfection, the pita was warm and soft, vegetables crisp and bright and the sauces and oil were oozing with perfection. I'm glad I don't live in NYC because I think I'd crave this every day!! Oh also, get the cauliflower to share. It's probably the best roasted cauliflower I've ever had!
Wow. So fresh. Flavors are amazing. Just like home--wait, better than home. They want to be magical?  They succeeded for even this quick lunch patron. Price was great too!
No comment

Really good pitas! Loved the steak pita I got. The roasted cauliflower was good but nothing special - a bit over salted and very overpriced. Only docked a star bc of how expensive it is but otherwise, very good!

I had the lamb kebab pita and the flavoring was incredible! Loses a star because the portion was tiny for what you pay. Ended up at $16 for a pita sandwich and there was one little piece of lamb. Delicious, but needed more in there for what you're paying. No sides either like fries or chips. Left hungry
No comment

I was looking forward to trying Miznon, but incredibly disappointed with the quality and hygiene. You can see the cooks make the dish and they did not wear gloves and held the pitas with their hands. Disgusting. The pita itself was soggy immediately after receiving because there was so much oil inside. It did not feel healthy at all. I ordered the shredded chicken in pita. Very disappointed with this restaurant
Delightful little spot to grab food at Hudson Yards! The meat was so tender and I loved the flavor. Great for a quick bite whilst shopping.
No comment
No comment
If you want to experience authentic Israeli /  Lebanese food, this is the place. Everything we had was made fresh right in front of us, and everything we had was delicious.
No comment
Absolutely delicious, they keep me coming back. That folded burger is a work of art and every bite is an adventure.
No comment
No comment

Cool new place in Hudson yards. I went during lunch on Wednesday and there was such a long line to be seated. I definitely recommend ordering ahead if you don't want to sit down. I got their chicken tzatziki pita and it was so good. The pita is soft and fresh, the chicken is flavorful, and the sauces are delicious. It's slightly pricey at $14 for one pita but I don't regret trying it

Fantastic - service was quick and efficient, seating area (we ate at the bar table in front of the prep area) was clean. I had the lamb kebab and my husband had the broken chicken. Delicious and tasty and worth the (inexpensive price tag)!!
No comment

Wow. Honestly wow. This place surpassed my expectations by a mile! It's fast food, but not fast food. It's veggie-centric, and even though I'm a carnivore galore, I'm in love with everything here. The burger in a pita is absolutely outstanding. Friendly service, modern decor. Great food.

Miznon has several outposts around the world - originating from Jerusalem. Fiancé and I decided to stop in at the Hudson yards location for pick up since there aren't any indoor seating available due to COVID. We ordered the rib eye steak pita sandwich. The sandwich was a bit bland and contained a lot of fat. With literally 3 long slices of meat, most of which was fat - very disappointing. I did really like the decor of the restaurant - great touch with fresh veggies on display.
No comment

I've been a huge fan of Miznon and Eyal Shani for years but this experience today was just atrocious. After waiting on a long line we find out that three of the items we wanted to order were not available that day, then it took over 40 minutes for our two sandwiches to come out, and to top it all off the sandwiches were practically inedible. We got the Lavan sandwich and the cauliflower was so charred we had to spit it out. Finally, when we went to tell their staff, they were too busy to do anything about it. Just terrible.
Very long waiting time, poor food quality and horrible customer service. Don't waste your time and money here.
the staff are fairlynice. My favorite is the mushroom pita and the octopus. Delicous . cute setting.

I got the folded burger and it was definitely not worth the $16 I spent on it.  For some reason there were big pockets of salt in the burger that almost made me sick.  Were it not for those, it probably would have been OK.  It's also very crowded and the wait time is pretty long at lunch.
No comment

I tried the Lamb Pita and the Steak pita.  Both were yummy!  Nice spot to eat inside of the mall if you don't want Shake Shack or Fuku.  It is a bit pricey for the size IMO but you shouldn't over eat anyways.
No comment
No comment

We came here as a party of five and the servers proceeded to place several  small plates on our table and said we had to order five entrees or be charged $25 for the small plates that no one ordered. Kind of strange, but we'll play ball. We ordered five skewers for dinner. First off, the skewers each came on an awkwardly gigantic plate, which took up the entirety of an already scarce table because of these small plates that no one ordered! Secondly, the metal skewer came hot, and they'll repeatedly warn you about that, but there really isn't an elegant way to eat the meat without giving yourself first degree burns. While the food was good (granted, it's hard to mess up grilled meat with salt, pepper and olive oil), the portions left a lot to be desired. For example, a $37 octopus shishlik came with skewer full of vegetables and two pieces of octopus. Good thing we had the small plates that no one ordered, because the group was so hungry at the end that we ended up eating all of those small plates! It's Hudson Yards, so I was expecting it to be expensive, but I wasn't expecting to leave with a half empty stomach.

One bottle of Goldstar Beer, a Chardonnay, and a 16.9 oz bottle of water was $28. Outrageous and unnecessary. Stay away from the alcohol. Food could be good but I didn't try it. Just wanted a beer while waiting for The Edge. I know it's NY, but come on. Will never endorse this place nor recommend it to any of my fellow travelers with the current prices.

The cauliflower pita with tahini sauce is incredible. I got this in person and it was such a treat to eat out on the plaza by the Vessel. I ordered the cheeseburger pita from Uber eats for delivery the next day and it was only okay. Definitely can't go wrong with the cauliflower here! Counter staff is friendly and COVID protocols are followed.
No comment
Incredible lamb Kabob.  The pita was delicious and the meat had really great flavor.  Will be back

Visiting the city and we were starving by the time we got to the shops! We found this place and decided to dine in! There was a group of 8 of us and the service was phenomenal! We were waited on by Megan and she made our experience so great!!! She was so cheerful and had great recommendations from the menu! The staff was so helpful as well! They were all working as a team to make sure we had all our drinks and food in a timely manner! Very hard to find people this friendly and energetic! The food was delicious! Would definitely revisit this place!

Great food as always. However, the employee customer service is terrible. We ordered two pitas and asked the person taking our order at the register if we could have the sauces on the side (sometimes the pitas get really messy). Girl at the register said no problem and that was that. When it came time to pick up our food the I noticed a few sauces were missing. I asked and the employee was really annoyed and said they normally don't do that and asked the cooks for our sides sauces which came out in 5 secs. Looking more annoyed and perturbed she continued to tell me again they don't normally do this in which i said "don't tell me tell your cashier" in which she rolled her eyes. Oh well, people have bad days I get it. It's Saturday noon and nobody wants to work. Then as we are finishing our meals another girl starts cleaning our table as we are getting up and spraying the table with our drinks (we were still drinking them) getting the cleaning solution all over. Just a bad experience. Would not eat at this location again.
Folded cheeseburger was absolutely delicious. Never had anything like it before. Highly recommend.

Ordered the rib-eye minute steak pita. Was super excited to bite into it but realized that the meat was heavily oversalted. Tried biting into other parts of the pita but it just tasted like the top came off the shaker when it was being prepared.
Super fluffy pitas and expert service. The mushroom pita blew me away. So juicy and savory.
I've never really had this type of food before and I was blown away by the exceptional flavor and will definitely be back!
No comment

Been here a couple of times and I seriously love this place. All the pitas I've tried so far are so good: rib eye, wild mushrooms, and hraime (fish in tomato sauce). My favorite is the fish one, so flavorful. But my favorite is their pita, which is VERY soft and fluffy. And we love their baby cauliflower as well. The first one we had was a bit burned on top but nevertheless good (I like burned food don't judge). I definitely see myself coming back to try the rest of the pitas.
No comment

Visited Miznon with my family for an early dinner at Hudson Yards. OMG, yuck!!!!   The falafel burger tasted like rotten eggs.  The Rib Eye Minute steak was extremely fatty and salty, and the tap water tasted like toilet water.  Save yourself the trip and go somewhere else.  Eyal, we expected something good, but unfortunately the food and experience were terrible.

Ordered the roasted cauliflower, which was amazing - definitely 1 of the best I've had!! Would suggest trying even if you're someone not too into veggies!! Also got the beef and root stew - which was more like a sandwich as it was in a pita bread; though, nonetheless also very tasty!! You can actually taste the freshness!! Also the staff/ service was on point!! Overall wonderful experience!!

After getting my first COVID shot at the Javits Center, walked over to Miznon at the Hudson Yards.  I am so glad I decided to eat here.  I tried the lamb kebab in Pita.  The lamb kebab was perfectly spiced and cooked / grilled to perfect temperature with just the right amount of toppings and the sauce.  Amazing, can't wait to visit again.
The Lamb Kebob is to die for! The staff is very friendly as well as a positive environment.
No comment
Samuel and Megan were delightful and made it an extremely pleasant experience. The food is delicious, especially the vegetables. These are the beast string beans you'll ever try.
Good food, unbearably loud music at the checkout counter. Hard to place an order because of the volume, hard to hear when your order is ready. Detracts from the overall experience.
Food was amazing Everyone should go try this location out bring family friends relatives it has a real Israel atmosphere strongly recommend the kabob and the octopus they both was phenomenal
You're thinking, it's in a mall...is it actually good? Ignore that. AMAZING Israeli food. Just go.

Don't come here if you're unvaccinated, you won't be served- this includes to-go. If you aren't vaccinated they will not serve you food(this includes to-go). Me and my friend came here to get our food to-go. We were going to eat outside because it was a beautiful day and we respect the rules of Hudson Yard Mall. But they told us they could not serve us food at all. Just giving those who are unvaccinated a heads up. You must show proof of vaccination when you place a order.

Miznon is an excellent find that I would have never found without yelp. Very nice and cozy environment. They certainly have a phenomenal menu as well. The staff was extremely welcoming and service is superb. Very recommended.

Just ordered a falafel pita. $18? Okay, I get it; I'm at Hudson Yards. It arrives, and was only cooked on the outside. Completely raw inside. The sauce, which I guess was supposed to be tzatiki, was absolutely tasteless. And they put minced jalapeno on top. That's not a falafel. It was more like terribly awful. Never again. Go to SweetGreen. You'll be a lot happier.

Talk about amazing. I specifically came here to try their folded cheeseburger. I only have one word to describe this sandwich-RIDICULOUS. Seriously, it's some next level burger. They grill the burger with the cheese so part of the cheese gets all crispy but the part that's inside the patty is all melted goodness. Then they stuff the ginormous cheese filled patty inside of the softest most pillow-like pita that's filled with toppings including sauce. Some locations even give you a giant green pepper to go with the sandwich which by the you should be stuffing inside the sandwich because there's no better way to eat it. I also tried their cauliflower and it was good but a bit too bland for me. Oh and their hummus is delicious!! It's creamy and topped with chickpeas and this green relish? Gives Taim a run for their money. Def give this place a try!!
Ribeye sandwich is ridiculously good.  Its so good I don't want people to know about it
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was so happy to finally check this place out. The wait was a bit long but it was worth it. We got the cod roe udon and the bulgogi fried rice. It was packed but our foods came out pretty quick. They gave us hot Tteok-bokki as a side dish. The creaminess of the udon was perfect and the roe didn't make it salty at all. The fried rice was fantastic! Such a great wok flavor with the diced bulgogis.

Great spot for Korean Tapas and there wasn't too much of a wait when we arrived with no reservation. We weren't too hungry and really just wanted something to snack on so we came here. I could've done without the lamb but everything else was really good! The portions are tiny and it is a bit pricey, however, standard for KTown prices. We also got their mango slushy soju that I highly recommend. It wasn't too strong but the flavor was great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

So much better than your name is Han. I really enjoyed everything here. The corn was super unique and crispy. The squid rice had a great umami flavor. The fried chicken was pretty good. The udon was super creamy. Would come back especially to try the cool drinks.
Food and drinks are super solid. I really love their makgeolli mixer and the wide variety of dishes . For uniqueness-- get the Mochi pork. For a full meal -- get the stew.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place was super popular even on a weekday night! Definitely recommend booking a reservation prior to coming in. The udon was so creamy and rich, but not too heavy. It also came with a decent amount of seafood so highly recommend. The corn pancake was not as crispy as expected and quite oily. Not pictured but we also tried the rose pasta. It was a unique flavor but not our favorite. Would definitely come back to try the other items on the menu!
No comment

No comment

The food itself is very good but like NOT crazy, you know? It was definitely worth it and I would go again. I went with one of my friends and I would definitely want to visit again with my girlfriend. My waitress was Jennifer and she was amazing. She always checked in with us and made sure our water and food was good. The topokki was free refill and she always made sure we had enough. The ambiance is very dark and romantic, which was weird because I was with my friend, but it was overall a good experience. This was my first time, and I definitely want to go again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Make sure you make a resv prior the waiting line will be a lot shorter. We made a resv  at 5:30p when it's time to open so we were able to get a table right away. I'm a frequent flyer here whenever I'm in ktown.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Managed to snag a table at Take31 without a reservation purely out of luck haha this place is popular! We ordered the army stew, cod roe udon, pork belly rice crepe, and makgeolli to share between 4 people. We felt quite full by the end but if you have big eaters at your table you might want to order a bit more since the portions are a bit smaller. Everything was presented beautifully and delicious. The pork belly rice crepe was pretty sweet and the injeolmi texture was more gooey than like a crepe, which not everyone will like. Cod roe udon was incredible though! Definitely enjoyed our meal here in NYC.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Anyone ever hear the saying if you see a bunch of Asians dining at an Asian restaurant, you know it's good? Well that statement pertains to this restaurant- this place opened at 5 pm on a Friday, my party of 3 got there at 5:45 pm and we had to wait 30 minutes because the place was packed! They don't even take reservations! Anyway this place was definitely worth it. I highly recommend the raspberry rice wine- the peach rice wine is the signature drink but raspberry was better.  Definitely order the crispy corn pancake, garlic spicy chicken (a bit spicy, you might not like it if you don't like spicy food), and the pork belly rice crepe wraps- a little on the sweeter side. You only have 1.5 hours- 2 hours to "sit", so make it count!
No comment

Take 31 is consistently delicious for some Korean comfort food. we got the short rib chapaguri which really hit the spot and the corn pancake. They even give you a side of their rice cakes when you order take out! I gave four instead of five stars because the food is delicious but it's pretty $$$.
No comment

The food here is pretty good. My favorite got to be the udon and the seafood pancake. the udon is very creamy and chewy. The seafood pancake is very crispy and not overly salty! The dishes here are  small portion so I normally get a whole order for myself.
No comment
No comment

It doesn't look like much when you pass by, but it's a vibe there.  The rice wine (makgeolli) is house-made, I got yogurt flavor, and it was super refreshing. The items I ordered were Army stew, Noodles, and Pork Belly. Army stew was good, but it didn't blow my mind. Chapguri was good. The prom belly was the star of the show. I was a happy camper!
No comment

Busting restaurant that serves unique Korean dishes! We got the cod roe seafood udon and wasabi cream fried chicken. Both were extremely tasty...i highly recommend the fried chicken just for the wasabi cream (and I don't usually like wasabi)! It's pretty loud and dark inside, but a great spot nevertheless.
No comment
No comment

Our server was incredibly rude for no reason. Me and a group of friends ate dinner here with one person being vegetarian. We politely asked for one of the dishes to not include the protein and he said they do not accept subsititutions. So, we opted for the corn/cheese pancake but was again rudely told by the server that it was not vegetarian friendly - it has "meat powder" on it. We asked if there was anything vegetarian friendly and the server just scoffed and told us that there was nothing on the menu. The only saving grace was the manager because he saw how upset we were and he kindly helped with our situation by making an exception to not include meat with their rose pasta dish. Overall, the food items were good and I am very grateful to the manager. I will not be returning to this place or recommend it to any of my friends. I hope that they train their staff to be better.

This place used to be so popular few years back. Somehow it wasn't busy when we passed by so we went with some memories. They cut down manus that I used to love so it became somehow very limited for me. We ordered the Makgeolli with chestnut but it doesn't taste neither Makgeolli or the chestnut so we ordered the banana Makgeolli, that was great. Foods that we order was great except the rice balls with spam. The staffs were nice and friendly
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was great for Korean late night snacks and it's located in Korea. I've been wanting to try some Korean small snack so came here. The service was quick. Had dinner on Saturday night. It wasn't too crowded so we got a seat right away. We ordered crispy corn pancake and Pork Belly Rice Crepe Wraps. Pork Belly Rice Crepe Wraps was quite unique and portion was quite good. Pork belly's meat and fat ratio were good so it's juicy. I will recommend to all of my friends and come back when I have chance.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has been on my list for THE LONGEST TIME. I've heard so many good things and I've also been to the place next door quite a few times. This was AMAZING. I came here with a group of 5 people and we ordered the Chapaguri, braised pork belly (I think?), Tiger udon, and some of the makgeolli. Everything tasted amazing. I can't pick a favorite because everything tasted so good in its own right. The makgeolli tasted so good/refreshing, kind of like a sweet slushee with the rice wine flavor. Amazing food, good service. I will definitely be coming back and recommending to others!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The roe omelette was a show stopper. It was unbelievably delicious. The whole table loved it. The corn pancake and squid fried rice was always very delicious. Really good experience.
No comment

No comment
One of the favorite bars/restaurants in the city now! The injeolmi pork belly is absolute fire. Also their drinks were v refreshing and not too sweet!! (a bit strong actually)
No comment
No comment

Spontaneously went on Halloween for dinner and we got a selection of the menu. A bit pricey considering the portion size but overall everything was really good. They also offer complimentary tteokboki! Recommend if you're in the area but be ready that they do have a limited selection.
No comment

This place has such nice ambient and pretty good food!! We liked everything we got and appreciate the complimentary rice cakes. Another review said that the squid in the squid fried rice tasted like the Asian dried squid snack and that is so spot on. It was really good on the first bite but started getting a little sweet near the end. The spam and mayo rice balls were good especially dipped in the rice cake sauce! Also would recommend the pork belly!

Pretty good place for drinks and food. I would def. recommend the chapaguri with beef and this delicious rice crepe pork belly dish!! Its my favorite here- the rice crepe on top tastes like mochi and its delicious wrapped around the meat. The drinks here are pretty good but can be pricey.

I've wanted to come here for a while now and was absolutely blown away by how amazing their food is. Highly recommend their seafood udon. Their peach soju is also delicious - it tastes like peach candy and doesn't have that medicine-y after taste like your typical flavored bottled soju. Def returning!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Friendly staff, attentive, modern yet traditional vibe, and good food. Stew is perfect for wintertime (1-2 person) to share and the rolled omelette was very unique. Would recommend trying it out!!

Great service and atmosphere. Everyone greets you when you walk in the door to make you feel welcome. it was crowded on a Thursday night after work and we got a table in the back alcove that only has 2 tables. Was nice to have the privacy and still our servers were checking on us to make sure we had everything we needed. The small plate korean bar food was perfect to share - we ordered a bunch. Standouts were the octopus fried rice which was a little stinky but had a rich, umami taste. The garlic spicy chicken bites were addictive. And the dukbokki was just the right amount of spicy. Great place!
No comment

No comment
No comment

I was compelled to go to Take31 for their interesting pseudo-fusion menu. The menu, and the actual dishes, lived up to expectations but I was taken aback by the awful service. I reached the restaurant at 10 pm. My friend and I ordered a beer, a specialty drink, and an entree. In 20 minutes, our entire order was on our table. And in 50 minutes, we were told that the table needs to be cleared to accommodate another reservation. Within in an hour, we were forced to gobble up our food and exit the premises for a 'reservation,' of which we did not see a single person outside. I was flabbergasted by how this restaurant treats its customers and hope they change their ways.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my super good friends kept telling me to come here because the food is really good. I'm super glad I came here because I wanted to order everything off the menu when I saw it. The food I had tasted really good, definitely on the heavier side and a tiny bit salty. The space is cute and dim lit so had to use a flashlight to get nice exposure on the pics.
No comment

I was excited to try Take31 after always going to Her Name is Han. I have to come pack again with more than just two people as the portions are huge! A bit more casual of a place but still delicious food none the less.
Good food. Went here for dinner before getting drinks. The chicken and squid rice was really good! Also the makgeolli tasted like a smoothie. We got the white peach. Great experience!
No comment
No comment
No comment

THIS WAS GOOD!! I personally love makkeoli, and they had so many good flavors. I have tried countless makkeolis in South Korea and even in the U.S., and yes this place is GOOD. We ordered only one type of dish - the bossam - BUT IT WAS SO GOOD AS WELL. And yes, again, I've tried countless bossams. This one is covered in rice cake and injulmi, which I've never tried before, but they nailed that combination. Vibes inside are dark and cute too, and it isn't too loud. Go with friends you want to enjoy good food & conversation with :)
No comment

Came on a friday night and had a reservation however it didn't look like I really needed it. I ordered the buttered squid fried rice and the prime short rib chapaguri. The buttered squid fried rice was super good and would totally recommend it! However the chapaguri was nothing to write home about. They also hand out complementary tteokbokki which was very enjoyable.

No comment
It was pretty decent for a korean spot, probably best after a night of drinks when everyones hungry bc they give ddeokbeokki on the house and it tastes pretty good.
Love the drinks here. They're pretty strong without tasting like alcohol. The food is pretty good as well. Good luck getting into this place for a weekend dinner if you don't have a reservation.
No comment

Interesting and modern take on Korean pub cuisine. Everything we ordered was delicious.  We also got the peach makgeolli which comes as a slushee. The pork belly rice cake wrap was very interesting. A little getting used to but pretty good if you enjoy injeolmi. Overall nice aesthetics and great experience!

I prefer Take31 over its sister restaurant Her Name is Han! My friends and I ordered the seafood hot pot, the pork wrapped in rice crepes, and chicken. I also got a soju cocktail and it was delicious. Overall great food and a creative menu. I see they're doing Squid Game inspired items and I love seeing that creativity.

Got the yogurt makgeolli, braised pork belly, cream udon, and scallion pancake (food came out in that order). Ddukbokki (spicy rice cake) came as service/banchan/appetizer. Everything was good and was a fan of the pork belly. It came with a sweet-spicy gochujang marinade on top of scallions and white kimchi. Would come again - especially for their makgeolli cocktails!
No comment
No wireless signal inside, and the restaurant doesn't provide wifi. Not recommended. Everything else is fine.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! The cod roe omelette was my absolute favorite. The egg was soo soft it almost felt like I was eating steamed egg. Still thinking about the omelette as of right now! The scallions and white kimchi came with the pork belly dish and complemented pork belly super well. Would 10/10 recommend!

The best Korean food I've had! Super flavorful and quality dishes. All of them were equally good. Staff was friendly and attentive. Clean spot even the outdoor seating was nice. Highly recommend the chicken and soup! Their soju was good too!
Always solid, soul Korean food. Chill vibes. Like a hidden gem, typically no line for a seating. I pushed off this review for a while because I wanted to keep this place my secret.
No comment
Great food, great atmosphere! The staff was friendly and gave us some recommendation of things to try and her recommendations did not disappoint. Try the Rolled-up Cod Roe Omelet!!

This is a pretty solid spot for some late night eats and drinks if you're looking for something in ktown. It's pretty good and I'd recommend to anyone!
Came here and got a bowl with the Korean army special I think it was? Can't remember too too good on account of the pitcher of beer. The crowd here skews younger so you'll see plenty of Soju

Cute and cozy restaurant in koreatown. They have lots of fusion korean including their cod roe seafood udon and short rib chapaguri, but also a lot of traditional korean dishes with a twist. Their food is comfortable and consistent. It's a spot that I take my friends to a lot bc I know it'll be a good meal. For drinks, I particularly like the flavored makgeolli that they make. They also have slushy soju which I haven't tried yet.

Came here after a busy day with a couple friends, and although it was honestly overpriced, the food was fantastic! The prime rib chapaguri really felt like a homemade dish, and the Mayo/Spam Rice Balls were amazing and very filling!

Really enjoyed the Crispy Corn Pancake. Love the crisp and sweetness of the corn. The Prime Short Rib Chapaguri is really good too, although the prime ribs was a little too sweet for my taste. The Pork Belly Rice Crepe Wraps were good as well but I would not recommend getting it if you're not super hungry. It's super fatty and very easy to get tired of. I do wish they also gave more radish on the side, it really helps with eating the pork belly. The restaurant has really nice ambiance too, it's loud but the sound somewhat drowns into the background so you can still hear yourself talking to other people. The staff are also super nice and helpful!

First off get the pork belly. It's incredible! Soft tasty great flavor. Also get their homemade Korean cocktails! We got a pitcher of the white peach flavor and if it wasn't a weekday I would have gotten another for me and my friends! This place has a line so I recommend getting reservations!

Cozy little space, The food is tasty generally speaking. We ordered the corn pancake, I'm a sweet tooth, but this is too sweet to me. It should maintain iit's original flavor from my view. I suggest cutdown some sugar may raise the sale. The hot soup is spicy but flavorful, Hard to resist to keep drinking it. Creamy noodle is the spotlight!

Ordered for delivery via Uber Eats. The spicy garlic chicken was very, very good. A lot of flavor and extremely crispy which you expect from Korean style. My wife really enjoyed the bulgogi fried rice also.

This place was soo delicious! Make sure to make a reservation or come early if you want a seat. They are so busy all the time and it is very hard to get a seat at the restaurant especially at busy hours! We tried their Spicy Soft Tofu Stew, Short Rib Chapaguri, and corn Pajun. They were all so delicious. The flavors blended very well. The short rib was perfectly cooked! They also gave us an unlimited side of spicy rice cakes which were perfectly cooked and so bouncy! I would definitely come here again!

You need to get the corn pancake and the braised pork belly! The pork belly melts in your mouth and is paired perfectly with the refreshing green onion. The corn pancake is crispy and sweet. The spicy rice cakes are also on the house. Everything is so delicious but definitely priced on the higher end. I would have loved to try the udon but they ran out when we arrived. Definitely give this place a try!

Ok value. The pork belly with rice wraps were very crispy and would recommend to pork belly lovers. Rice balls were filling. Seafood pancakes were super crispy as well. Good for pictures too. I do think the seasoning can use a bit improvement but overall it's a good spot to come with friends. Doubt that I'll have cravings tho.

3.5 stars. I have mixed feelings about this place. Based on my last visit, I would say the place is eh, although probably largely influenced by the dishes we picked. I really only liked the rice wine (quite good actually) and bulgogi black garlic fried rice. The pork belly and corn pancake were sweet, which I'm not a huge fan of. The food quality is decent though so maybe would give it a second go and try different dishes. Highlight of this place is that they give free unlimited rice cakes as the starter.

I've been here at least 5 times now haha, the food is amazing and the service is always insanely fast. All the employees are super nice and chill, great place to stop by for a bite or drink late at night!!

The food was outstanding! I ordered the braised pork belly and beef bulgogi fried rice. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.
No comment
Really good short ribs and seafood udon! I highly recommend this place next time you're near midtown Manhattan.

Best Korean restaurant I've been to this summer! Everything was priced reasonably; just the same as other restaurants near k-town. I've been trying to find one I can come back to because I always want to try things once. Definitely coming back here again!

Good stuff. Shared with a friend so price was affordable. Unlimited rice cakes (!!) that I couldn't take advantage of because I was stuffed  the canned pear drink was pulpy and very good. Small but good.

Everytime I'm in New York City, I have to stop by! It is one of the best Korean food places I've indulged in. I haven't had anything I have not enjoyed. They have a great variety of options and the ambiance continues to add value.
No comment
No comment

I definitely wasn't expecting a ton from this small gastropub in k-town, but man was I blown away. The ambiance is great--very different from other Korean restaurants I've been to. Loved that we got tteobokki and fish cakes to start off with, I believe it's complimentary for parties of 3+. We got the garlic crusts&spicy chicken, short rib chapaguri, and bulgolgi black garlic fried rice to split. The spicy chicken was quite possibly the best fried chicken I've ever had. It was the perfect mix of sweet and spicy, and had a great breading. The chapaguri and fried rice were also amazing, and the meat was seasoned really well. I was pleasantly surprised by this spot, and definitely going to be coming back.
What a delicious meal! Loved the personal ordering and the fast service. Black bean short rib noodles...yum! Rice balls with spam! Fantastic!
No comment
No comment
It's pretty good. Instead of  traditional Korean food, it is more like fusion, such like an American Korean food. Loved it but their menu doesn't have many options.
No comment

This spot is right next to our hotel so we had to try it. They had both indoors and outdoors seating in a great way for lighting and heaters if needed. The service was good and it is a easy process. The food was great our garlic fried rice needed a bit more salt but the chicken we had was delicious for $25 I do think it should come with something else with it but the portions are great. I would recommend coming here for the chicken alone.
Great injeolmi pork belly, and although I didn't get it this time, it would've gone great with one of their flavored rice wines. Kimchi cold noodle was average but it was still good.
No comment

Went in starving and proceeded to order a bunch (probably too much for two people). First of all the makgeolli was amazing, and the tteokbokki banchan was so good that we asked for a second serving lol. We started with the spicy bulgogi fries - came with a lot of meat and mayo on top. The short rib chapaguri was what I was most excited for and it turned out super good. It may look really dark but not overly salty at all. It has a great black bean flavor with a touch of spice, and a lot of short ribs. The spicy tofu soup was good too, especially on a cold evening. A lot of tofu and meat as always but wished there was more vegetable and kimchi. Overall a highly satisfying meal and would definitely came back again to try other dishes.
One of my favorite ktown restaurants when I visit NYC. I love literally every single dish they have. The makgeoli is also so delicious and they have so many flavors!

The portions are a lot smaller than I thought but enough for my mom and I. Really liked the seafood udon while the pork belly could be a little sweeter. The dalgona tiramisu was average and is not worth $9. Service was good. Overall 7/10
No comment

Take31 had such amazing food! The Tteokbokki was one of the best side dishes I've ever had in a restaurant, and the entrees we got were so so so delicious! We ordered the Braised Pork Belly, which was so soft and fatty! We also got the Cod Roe Seafood Udon which was really on point, and to top it off we got Wasabi Cream Chicken to pair with the yogurt Makgeolli. Would order everything again!!
One of the best restaurants I've been to in NYC. Really like the udon noodles, pork, and eggs.

Take31 is one of my favorite restaurants in nyc ktown! The servers are kind and their service is quick and great. I also love that they serve a small plate of ddukbokki as a side dish! One thing I always order here is the braised pork belly - its slightly different from the traditional style but oh my tastes so good - the meat is tender and chewy and the scallion/cabbage go very well with it. As appetizer we got the rose cream bento pasta which is so delicious - you gotta try it and the fact it's in a bento box makes it look more like a comfort food. We usually order the army stew (budaejjigae) which is pretty good, but this time tried out the pork belly rice crepe wraps - it's more sweet with the drizzled sauce that def tastes more like injeolmi (Korean rice cake). However the meat tasted a bit too hard to bite through and we got tired of the sweet taste, even with the pickles. That being said, the food has been consistently great the many times I've been so I don't dock off any star. Make sure to get a resy because the wait during peak hours for walk-ins is at least 30 minutes for two ppl.

A little pricey but easily one of the best restaurants I've been to in NYC. All the dishes we got were amazing: the soondubu soft tofu stew, fried chicken, braised pork belly, short rib chapagetti, and corn pancake (probably in that order for me). Also their flavored makgeolli is delicious and a perfect pairing on a hot day.

Pretty much every dish here is very delicious. The braised pork belly is a must try. Also strongly recommend seafood cream pasta and short rib.

Excellent food and convenient location.  I will definitely come back for different menu items.

Amazing service and very thoughtful servers. The food is great, especially the tofu stew and the wasabi fried chicken!! Honestly everything was great and portion sizes were good as well.

I have never had a better meal so fast and courteous. We had just arrived in nyc hungry and tired. Hotel restaurant closed. This 2 blocks away. As I lay here waiting for sleep, I know a better choice could not be made

I love this place. You get complimentary tteokbokki to start and it's the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. I love their makgeoli (chestnut, peach, yogurt are all so good) with the spicy fried chicken. The chicken has a ton of fried garlic on top which makes it extra delicious. Their house made slushy soju and soups are also so good. Great place to go with friends to share food and drinks
On 2nd visit got the pork belly crepe again because it's so iconic, and the black garlic oil bulgogi fried rice which was incredible, this place never disappoints.

the staff was nice and the food was good. It's what you expect from Korean street food restaurant.
Good spot for Korean food. Loved the corn pancake and the chapaghetti. But expensive though

The foot was incredible and the staff was very nice. We ordered a few dishes for the table - the pork belly, corn pancake and Bulgogi Black Garlic Fried Rice were my favorites. The drinks were also delicious.

Don't really understand the hype around this place. It was kind of mid. Everything was really sweet for some reason, which made me a little nauseous after.

I believe the very first thing called my attention about the place was the chill and minimalist decor the place has going on. It's a very relaxing environment! And the service is outstanding, very attentive and mindful of their costumers which I loved very much. The food is outstanding so if you're thinking about making a reservation anytime soon please do so! You will not regret it, wether you go with friends or alone :))
Hard to get seating but if you can the seafood udon is my favorite. The soups are nothing to crazy but everything else is super good

Restaurant was packed on a Saturday night. Best to make a reservation if possible. Place was dark and loud, as you should expect from a gastropub. Ordered their Omaha Short Rib Chapaguri and Pork Belly Rice Crepe Wraps. The chapaguri was the best I've tasted so far. Wanna try their Makgulli next time.

Went to Take31 for dinner and it was great, very nice vibes and the beef tasted so good!. Also ordered the army stew and was more than enough. I do not recommend sitting anywhere in the back there is NO internet/data. Tried to scan the menu on the phone, but there was not internet to do so.

my god why was this one of the best meals i've ever had. the pork belly literally melted in my mouth, and it was sweet too! the rice crepe around it added to that sweetness and added some texture as well, really really loved this dish. the prime short rib chapaguri was also fantastic! there was so much flavor to this dish and the meat was so so tender and also melted in my mouth. i had been meaning to try this for so long given that i had seen this on so many shows and it did not disappoint. also be sure to make a reservation here, they don't take reservations for more than parties of 4 though i believe. her name is han is right next door and i've heard rly good things about that one too so also want to try that restaurant as well:)
Delicious beef chucks sauteed with Ramen noodles like the one from parasite. I'd go back soon once covid is over!

We ordered three dishes. The first one is so good that we cried out, and each dish is better than the last one. it is so amazing. definitely gonna come back and try everything on the menu.

Ordered take out. Budae chigae and fried chicken and  spam masubi. All delicious. I highly recommend the food here. Satisfying comfort foods. Nice portions.

The cod roe udon was creamy and had a decent amount of clams and squid. The sauce is slightly sweet and not too heavy. The corn pancake was so good, we ordered a second one. It's the perfect amount of crispy and reminds me of Mexican elote. The rice crepe pork belly was tender and I loved the flavor, although I was confused by the multigrain powder. I definitely recommend these three dishes if you end up going. We also ordered the budae jjigae, which I tend to prefer homemade but this one was pretty solid. I don't really like the taste of alcohol, so the sweet potato makgeolli and peach soju were ok for me. The soju came in a cute bottle with a couple slices of peach on the bottom. Not sure when I'll be going back since the prices are a little high for me, but dreaming of the corn pancake until then.

The spot offers outdoor box which makes us feel very safe during Covid-19 time. The food taste really good, authentic Korean style! Definitely will come back next time.

It was a great experience! The day was really cold, but their heat lamps were strong and the booths felt cozy. We ordered their army stew and fried chicken, received rice cakes as a complimentary app. It was very filling for two people. Service was just slightly delayed because it is outdoor dining and it was cold that day. I definitely would go back!

One of the best restaurants in ktown. the galbi is very juicy and in my opinion is the best thing on the menu.
Delicious! Big portions which were enough to go family style. They were able to sit us early and were very helpful. Great food and drinks as well! And covid-19 friendly

Came here for a late lunch on a friday. The outdoor space was closed, but my friend and I were able to get a seat indoors. They have good separation between the tables if you are concerned with being too close to the party next to you. We tried the seafood and scallion pancake, the garlic fried rice, and the wasabi cream chicken. The pancake was flavored nicely, but it was more like a scallion pancake than what I expected. it was deep fried strongly and it had an oil residue. I really liked the garlic fried rice since the garlic flavoring was really pronounced. Finally the chicken, I thought it the flavor profile really worked, but it was overly fried and felt like I was eating a lot of breading. Overall, the meal was fine, but wished I tried food that wasn't overly fried. Next time I guess.

Unbelievable food and service! I've had the good fortune to try quite of bit of Korean food in my lifetime. The food at Take31 is like eating the best Seoul street food in a very cozy, beautiful spot. I highly recommended to try anything and everything on their menu. One absolute must is their Pork Belly Rice Crepe Wraps. Succulent pork belly encased in this crops between mochi and Chinese dim sum rice noodles. Sweet, savory, porky.... Wow!!!! Stellar. Service is outstanding. If you're in NYC- go!

I came here with two friends for dinner at 6PM on a Tuesday night. We didn't have to wait and after we ordered, we were given spicy fishcakes + rice cakes. We decided to order a few dishes to share and chose their braised pig's feet, kunpao galbi, garlic crusts & spicy crusty chicken, and scallion pancakes. We also ordered 4 bowls of rice for this meal. I was very happy to find that all of the meat dishes were delicious. They were around $20 a dish, but well worth the price. Although they're all great, I definitely love their chicken the most.

My favorite Korean bar food joint. Bo Saam, Fried Chicken, and the Roe Omelet are my go-tos. Almost everything else I've gotten here has been great. Don't come here if you're on a diet!

Honestly, one of my favorite Korean restaurant in the area! They give you some free spicy rice cake as an appetizer and its actually pretty delicious! The braised pork belly and pork belly rice crepe wrap are my absolute two favorites. The pork in both dishes are super tender and flavorful. The cod roe seafood udon is pretty amazing as well. You get a lot of food for the price, and it is all very filling. Love this more "modern" take on Korean food!

Phenomenal food! What a beautiful experience! I recommend the seafood udon - absolutely unique dish

What an eating experience! When this place first opened, lines were around the block and I totally buy into the hype! The food was simply excellent and the service was outstanding. This is a great comfort food spot and the dishes are a little heavy, but pairs so well with chamisul! The spam with the rice balls are easily my favorite, I can see why it comes highly recommended. The steel was cheesy and peppery, a real win! Great spot for dates or catching up with a friend. I want to try the brunch, will report back when I do!

Came here for dinner, really enjoyed their little dishes, ordered a hotpot and some other little dishes. Will recommend. Try their corn cake. Was really good.

Wow. Came here as a recommendation from a friend who lived in New York for a bit and it did not disappoint. Take 31 experimented with their Korean Fusion cooking and mastered it successfully. I enjoyed the injeolmi pork and the creamy seafood udon the most. I always recommend this place to any friend going to New York.

I'm honestly so happy I found this place randomly as I was scrolling through Yelp. My friends and I were looking for a place to eat near korean town, and I saw that this place has really good reviews and decided to make a reservation. Two of my favorite dishes were definitely the pork belly and the cod roe seafood udon. Wow. The pork belly was so flavorful and it's a big portion to share. The udon is more on the smaller portion side but IT'S SOOO yummy. It's really flavorful and you just want to keep eating it!! We got peach and raspberry lychee cocktails (they're pretty strong but only 11oz so I'd suggest to share with friends and try other flavors too). Overall, I was so satisfied with this place and would come back again.

This place felt hip. Simple as that. Their bossam was really delicious, so melt in your mouth, and their kimchi jjigae was soooooo clean tasting. There was no greasy feeling from any of the food and the interior was young, cool, and really trendy. I really enjoyed this place and would definitely come again.

Uh, no.. the place is overrated. Interesting and trendy menu items collaborating amercan and korean cuisines but they don't taste as good as they look in pictures on their menu.. everything lacks deep flavors and taste like it's quickly made. It is presented in nice plates though. The best thing I'd say is the free side of ttuk bok yi which is spicy rice cakes.. and even that's overly sweet. Drinks and food are so over priced. I've had the similar quality of korean food at take out shops for a lot cheaper. Ambience is nice though and cutely decorated with asian flare. However, it gets loud in there and filled with young kids.

I love love love this place!!! Food is amazing!!!! I go here every year when I'm in NYC. I'm so happy they are still here and ALWAYS recommend my friends to go check this place out. A bit of a smaller restaurant with cramped seating but the food was really good. Came here on a Saturday around 8pm without a reservation and were seated within 30 minutes. A bit odd they didn't have the typical Korean beers (OB/Hite/Cass) so we settled on Asahi. We ordered the corn tempura, pigs feet (on the special menu), and the pork bone stew. Everything was really good and it was plenty of food for two people, ended up with leftovers. Great spot for a dinner with friends.

My absolute favorite spot in the ktown area!! I've been coming here since around 2015 and have been coming here ever since. The cod roe seafood cream udon is a must and I love the braised pork belly as well. The udon is so creamy and has the perfect amount of seafood flavor!! I tried the pork belly crepe thing with soybean powder recently, which was still good but it definitely comes in second to the braised pork. The makkeoli and soju cocktails are so good as well. The lychee and the yogurt soju and the chestnut makkeoli are definitely the best. The lychee has little bits of real lychee blended in and it's also really icy and delicious. The chestnut makkeoli is so creamy and almost feels like you're drinking a milkshake. I love this place!! 10/10 would recommend.
The food was outstanding, really like the udon there. However, the service was a little odd, the waitress did not understand what we meant and just poured away our sake without giving back a new one.

Came here last Thursday night with a friend around 630 and there were still plenty of seats. The ambiance was very cozy and warm. We ordered the cod roe udon which was creamy and delicious. Also ordered the corn pancake and the army stew, which I had for the first time. I learned the recipe was created after the Korean War when food was scarce and locals had to make a meal from surplus foods from army bases (hence the spam, hotdogs, American cheese, etc). I didn't think I'd like it at first but the tanginess of the kimchi really cuts through the fat in the spam and balances out the dish. Great service as well, would definitely come back again!

Pork belly was amazing! The wait for 2 was about 40 minutes but theres things to do around the neighborhood until they message you. Service was overall great. Loud atmosphere but you can't expect any less from a place providing soju!

Got here before 7pm and was able to be seated right away for a table of two. We ordered the corn pancake which was pretty awesome. It is sweet so bear this in mind if you are not a fan of sweet stuff. Also ordered the army soup and bulgogi jap chae. All this was plenty for myself and my friend. Tip: phone reception is very poor if you are seated at the back but there is a sketchy TWC WiFi you can jump on.

Used to be one of my fave restaurants. Loved their seafood noodle dish, which is no longer on the menu. You get a free rice cake appetizer and can order an unlimited amount. (Soooo delicious). But the menu isnt good as I remember. The size of their soja has reduced by 75%. You used to be able to get a large pitcher for $15 and now you get a mini size bottle for the same price. I'd possibly return for the food but wouldn't get any alcohol.

This place is worth the wait!! My favorite thing was the creamy seafood udon - just yummmm. The sauce is what makes it and the shrimp was really good. The other seafood was just whatever to me. The honey butter chicken also a great sharing app, and the pork bossam was unctuous and delicious. The kalbi dish was good but mostly because I was surprised by how amazing the fried cauliflower and other veggies in the dish were! They had the best tempura like batter and drenched in a sweet soy concoction that made it addicting. I'd order any of those things again.

Best Korean fried chicken and pork belly with rice wrap in Manhattan, must have a try!

Pretty good! But average. Really friendly staff. Cool enough space. But the food was a little steep in price and average in taste. For example, my mayo kimchi was sort of bad, but maybe I ordered poorly. My fried popcorn chicken dish was good. My friends jumbalaya was pretty creative, but small portion and all rice. And the drinks were too sweet. But a really pleasant place, not too crowded, casual, especially for ktown.

One of my favorite spots to go to for korean food but the portion is really small for its price. The food is good overall and the pork belly dish is a must! You will not be disappointed.
Love this restaurant must visit. They great food and service.  Must try one of their hot pots.

Most people hit up Take31 for drinks, but the food here is pretty damn good as well. The appetizers, meat plates, and casseroles are all delicious. Waits are to be expected, but you'll be able to satisfy both the food and alcohol cravings in one go.

Friend recommended this place in Ktown for our quarterly hangout dinner, and I hadn't heard of it before so I was super down to try it. We went to dinner ~6:30 pm on a weekday night, and were seated immediately to both of our surprise (the restaurant was full). It's kind of weirdly situated in that it's a really long and narrow restaurant, with kitchens both in the center and in the back and seating in the front and in the mid back. We were seated right next to the center kitchen in the back portion, so it was fun seeing them make drinks and watch the large pan of dukbokki swimming in Korean hot sauce. We got a beef hotpot of sorts, a seafood kimchi pancake, as well as a pineapple vodka drink to share between the two of us. The drink was delicious, and so pretty! I have a thing against paper straws because I drink slowly and it disintegrates fast, so that was annoying. But the drink is super cute and super good too, you can't even taste the alcohol! The food came out maybe 15 minutes later, and we were both impressed with both foods. The hotpot is good, not as extravagant as its sister restaurant Her Name is Han next door, but still good nonetheless. The seafood pancake was good too, with delicious dipping sauce (soysauce/sesame oil? a mix of the two?). It came out to be ~$50 for the both of us, which was totally fine because we left stuffed and with leftovers to boot. I think I like Her Name is Han better just because of the actual restaurant and how cute it is, but I would be totally for coming back to Take31 if Her Name is Han was too busy or I were looking to eat in Ktown, but slightly off Ktown

Came here looking for some good korean food and let me just say that i was not disappointed.  The wait was over an hour so i ended up just walking around ktown for some dessert and looked around. The atmosphere is there was really nice and quite comfy and cozy. The food was great, there was a lot of good food to pick from so i asked for a recommendation from a waiter and they the recommended the budae jjigae. I also just had to try the fried chicken since after all thats why i came here. This was a bit on the pricier side but this was all worth it, the experience, the great food, i honestly would come again.

Came here last year for New Years so was excited to come back--we got the creamy kimchi jiggae and the pork belly wrapped in injeolmi. Both were SO good, our pork belly took awhile to come out but our server was so nice about it and kept apologizing. Didn't disappoint again.
we're waiting for 1 hour front the door，and we didn't receive any call，but the lady told us we missed this number，it's rediculas. this store's service is very very bad！！！！！

So good!! Started with the soju coffee shake and the matcha bomb drinks, which were SO good. Love Korean cafes and this was one of the best drinks I've had in general. The food was great too. My friends and I got the seafood pancake, garlic crispy chicken (yum!!), and creamy kimchi hot pot. They textures were all so good, crispy pancake + chicken and the delicious creamy broth. I loved the little bits of fun fusion aspects of the dishes, like cheese in the creamy broth or the crispy "nooroongji" that looked like rice crispies on the soup. The prices are I guess average for NY! I'd highly recommend, and will definitely try to come back

I loved it. Everything was good. A lot of food options. So delicious. It's better to have a reservation tho bc place gets super busy. Drinks however were ok. That's the only reason I'm leaving 4 stars.

Came on a Sunday afternoon and was surprised we got seated right away! Our little table area was all the way in the back and very cozy... Though I was pretty confused by the computer hardware decoration. Anyone know how that deco fit in? Anyways the server was really kind and answered our questions, was pretty prompt and had pretty good timing when it came to checking in on us. We ordered one of the Korean stews, the seafood pancake, and Korean jambalaya. The stew was probably my favorite! It had a good kick to it was filled with never ending noodles, meat, vegetables, tofu, mushrooms etc. Super filling and warm for a fall day. The Korean pancake came out surprisingly thick but it was filled with seafood variety. A little bit on the oily side but not too bad. As for the Korean jambalaya - idk it was okay. Reminded me of a fried rice more than a jambalaya

Unfortunately I don't have good pictures for this place because it's too dark at night. But the food here is absolutely fantastic. It's a typical Korean bbq and bar. It opens till late night and it's good for a late night snack plus drinks. I like it here because they don't over-flavor their food, which could happens to a lot of Korean bbq place. It's busy at night so be prepared to get in line for about 20 minutes.

I was very impressed at this restaurant for the service as well as the food. It's definitely up solid Korean food with a mixture of familiar dishes and more innovative ones. The BBQ soup and noodle options won't disappoint. I will go back.

DELICIOUS!!! Bossam here is fatty and amazing. Had the soondubu-budae-jjigae which was incredible. What an explosion of flavor. This is the level of deliciousness that I expect of NYC.

My go-to place for bomb ass korean bar food and drinks! I have frequent cravings for their seafood udon cream pasta, and also highly recommend the bossam/braised pork belly. I've had a rice cake covered pork belly dish and a chicken wing dish with almonds or nuts sprinkled on top, and those were the only two things I didn't think met up to their normal standards. If you don't want to wait over half an hour I'd recommend trying for the weekdays or getting their as soon as it opens around 5:30 -6. If you get there after 7 on a weekend, the wait is insane. P.S. they also give free spicy rice cake dish

I was unhappy with my food and did not eat anything the manager did not bother to come over and told his server that there's nothing they can do about it and charged me $35 for food I did not eat and I did not like.  The garlic fried rice was mushy and the seafood scallion pancakes were also mushy. My dishes were poorly prepared. It was a waste of my time and a waste of my money now I need to go somewhere else to feed me and my growing baby.

One of my favorite restaurants in NYC as of now - forgot to take more photos, but we also got the spicy Korean fried chicken and short ribs. All four dishes we got were REALLLY good. No complaints, service was fast too. They don't take reservations, but we arrived at 6:15 and managed to get a table without having to wait, but by 7pm there was a really long line - definitely get here early on weekends!

Came for some food and drinks late one night. Got half garlic and half Kung pao chicken. The pieces were aggressively large and awkwardly shaped. It was a little hard to eat but the sauces were okay. The garlic one was overpowering but the kung pao was good. Also got the octopus and rice balls dish which was alright but definitely had better. For all the food options you have in ktown, there are definitely wayy better alternatives. Also got the lychee soju but had way too much ice particles which I get you're supposed to separate with the Popsicle stick but still found it too cold. Overall cute space with mediocre fare. I much rather go elsewhere.

We were looking for a last minute spot and this place did not disappoint! The cocktails were just what we needed: sweet and enjoyable. The garlic chicken and scallion pancake were delightfully YUMMY. Also, whoever conjured up that wasabi cloud that goes with the chicken is genius. I could eat that in spoons.

Honestly, I do like their food. But considering the fact that they don't take reservation, and we came and were told the wait time was 30-40min (which they nearly told everyone that), we ended up waiting for over an hour. After sitting down the server came like 15min later. Fortunately the food didn't come too late. So basically started waiting around 6:40 and finally got to eat around 8:30. Not to say it's bad that place is so popular, I would expect the front person to give me a better estimate. I will choose somewhere else if I know I am gonna wait that long cause it's cold outside and I am never a person who's willing to wait for food over an hour, for any restaurant. If keeping customer waiting way beyond how long they are told to is their strategy, I would say it's a bad one cause I won't be willing to come back. Reason why I still give three stars are because of their decent food. Got the corn pancake, garlic chicken and rice cake pork wrap along with beer they were all very good.
My favorite korean restaurants! Great service and very good food. We got desserts on the house when the pig feet we ordered took a little longer to arrive. Would definitely want to go back again!

Must try their ramen noodles and pork belly! Alcohol drinks are pretty good. Come before 6:30 to avoid the lines.

I came again twice during the weekend & I absolutely love the white paper sets & the music is phenomenal during the weekend. It is not too love as it was during the week. The atmosphere is amazing, dimed light as well as the customer service is amazing during the weekend!!

This is the second time I've been here. The first time we ordered the bossam, which is one of the best I've had in awhile. This time we were craving something soup-y on a rainy day and so we ordered the Nagasaki. It's a spicy, white seafood stew, which at first glance doesn't look as if it can't be spicy but it does have a bit of kick to it, though I would've liked more. It was also a tad bit salty and the flame underneath didn't last that long--I wish it would've stayed hot for longer. We also ordered the fried stuffed peppers, which were okay, but I had hoped the ground meat would have kept together better. We also ordered the crispy chicken with wasabi dip. The chicken wasn't crispy and the wasabi taste was a bit faint. The complimentary ddukkbokkk was nice. My biggest issue was with the service--it took forever for anyone to even come to our table to begin with and they forgot one of our drinks and were kind of hard to get ahold of. I would come again but I hope the service gets better!

Was here for lunch, looked it up on Yelp before coming here.  Everyone had a picture of this dish call seafood creamy udon, it made it so tempting to try.  So here I am trying out their seafood creamy udon, it is SO GOOD!  It taste so homey and delicious, the sauce taste just right, definitely will comeback again..!!
Wasabi chicken and seafood udon were sooo good. I recommend the green tea honey butter cake for dessert.

The wait to get a table is long! And the place is tiny, so think it twice if you're coming with a large group of friends, if you get in try the Pork Belly!

Compact, busy, hectic. New York is a 'sardinized' city. Meaning, I can't help but feeling like a sardine in a city wide can. This place is filled to the brim, using every inch of its space to satisfy the needs of mostly college and high school kids. Cheap, fast, easy and delicious. Yes, corners were cut but it's expected. Walking the block of K Town was meaningful to say the least. "Shileamneda" (sorry, excuse me) is said a lot. But so is "gamsabnida" (thank you) The reviews are right. Come here and enjoy

Food was amazing! Had the crispy garlic chicken and it was delicious! Huge portions at very reasonable prices. Service could have been better but willing to overlook it due to the great food! Will definitely be back and bring friends!

My friend and I stopped by here for some late night munchies. We ordered peach rice wine, injeolim pork belly, and corn pancake. The food was great, and we had a blast in the cozy restaurant. Just want to say thank you to the friendly waiter who kept refilling our ddoboki!

My boyfriend and I were eager to try a new place and figured to come here last night. We arrived around 8:30 Pm and it was a 20 min wait on a Saturday which wasn't bad at all. It had a lively environment with a very young crowd. We ordered the braised pork belly (we contemplated between the small and large portion) and ordered the large. Which did not disappoint. Honestly, that pork belly alone made this restaurant worthy to be a regular customer. It melted in your mouth and was seasoned to perfection. We also ordered a hot pot for one of those rainy NY days. We got the bone in pork hot pot which was also very tasty. I think this was actually the perfect amount of food if you have a good appetite. The hot pot didn't have too many things in it so it's not super filling but the bone in pork was delightful. I also ordered for dessert, the green tea honey brioche with green tea ice cream. This dessert would've been great if the outside coating of the dessert wasn't pure sugar. It was way too sweet on the outside. If the outside of the brioche was cut out I think it would've made an excellent dessert. All in all, very happy and very good service!

Delicious option in Ktown. The ambience is beautiful (I.e the floating cloud, the artwork, and quotes) and the staff is very helpful. Music is so hip - mostly Korean r&b and even the staff looks very stylish too! Food is great! I ordered the cream udon which is a fave dish of mine wherever it's offered. It's like fettuccine sauce with udon noodles and lots of sea food!! It's just a delicious combination. The bossam is really really good. I would recommend getting the large one bc the mini bossam was too small for me. Like I could probably eat a large one all by myself bc it's so so good haha. I also like their fried chicken with wasabi cream a lot. It's just one block away from 32nd street so it's much chiller - granted there's usually a line in front bc Her name is Han is right next door. Overall, such a satisfying meal and I left very happy ~ thank you!

Where can I start? Best of the best Korean food in the city. I've been there more than 10 times so far. Every single dish kills. You can't get it wrong. My fav so far are the pork belly and egg rolls with fish roes. So good. The staff are friendly. The free dukkboki is delicious. Can't wait to go back!

Always a long wait but worth the wait. Most of their dishes are to share. They're huge! I've gotten the short ribs before and it was my favorite. Their fruit soju is a great addition to the meals! Would come back again.

Had a reservation here last night. Everything was incredible; we had the bossam, fried chicken, budae jjigae, jambalaya, and the corn pancake. We also ordered a jar of the white peach makgeolli, which was so delicious and refreshing in this heat! I'll definitely be back here again soon!

Trying this for the first time and it was good. This place looks like a film kind of restaurant and good customer service.

One of my favorite late night Korean restaurants. I come here quite regularly. Love love love the budae jigae here! It's lighter and soupier than the one that pocha serves because they use less cheese so it really hits the spot on a cold day. As an added plus my boyfriend and I love the dbukki they put in the soup. Their other food is a very delicious Korean take on bar food. This place is a must try! I highly recommend going.

Came here for late night dinner and drinks recently! It's been several times coming here and each time, I'm actually pleasantly surprised by how good the food is. We ordered several things and I can confidently say anything you order here is good. It's weird to say because it seems like in any restaurant, you recommend a few things, but I feel like my friends even say that anything you get here is good. I love the atmosphere as I am a fan of good vibes and music. You would expect that even though it is loud and crowded that service wouldn't be good, but the waiters always check up on you and are there for you when you need them. I came with one friend this time and sat in a two seat, but when I asked to move somewhere else as another friend was coming, the waiters were polite to move us to a different table. Even though the wait is long, I would recommend coming to this place for drinks or food or honestly even both.

Take31 has become my go to restaurant in Koreatown. Yes the staff is friendly, and the restaurant is cute and hip, but it's really about the food. It's a unique take on Korean dishes. Take in to account that I am Korean, and my standards for Korean food might be a little higher, but it's pretty good. Again, it's not perfect, but I always go back to some of these dishes: the corn pancake, the rice cake wrapped pork belly, and if you're a fan of fish roe, the cream udon, it's delicious, with generous amount of seafood.

My favorite Korean restaurant. The clientele is mostly Korean (very good sign). My favorite dish is the mentaiko udon. It's amazing.

The host told me it may take 30 mins to get a table for 3 but we ended uo waiting for 2 hours. I am not sure if I will go back

Great small plates. Good drinks. Atmosphere is a bit dark on the inside, but comfortable. Make sure you ask for the wifi, towards the back there's no service. Only thing that bugged me was the inattentiveness of the waiting staff. However, this was my first time there and first impressions don't always dictate the restaurant as a whole. Come here for some good eats and drinks after work.

Braised pork belly with chestnut makguli  I came here on a Friday night with a friend and we were seated right away! There was a good amount of people but the atmosphere was nice. Not too loud like other korean restaurants. I hate environments where I have to yell at the person sitting across of me to have a conversation. They have a wide range of makgulis but my favorite was the chestnut() makguli. The banana one isn't bad as well but on the sweet side. It's a good place to come with friends if you want a chill night out with good food and drinks.
