The starter rice cake is warm and can be refilled, good start! We ordered the roasted pork feet and budae jidae, both of which are great, will definitely come back to try other dishes!
Their suggested tip amount includes tax. Make sure to calculate the tip on your own. Food is good, not so much about service. Come before 6 to avoid the long line.

Store is cute, waiters/waitress are good looking, food is ok in general, but the taste was not as creative and rich as I expected. I came to know this store from a friend, she said the food was amazing..... well...... it is ok, but not amazing.... and maybe too greasy for me, too many calories....

I came here with my bff to celebrate her belated birthday and it was luckily only half full when I arrived at 6:15PM but the whole place quickly filled up and we didn't realize there was such a big queue outside until we left. This place is cute and bigger inside than I thought. The waiter was really nice in helping us narrow down what to get since we almost over ordered though I do wish we did get to try the corn pancake too in hindsight. We started off with their complimentary spicy rice cakes that we could have refilled but didn't and shared their spam musubi rice balls, cod roe seafood udon, and rice crepe pork belly dishes. Everything was good with the spam being our favorite dish but the pork belly was a bit dry since it was mostly lean meat so I do wish we tried the braised pork belly instead though the rice crepe wrapped around it is definitely unique and surprised us with a sweet peanutty sauce on it. I wish I had room to try their dessert toast, which I was eyeing but I didn't so maybe next time along with the corn pancake!

Love this place! Want to order almost everything on their menu. We ordered the cream udon and chicken wings. Cream udon is so tasty, large portion. Good to be shared by 2 people. The spam with rice balls are cute, just like cupcakes. But I wouldn't order them again because they are too filling!

I love Korean food and the staff here was so incredibly nice!! All the waiters/waitresses greet you as you walk in and they are super friendly and welcoming. We ordered the pork belly with rice cake, seafood pancake, and yogurt soju to split between two. Everything was absolutely delicious I'm getting hungry again just thinking about this place.

This place's got cozy homey vibes. Food is very much like comfort food level. Loved the army stew, and their spicy pork app (forgot the name), also their chicken. Great place for taking friends to get a taste of korean food.

For the most part, the food was okay, nothing special. The seafood pancake and the creamy udon were pretty good. It was a very cute place but the super dim lighting gave me a headache and made me lose my appetite.

One of my favorite Korean restaurants in the States. The quality of the food has always been pretty consistent. For better prices, go during lunch time. Great drinking place.  Similar concept to Pocha 32 but more modern decor.  The food is excellent and service very friendly and efficient.  It does get really busy if you come after 6:30 or 7:00 so come early if you don't want to wait.

It's really good. Unfortunately, some dishes have been removed from the menu like Garlic Fried Chicken.
No comment
No comment

The sign is kind of small so is easy to miss out this place. Their seafood udon is a must! So creamy and delicious. You can also ask them to give you complimentary Dduk Bok ki, they will give it to you for free!
No comment
No comment

I went here 3 times now and think this is a great Korean spot with a lot of traditional Korean dishes in a modern atmosphere. Its a tad loud but you're still able to have conversations. It's off the main Ktown drag by one block. There are no reservations unless you have a larger party so come early or you will be waiting. The shiitake bugolgi japchae is delicious, ordered it all 3 times! Big fan of their garlic crusts & spicy crispy chicken! Pork Belly rice crepe is better than their pork belly cutlets. I have yet to try their hot pots because the weather has to cool down for me to be in the mood for it but I've noticed a lot of those being ordered. The seasoned rice balls with spam, seafood pancake, stuffed peppers, corn pancake are all tasty snacks. Enjoy!
The food here is interesting, and the vibe is great. Everything we ordered was tasty. The cute lunch box is our favorite. The peach soju is highly recommended!
I can't tell you how much I love this place. So much good food for a great price. The staffs are super attentive. The food is so good!!! Order their house soju while you're there.
No comment

Had to wait about 30-40 min. for this place, but it was worth the wait. Feel as though we were skipped on the list by accident tho for organizational reasons. The ambiance is cute and trendy. We ordered their house made makeoli (citron), which was absolutely delicious (frozen)! Check out my pics. We also had their signature dishes: appetizer rice balls w spam (recalling home cooking growing up), their #1 rated fried chicken sauce dish (it was OK), and our fav. creme seafood udon dish (surprisingly al dente-ish). Our waitor had to stop us from ordering more, which I'm really glad he did because we were stuffed, although we pretty much finished everything. :) We already made plans to go back. We are going to get the grilled intestines next time!

Interesting take on contemporary Korean cooking. The food we ordered seem all be traditional food with a twist. Their use of spices and creams make the tasting an interesting experience l. Would recommend anyone who got tired of traditional ktown food to come here and try
ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!!  Their Kimchi Cold Noodle Soup and Creamy Seafood Udon we're by far my favorite dishes here! Sooo good!!!! A must here.
No comment
No comment

Luckily there wasn't too long of a wait on a Saturday night, but my friend and I were seated at a tiny round table in the corner of the restaurant which barely fit all the food we ordered so I wish we had better seating. My favorite thing here was the chestnut makgeolli. We ordered the cod roe seafood udon, pork belly rice crepe wrap, and creamy kimchi stew, and the best was probably the pork belly rice crepe wrap. The cod roe seafood udon was really good but got too rich towards the end so we couldn't finish it, and the shrimp was a little annoying to peel since it was smothered in creamy sauce. The creamy kimchi stew was unique in that it had nurungji (toasted rice) but it was just too creamy with the creamy udon so that was on us. I probably would've enjoyed it more if that was the only thing we ordered. It seemed pretty similar to budae jjigae and the portion size was a little small for being $20. Overall though, it was a good experience minus the slow service.
No comment

Great place to eat with friends with a relatively short wait for a Thursday evening. The food is good (not fantastic) for the price, but I'd go back and try something different. I just wish they took reservations!

Korean gastropub at its best. Similar to Barnjoo but more creative but at the same time feels more authentic. Wasabi fried chicken was my favorite of everything we ordered. The pork stew was also really great. Also the lychee peach soju cocktail was amaaaaazing. I want to come back to try the coffee bar and lunch options!
Food was delicious. But the desserts were either too sweet or ordinary. Love their garlic fried chicken! The cold soba is an acquired taste.
No comment
No comment

This was awesome! We came here on the recommendation of my brother who is a makgeolli connoisseur. Get the white peach flavor. As for food, the spicy pork, kimchi stew and garlic chicken were all super flavorful and nicely cooked. Service was friendly and the menu was easy to read.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Made the mistake of not consulting Yelp before ordering D': I ended up ordering some mediocre dishes (creamy kimchi stew and corn w/ cheese, we weren't very hungry). They weren't bad but they weren't particularly good either. Nice ambiance and great service; the waiters were very attentive. I wouldn't come back any time soon just cause there are so many other restaurants in the neighborhood to try but if you do decide to stop by....consult Yelp first! Ha!

One of my favorite spots for drinks/food in ktown. I haven't had anything there that I regretted ordering. But what really keeps me going back is their makgulli. My two favorite kind are yuzu and sweet potato! Also their dessert is also worth getting.
No comment

My new favorite Korean restaurant! Portions are big. Atmosphere is modern and cute. Seems like a younger crowd comes here. Prices are reasonable, and its never gets as crazy as waiting in a 45 minute line in Korea Town.
Awesome atmosphere. The food was pretty good. Drinks are amazing. The Korean pancake was one of better ones I had in the city. Great spot to go.

One of the slightly more trendy places to have Korean food near K-town. The space is actually bigger than it looks and we only had to wait 10-15mins to be seated for our group of 7. The food was yummy and they give complimentary dduk-bok-gi which is spicy Korean rice cakes. If you ask for more they'll happily give more! Definitely worth a try~
No comment

No comment
This place is cute and fun. Pork belly and haemul udon are the best items IMO. Seating is limited, so arrive early.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Super place, friendly, good food and also very competent. Nice atmosphere! The lady at the desk helped us through the whole dinner. Definitely a place to visit more than once
No comment

We ordered the Nagasaki hot pot, and I like that they had non spicy selections for the hot pot. The seafood was abundant and fresh. The soup was flavorful. Well worth $23. Next dish that I really enjoyed was the pork cutlet with rice noodle on the outside. Let me tell you-the pork cutlet was slightly crunchy but roasted well with a teriyaki-like flavor. I nearly ate half of the dish myself. The final dish we got was the garlic chicken which was also quite good. The only downside is that I think the main dishes were on the pricier side but I do think the hotpot is really worth it!
No comment
Second visit here. Definitely recommend their makgeolli! Good music and atmosphere. The pork on ribs dish was passable.

My favorite place to eat and drink in Ktown.  I've come here many, many, many times.  Food is non-fussy and unpretentious.  It's got a homey vibe and the focus is comfort food.  All the fried chicken dishes are incredibly good.  I also particularly love any spicy noodles they have on the menu. In the end, everything tastes great with a shot of soju.  I think that's the point.  It can get super crowded, long waits if you come at the wrong time.  Just a really popular place.  And, for a good reason.  The staff here are all kind.  Whenever people ask me where to go in Ktown, I always recommend this.  Absolutely love it.
No comment

My boyfriend and I came for dinner one night. They dont have the traditional side dishes like other korean places but they do give you unlimited spicy rice cakes (although they were a little undercooked in my opinion). I ordered the seafood cream pasta and he ordered a kimchi stew which seemed pricey at first compared to other Korean places. We found out why when the stew came and it was HUGE. We ended up sharing that and the pasta and couldn't finish either and we both have large appetites so it's saying something. They were both delicious nonetheless and made for a good meal the next day. The decor was very cute with cloud lamps and little Lego inserts in the walls.
No comment
Impressed! Complement Toppoki and creative menu were above my expectation! Try garlic crust and spicy chicken
No comment
No comment

wow- that is all I can say. got some take-out Kimchi dish for a few hours later. and it was like a fine wine-but better. i didn't take a picture because it rolled around in my front seat and was 2 hours old by the time i got to it. the place is open super late. the hostess is cute friendly and the staff is helpful. I will be back here on a regular basis. i've seen a wait outside but its all good looking asian girls so hey its not the end of the world..
No comment

Just love all of their foods. Had bossam, injulmi samgyupsal, chicken... and so on. But really liked all of them. The best was bossam for sure, also ddukboggi they give out for side dish without charges. Cant wait to go back
No comment
The wait was long but the food was delicious! I love the way they had a small menu and pictures to go with each dish. The chicken wings were overrated.

Really good food, the menu was rich and we had a lot of choice. But we waited 90 min to be seated, we were 6 but we were first told all the 6 have to be present, then they told us we would have to wait 5 min but it actually took 30-40 min after that to find us a table.
Delicious food. But very pricey for the amount they give, even for NYC standard. If you are price conscious, stay away.

Four stars only because they don't serve little plates with appetizers like usual Korean restaurant. The rest is just great. Ambience is very nice, people are really friendly an helpful. I wish they had more of the drinks selection. Dinner for two was delicious! Pork belly, crispy chicken, spicy seafood ramen, all was just great!

The food here is amazing! I would definitely go again! There are just so many good food I haven't tried yet XD can't wait for my next visit! The interior was very cute, I liked it a lot! Love the free Ddukbeokk tasted amazing! I ordered the Jokbal and fried chicken and spam and mayo Riceball

This is a cute space. The menu is fusion Korean. It was a bit difficult to choose because most things are spicy. The food is on the less healthy side with a lot of fried items and heavy sauces. I find it a bit pricey and am not very impressed with the taste.
No comment
This place is excellent! Everything we ordered was better than the next! The pork belly was the highlight of the meal.
No comment
Food is much improved since the first few months and the selection is much better. Gets a bit too crowded now and it's hard to get a seat most weekend nights.

This is one of my go to places for dinner with friends. The menu is on the pricey side, but not bad considering the consistent quality of the food. Our favorite dishes include the Havanna-style corn pancake and pork belly cutlets. The menu includes seasonal dishes that seem to rotate, which keeps us coming back to see what's new. We also enjoy how instead of a bread basket, every table gets a plate of ddeokbokki, which complements the entrees well. The staff are friendly and unobtrusive, which is another plus in a city where many restaurants try to free up tables as fast as possible.
No comment

Their food is so delicious and their portions are generous (in my opinion.) The place has a really chill vibe. Always a go-to spot for a casual night out with friends. Their drinks are dangerously delicious as well so watch out!

Weekend brunch menu is awful. 3 ppl spent $75 and were still hungry. The portions were ridiculously small and food tasted just normal. It wasn't worth the money. I don't know weekdays menu is better but i am not going back.
No comment

This is one of my favorite korean bars to go to. I've tried practically everything on their menu and i love most of them. boodae jjigae, lazy chicken, spam and rice, cream udon, padak are among my favorites. Yes, not everything on their menu is amazing, but I would say there are many more favorable dishes than not. It has a very cute/cozy atmosphere, their soju is cheaper than other places, the staff is very attentive, and i never have a bad time when i am here. This place get packed so be prepared to wait.
Good food! Really good makgeolli and bossam! Worth the wait but the place is small and feel squished.
My Korean friend brought me here and she said it is definitely the most authentic Korean food. I really liked it but I think the hot pot can have more flavor
No comment
Love their makgeolli! The banana and yuzu ones are the best! Food is a little on the pricier side, but Ive had positive experiences all the times I've been here.
Great food, service and vibe. Can't wait to go back. Had the chicken wings, nori and desert (Melted Toast w/ vanilla bean ice cream) AMAZING!
No comment
Everything is sooooo good here. Def get the pork belly, you can't go wrong. I try to avoid fri, sat nights.bc there's atleast a 40min wait. It's a small place.
My favorite Korean restaurant in NYC so far. Great ambiance and I have to say very philosophical lines on the paper tablecloth. Try the fried chicken in garlic sauce and the creamy seafood pasta.

It's my favorite bar in K-Town! All of their bar snacks are insanely good. They offer different items that other Korean places in town do not offer. Their Cod Roe Seafood Udon is the best thing on the menu, only next to their Wasabi Chicken.
No comment
No comment

When you first walk into Take31, it seems quite stuffy because all the tables are close together and the space isn't that big. However, the ambiance is very nice and the staff very mindful. We opted for bossam and garlic crusts chicken. The bossam was ridiculously tasty and tender - something I would definitely go back for. The chicken was ok but not as crispy as I like it. I prefer the chicken from 'Her Name is Han', as it's crispier and comes with moo. They did give us ddeokbokki while we were waiting for our food, which were really tasty and went well with the makgeolli. Overall, I would recommend Take31 but I still prefer 'Her Name is Han' next door, as the food has been a bit more memorable.

Lonnnnng wait time for dinner, is it worth it? Debatable, but the food here is good and they have interesting twists on some typical Korean dishes. Wait time for a table too long as we had four people but four stars for the food!!
No comment

Their deep fried pork was $16 and it seemed like it would only serve one person!!! It is way too over priced and their lemon soju cocktail was way too watery and just sweet. I would not visit here again.
My favorite one is Braised Pork Belly, so good! and reasonable price!

Came here at 1am, not much of a wait but this is definitely a place that all Koreans and their friends come to drink and hang out before/after they go out LOL, it was super crowded and loud! Also tons of drunk people, including my party...it's exactly what you expect in Ktown on a Friday night. But it was definitely more cozy and had a more intimate vibe (than say, pocha lol). We got the frozen drinks which tasted nothing like alcohol so they were delicious! We end up getting kimchijigae, which was good too. Cute place, never felt rushed there, was a good time!
No comment

Fun menu, good food, varying service, and long-ass line. I recommend the half and half bonchon special, which allows you to choose 2 of the 4 available flavors. I personally enjoyed the sweet one while my friend really liek the soy garlic (warning: garlic chunks are HUGE). They sold out of the signature hot pot when we got there. Disappointed, we ordered a tofu pork one which was really good. I liked it better than the hot pot we got at Her Name is Han next door. The only free side dish we got were spicy rice cakes, which were served warm, but I liked the ones at Her Name is Han better. I recommend this place but try to come when there isn't a line... not sure if that's even possible to be honest.
No comment

The menu is pretty hipster and they have a "Cheetos" dish in what looks like an effort to compete with Burger King and Taco Bell. The pork belly is a standout though and everything else from the pajeon to the bulgogi japchae is really good.
Great time and amazing food. Absolutely have to get that lechee drink they have and corn pancakes:)
No comment
No comment
I'm writing this because they deserve 5 stars. I've been to Korea several times and this food is spectacular. Don't think twice.

This place was over priced to me. The food wasn't very good. I got the pork belly, chicken with wasabi cream, and the ramen thing with spam and sausages but they were all average tasting. Not worth coming back again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow on the presentation, wow on the atmosphere, and wow on the flavor of the food! No joke I'm from Texas and never have I had korean food taste like this in Texas the braised porn belly dish is must bc the flavor was so good soo great and the presentation of the dish was also good. The other most memorable thing was the pop corn shrimp and it's dipping sauce! Amazing flavors and texture especially the dipping sauce for it. Super highly recommend get that dish too. Wish I knew the recipe for it bc it was like have the best of both worlds it's was like having ranch dressing and salsa verde on the same table but oddly works. The atmosphere was pretty dim but didn't mind it at all pretty intimate so great for dates and if you want more light for food shots then I'll recommend sitting in the front of the restaurant than the back. Wish I can come back and try the other dishes but I live in dallas Texas so will be missing this place a lot.
No comment

Came with a group as a pre-wedding celebration for a mutual friend. Since our friend is Korean and has been before, she recommended most (though she did ask for input and preferences) of the dishes we tried: the Wasabi Cream Chicken, the Braised Chicken, the Shitake Bulgogi, the Braised Porkbelly, and the Kunpao Chicken. Everything was decent, but nothing in particular stood out to me as being especially delicious. If I had to choose, I would say my favorites were the Shitake Bulgogi, the Braised Chicken and the Wasabi Cream Chicken. I'm glad I tried this place out since I pass it on my route to work everyday, but I didn't love anything enough that I think I'd go back on my own.

I love their complimentary appetizer, rice cake in Korean spicy sauce best. Tried seafood noodles. It was good, but not surprising. There wasn't a lot of seafood, nor enough vegetables, which makes feel quite unhealthy and unbalanced as a dinner. Maybe it is just not suitable for one, more for friends dining together.

Excellent service! Very accommodating! I had a sausage stew that was perfect winter food! The chicken w/ wasabi cream is pure heaven! And a great grapefruit drink that they made extra strong for me  came ere several times during my trip. Excellent quality food!
No comment
Was craving JJimDalk. The flavors were spot on and the amount of DangMyeon was good. The chicken part of it was a bit disappointing though. The sides of Dokbokki were delicious too. Great place!

Very good food, especially the pork belly and chicken wings. An innovated Korean food cooking style. Price is reasonable and the size of dishes is also good. Location is not as good as the Korean town restaurant and hard to find (since it is under construction for the building.
Food is great, service is good, but the only bad thing is that it's too popular. It gets really crowded so make sure you make a reservation!

Loved everything. We arrived at 9:30pm and had a 10 minute wait. The staff from the hostess to the chefs were extremely friendly. We had the braised pork belly, great flavor and mild kimchi, the seafood udon (the only criticism was the octopus was a little tough) we also had the fried chicken with wasabi cream.... the chicken was fried perfectly and wasabi cream was great. For dessert was had the melted toast a must try!
We randomly picked this restaurant and it was unbelievably good. Will definitely recommend for the neighborhood!

Great down-to-earth Korean restaurant. The staff are very efficient and nice. The banana rice wine was particularly excellent and was almost like a smoothie due to the thickness of the fruit. I'll likely be back but I don't think it'll be a priority.

I don't really get the hype for such mediocre food. I stayed in a hotel across the street and saw there was a queue waiting every single night. So my friends and I decided to have a go before we left the town. However food turned out to be very ordinary and definitely didn't live up with the queue that I have witnessed. (BTW I soon realized that there is another Korean restaurant next to this and I am not sure whether the queue I saw was asking for this restaurant) All in all, food wasn't terrible but doesn't seem worth an hour waiting for.
No comment
No comment
The food, staff, service were amazing! Nice atmosphere in a great part of town. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good Korean restaurant.

Take31 is so cute and it makes you feel like you're actually in Korea!  Something about this place (the atmosphere?) makes it feel like Korea and the workers here are soo nice!  I was supposed to meet my sister here and I was running an hour late, and the manager(?) reserved us a table and sat us right away.  Thank you!!  The food was so good, it's Korean fusion food.  I especially enjoyed the seafood cream pasta as well as the bossam.  Definitely one of my favorite places in Ktown!
No comment

Went for dinner with my Korean buddy. I loved the experience. Felt like I'm in Korea. The food is absolutely delicious and spicy. Great service and staffs are super efficient. Will definitely come back
No comment
No comment

Always a smart choice to eat, drink, and hang out with friends~! Interesting dishes and their portion is big. Also like their services, they listen and assist customers to order delicious food and drinks

I normally don't love korean food but somehow really like Take 31 haha. Their dishes are all very unique and just delicious. I love the pasta, egg rolls and army hotpot. One downside about the food is the portion - it's good to share with 3-4 people but when you only have 2, you basically cannot order a lot of different dishes.
No comment

We just got reverse discriminated here and it was ok. This was probably going to be good but we seemed to be past over because we are not Korean. It started as a 5 min wait and when Koreans showed up behind we were told that it would be 20 min and they were first. Rock on!
Banana rice wine is amazing. Like a banana smoothie from heaven in your mouth. Also comes in handy when eating something spicy. Forgot Asian spice was extreme.
No comment
Super disappointing food. Fried chicken wings were soggy and cold, probably reheated from the fridge. The crowd also looked very young. The place seems best suited for teens to hang out.

The banana makgulli is so good, sweet potato I'd probably skip next time. The pork belly was probably one of the best pork bellies I've ever had and the egg omelette with cod roe cream sauce was addicting.
No comment
No comment

Food is delicious and good for dinner+drinks. If you have enough people, you can make a reservation (I think 8 is the minimum?) There's usually a long wait without one at peak dinner hours. They have traditional Korean dishes, in addition to some fusion options.
Young and cozy place where you want to try casual and delicious korean dishes. Enjoy free coffee coming after lunch.
Yummy! We got the three layered pork, bulgogi japchae, yogurt soju cocktail and the green tea butter toast with ice cream! The japchae was really good! More the sweet side tho!

Walked in here at around 7pm and started off with the bossam and it was so good. There were 7 of us and we gobbled it down, the texture of the meat was so soft. Then we got the fried chicken with garlic crust and we thought it was a great twist on Korean food! It was crispy and had the right amount of garlic flavor when I ate it! Then we got the donkatsu which was pretty oily but then the pork belly wrapped in crepes made it up. It was just the great amount of crispy pork and soft crepe that covered it!! We also got the sweet potato fries and fries, it came out with so many dipping sauces it was glorious. Then for dessert we got the green tea ice cream (I think?) and it was a great way to end the night. This is definitely a great place to drink and eat with your friends. We walked out of here extremely stuffed and satisfied.

Really enjoyed this place, our waitress was very nice, she was a little worried about us ordering all spicy items, very sweet. All the staff were cool and the food excellent. If you have not tried Korean unfiltered rice wine, do so. I can't believe I've never had it before, it's low gravity so only about 5% but a really nice compliment to spicy pork belly, Koren bbq and this crazy good spicy glazed chicken chunks laying in a bed of fried garlic chips, all three dishes we had were quite good.

Take31 is a great place to get together with friends and share less traditional, but more creative Korean fare. They have an extremely extensive menu, geared towards sharing and pairing with soju or beer. My friends and I shared the pork belly and the beef short ribs. They start you out with a complimentary spicy rice cake dish that was super spicy, but a good way to pique your appetite. The pork belly itself was marinated perfectly, but personally I'm not a fan of eating the actual fatty portions. The short ribs came in a huge bowl, drenched in sauce, and topped with kabocha squash fries. The meat was cooked well, but the sauce was a little too salty for my taste. I loved the kabocha squash fries on top, that added a surprising lightness to the dish. We also had an order of the crab onigiri, which was good but had a little too much mayo. The meal gets to be pretty expensive here, but it's still a fun place to come and sample something a little different.
No comment
I seems like only the most beautiful Korean women I have ever seen eat here. Hotpots are just like the ones I get in Seoul. Added bonus: They serve legit makgeolli.
No comment
Awesome service and delicious food. Reminds me of places in Seoul. Retro decor is great too.
No comment
No comment

Soooo cute! Stumbled upon here looking for a place to eat during lunch and what a nice surprise. I love how they use real mugs and bowls it adds a nice touch. Coffee and tea selections are really good. I ordered the Bulgogi lunch special, first time I ever tried it and was pleased. Looking forward to trying other items on their menu.

Love it here. Food is consistent and dishes are always outside the box. The only downside is it's tiny, so you have to wait. The service is also great. Fav dishes include pork belly with rice-cake wrap and cold kimchee noodles. Also, gotta love the free spicy rice-cake they give you as a starter.
Sweet soju cocktails and strong dishes to go with! They give complimentary topoki to all tables which is an added bonus I really like.
Easily the best korean food place in the city. However, if you don't speak or read korean, it may be a little hard to order food here.

No comment about their food, since it's the reason why we came here. But I hope there are more new restaurants opening up in the neighborhood or anywhere in Manhattan that offer better service than Take 31.
CAUSUAL Korean food! Large serving and heavy flavory! The canteen has Special style with many many details worth exploring! Like this place so much!! Getting bored with authentic Korean food.
Nice break from regular 32nd street K-Town. Great cozy food. And the fried chicken is sublime. For medium scale groups 4 works best 6 you might be waiting for a hot minute.
My friend recommended,I will check it out this place soon I love Korea food,the picture make me hungry
This place smells like delicious Korean fish. Everything was delicious. Might be a long wait though.
No comment

Been here twice but I cannot go here since there's always a long waiting here.. I wanted to check out their new menu last week, but the waiting was huge and had to go somewhere else. Wish there's less traffic to this place!
My go to chicken place. Also like their spicy pork which was added to their menu recently. Great options for drinks. Cool vibe. Love this place.
No comment

The menu had a surprisingly small number of items, which can be nice if you don't want to be overwhelmed by too many options, but if you're a picky eater, you might not be able to find something you want. Overall the food was about in line with other places like this. The dishes run a bit on the small side so you'll need to order a bit more.
No comment

Average food. I know the furniture in restaurant in ktown are usually simple and cheap and atmosphere is usually very casual. but TAKE31 still impressed me of how shabby those tables and chairs are. of course it is not that important if it is cozy. but the thing is we went on a cold  night, and it was still cold inside the restaurant. Almost everyone in the restaurant kept the coat on while eating... better not go there during winter. btw the pork bones in the soup we ordered did not taste fresh...
No comment

To my taste, the food here is mediocre. There is far better flavored Korean food in New York, like one restaurant I always go to at Saint Marks and 3rd. I like food with rich and complicated flavors, but Korean food, in my opinion, is usually the more simple and "blunt" kind compared to say French or Chinese, so if the restaurant makes it in the simple and "blunt" way it is doubly mediocre (barbecue and chicken wings excluded, they are supposed to be simple and blunt). I will not go come here again.

Fun place. Easy food. In the neighborhood and walking distance. However, rude to elders. Went w my dad. He went in first. I showed up 5 mins later. Was offended at their attitude towards him but oddly enough, they were super nice to me.  I only found out afterwards. We had to take out the food and I, ashamed for taking him to such a place. All patrons should be treated equal, esp when they are spending money for service. And do respect your elders as Koreans. Very disappointing.
Love the food here! Their portions are huge and most dishes taste authentic. Would really recommend this place:)

The most delicious seafood pancake I have ever tasted, the seafood soup is also palpable. The only thing I don't like is the environment is not quite enough. The food here is very good and I would like to come again.
No comment
the food is good here but not really my best of choice. The service is alright and when I ordered the boodagukae it was a little bland. It's not the best korean food place but the prices are okay
Lazy chicken tastes good but too oily after several bites. Spam and mayo rice ball is simple yet amazing. The salmon omelette(don't remember the exact name) is amazing.

As a Korean, I can say honestly this restaurant foods are generally okay. However, they included 20% of gratuity even though we never asked for it. Also, the food prices are pretty much higher than average. The staff member mistake to check out our payment, so we had to complain and wait for a long time. It was good for flavor, but will never been again because of service. Terrible!
I just love the pork belly! This is one of my favorite restaurants in K-town

Just wonderful. Funky vibe with mismatched chairs and tables. Very sweet waitress walked us through the menu. Food was delicious especially pork belly. Also lunch box, which you close top on and shake up to mix together. Top notch.

good food good service and reasonable price. i really like their yogurt soju. We will definitely come back again.
The interior Was amazing and creative! The food as okay, nothing too special for it's price. My favorite was definitely the lazy chicken, SO GOOD.

Ohmygosh.. Can't believe I knew about this place recently. It's a cute Asian fusion restaurant and the store is small but the food here is sooooo good. Basically tried everything on the menu and there's nothing bad to say about this place. Even introduced  this place to friends from Korea and they said it's better than the food in Korea

We were in the city for a night out when all of us decided we'd like to have a late night dinner. This was the first place that popped up on yelp and I understand why. The food was amazing! So flavorful and filling. Exactly what I wanted on a freezing NYC night. Will definitely be back!
Obsessed with the spam rice balls here. Near the koreatown strip, can be easily found and opens late. Great place to stop by and eat and chat.
No comment

I went here with my friend and was blown away!  Everything we tried was delicious. Plan to wait for a table.  It was packed when we went and we waited for just under an hour on a Friday.  It had a bit of a fun/hip vibe to it as well compared to some of the other K town offerings.  I will be back to Take31.

I mean, the food is good, it has a very homestyle feel to it. That said, I would argue the food is over-priced as my girlfriend has prepared similar dishes that were much better, so I can't really justify the cost (disclaimer, my gf is a great cook, so to compare her cooking to Take31 is not really fair for Take 31 :).

Had their Nagasaki (soup) and it tasted ok but the seafood definitely did not taste as good/fresh as when I had it last time. Was slightly disappointed but at least the chicken and bossam were consistently good...

got here right before dinner service started at 6, and was seated right away. they brought out complimentary spicy rice cakes which had a nice kick to it, and they were probably the most tender rice cakes ever. wanted to try the lazy chicken but was told thats discontinued and instead got crispy chicken with wasabi cream, budae jigae, and pork belly. the chicken was a bit bland, but the wasabi cream had a nice touch to it. the budae jigae was just the right amount of spice for me - a slight kick. the pork belly was ok, not the best i've had but pretty good still. 2 of us being girls, we like to talk and eat - but unfortunately this place is in a rush to get you out. fair enough, we were mid way thru the meal as we chatted and stopped eating and they interrupted asking if we wanted to see the dessert menu. rude! but we got the hint and finished up what we can, and left. it was a wednesday night but a small line formed outside for dinner. the crowd is young and trendy but mainly asian if not all korean.

Typical Korean bar food, but pretty good food. Decor is decent. The chestnut (bam) makgeolli was delicious, definitely a must try if you have a taste for makgeolli. However, the 3 stars come from the fact that we waited over an hour for a table for 4 on Friday night. I don't know if the food was actually that worth trying given the long wait. There were tables of 3 who sat down half an hour before us...They did eventually give us service, which was ice cream with chestnut powder, not bad. Also, if someone in your party can't read/speak Korean, you may want to reconsider this place.

I think this is my favorite new place.  Everything I've tried here so far is absolutely delicious and I can't wait till the next time I go back.  Only thing is it's always a bit warm in the restaurant, but the food is so good I really don't care.

I'm sorry to break the bad news. The bossam was such a miss for me. The pork belly (even eaten with the toppings) was mushy and bland. We also had the buddae which had very little ramen (almost half of those packet ramen you get at Safeway); the soup was however flavorful.
Excellent food. Love the free rice cakes. The pork belly almost melts in your mouth. Army stew had flavorful soup.
nice atmosphere. there will be a wait time if you go in the evening. my friends didnt like the makgoli mixtured drinks too much but the workers are really nice and food seems to be at least average!
great ambiance - has a cozy, nostalgic feel. The pork belly  was delicious, buddae jjigae was too good :) I'll DEF come back!!!

This place gets 5 stars for awesome service and really good food! This was my boyfriend and I first time trying Korean food. Our waiter made recommendations on what to try, and needless to say we were not disappointed. The environment was casual and fun, and the food was spicy, just the way I like it!
No comment
No comment
Super cute place, good lunch specials!! A little bit small portion-wise, but it's pretty affordable. Will come back to try dinner as well...

Typical bunshik type place. My friends and I got 3 things. The makkullee, the budae jjigae, and the cod eggs seafood udon with cream sauce. All three were so good! A worthy mention is the udon with the cream sauce. At first this didn't sound very good but when we got it, it was weirdly very addicting. I personally don't like creamy foods cause I think they are neukki but it was so weirdly good. I recommend it!

The staffs are really nice! They helped me find a song I like in the store   And the food is so nice too, especially the seafood ramen! The price is friendly and good four groups of friends to share. We were lucky we didnt want for too long because there are slways so many people and popular. Will definitely come back again.
No comment
No comment

While I understand it is a busy restaurant and there is a long wait outside, bring a check in the middle of the meal rushing customer out is unacceptable. Food is mostly unhealthy fried and sugary. It is for kids and non Koreans. Would never comeback because of the rude service.
Waiting here was a nightmare. Favoritism first. Not organized. Took me an hour to get in and took another 20 min to make an order. Unfriendly staff. Food was OK but salty. Would not recommend.

their food is delicious! really good for side dish while drinking casually with couple of friends! really comfortable environment inside as well! ill guesstimate that youll spend around 20-35 dollars in total!
Nice place for bar and unhealthy Korean food. The food is authentic, the environment is great and the pricing is fine. Overall a great place to go.
You should try their banana rice wine which is their newest menu! It was sooooo good! They have so many good menus that you gotta try!
Everytime I come out to eat with my friends, I always go here. Waiters are super nice and i love their foods. I recommend the garlic crust chicken.

I came for dinner last week and I had braised pork belly and spicy chicken with garlic crust which were the most popular ones. Foods were awesome and their prices are reasonable. Besides the staffs were very friendly so I would def come again.

I like the take 31's food!Everything is awesome!The service is perfect!Especially the korean style rice wine is really nice!They have lots of flavor for the rice wine!The Banana rice wine is awesome!It tastes like Banana smoothie;) And the sweet potato rice wine is also amazing! If you are looking for the fancy and good food restaurant come to this place!im strongly recommend this place!!!!

My friend recommended this place for our Friday night catch up dinner. We ended up waiting OVER ONE HOUR in the cold for a party of 2. I was pretty disappointed at the way they handled this situation; we checked in after 35-40 minutes of waiting, since the male hostess mentioned this would be the wait time. At an hour we checked in and he said he called our name but no one responded. We were standing right in front of the door under the heat fan and our name was never called, nor we were asked of ours when he saw us standing there for so long. After finally being seated, we got our drinks and food. Although the food was delicious, I'm very hesitate to come back here after that kind of treatment. I come to ktown every weekend too.
I love this place.Very delicous foods and staffs are very nice.This place is must go.
The best dish on their menu that i had was the pork belly rice crepe wrap and yuzu rice wine. The rest were eh but i would def go back to try the rest of their menu.

Ate dinner here last night. It was a packed house but the service was still snappy and attentive. Food was very good. We tried the braised pork belly (mind blowing amazing) and the seafood pancake (good but not great). Would definitely go back a second time.
Check your final bill on your bank account. You might be charged extra tips... Feeling like being scammed. Never going back to this place for sure.

My recent revisit here was awesome. I had delightful soju-time with my old friends. The food was great. They still give out spicy rice cake. This time, I did't see any waiters, all waitresses. LOL. It was my pleasure to be there again. No complaints.
No comment
Excellent anju, everything was delicious. Bossam, cod roe pasta, lazy chicken were all top notch. Only complaint is the poor beer list but the food more than makes up for it
As I was leaving this place........I spotted a dead COCKROACH on the floor 2 ft away from my chair..... how wonderful....-_-

Really authentic/flavorful Korean food with a fusion twist. You could tell it was legit as my friend and I were the only non-Asians present. Very cool atmosphere and chill staff. Definitely going back and bringing others!

Nice interior. Had lunch with co-workers here a bunch of times and the good was pretty good every time. I really like their donkatsu. I hate their fried rice with some sort of roe... So greasy an them adding mayo on top does not help the situation. Only strange thing about the place is they don't give you any sort of napkins until you ask.

Surprising new Ktown place to go to with friends. It's on 31st Street between 5th & Madison.  Their spam rice balls are yummy and I had the lazy chicken. Both were tasty, but I wish their chicken is more savory than sweet. The garlic sauce is too sweet.

This place is a hidden gem.  Most (if not all) of the clientele was Korean which is a good sign to start with. Relaxed, cosy atmosphere. Delicious side dishes which we enjoyed eating with soju.  Service was attentive and professional.  Will definitely go again!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

GREAT drinks, nice menu selection, plenty of seating, good vibes, reasonable prices! Becoming one of my go to spots for a drink date or friend meetup. One of the best bars in the neighborhood for cocktails if not the best.

The place is really pretty. The bar and bathroom are beautiful. They had the heaters on too high when we were there so we were melting. I got an amaretto sour and it was fantastic. I didn't order any food but I would go back. The bartender was friendly.

What a pretty bar. Great drinks. Well decorated. Not overly crowded. Also a bar that's staffed well. Im used to seeing one bartender manning the entire bar so this was a pleasant surprise. Ken will make you an off menu cocktail if you ask nicely. We'll be back for sure!
Too loud average food.  Great. If you love packed places. I definitely didn't enjoy myself and will not be going back to many other great places in New York to enjoy.
No comment
Varied options of food and cocktails. Everything we ordered was great. Very good service. Nice atmosphere. Two thumbs up.
No comment
No comment
The staff was great and fun to talk to. The food, drinks, and ambiance were on point.

If only I could give 6 stars to this place because it has it all, great service, amazing food and the atmosphere is nice. Cocktails are lovely and the food is out of this world. Definitely recommend this place for its food variety, atmosphere and especially the bar. Great job and welcome to Tribeca.
One of the best spots in Tribeca. LOVE the drinks, LOVE the food, and LOVE the bartenders and service. Would reccomend
Great ambiance. The duck confit was really nice. Awesome cocktails, loved the Choco Old Fashioned.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just come for the drinks and bar. Cocktails so tasty - drunken dragons milk is so sweet and creamy with coconut milk and green tea vodka, etc. Great service and bar area. The food itself though was very average and overpriced. Burger was cooked perfectly and very tasty. But both the burger and noodles pretty average and way overpriced for what they were

I loved the vibe in this restaurant, the food is incredible, the drinks are delicious. The appetizers are probably my faves, the mushroom truffle croquettes and the ribs were to die for. Definitely get the pana cotta and the malasadas. We got the whole fish which was soooo good. The service has been great both times I've gone.

We had a lovely pre-theater dinner here. We sat at the bar while we waited for our friends, the drinks were good and the service was attentive. The whole place is very pretty. Service was just right, which is to say neither intrusive nor scarce. The food was very good and the seafood was fresh. For some reason I expected it would be more heavily seasoned but it wasn't, it was just right and flavorful for us. We enjoyed everything

Very interesting design and bar area. Would def recommend going even if its just for the design. The food is mostly fusion food so dont have the expectation of getting authentic food from Macao. The servers there were nice and attentive.

This was my 2nd time dining here - first time was for a friends birthday and it was great! 2nd time the food was SO salty and probably a lot of MSG in it.  The cocktails are good but on the pricey side - $20+ for one cocktail. For the little food we ordered, the bill was around $224 with tip. I was looking forward to dining here, but my opinion has changed since the last time.  Other spots will have better food, although the ambiance here is nice!
No comment
Beautiful setting and great for happy hours after work. The food is not close to Asian so it was a bit underwhelming. Steamed fish was delicious but I'd say overpriced.
No comment
My husband took me here for the first time and was pleasantly pleased. The drinks were on point and so was the food.
No comment

This place had the coolest interior I've seen in a while. The lights were low and the decor amazing. Everything on the menu was in the $$$ range and the food was well made. I enjoyed my meal though I do wish that for the price it came with more that 5 French fries and a scoop of spinach. Our waiter was great he checked on us often and bantered with us at the table  I think if you want a cute, intimate, date night spot this could be it.

This place is great. Located in the mids of china town it is opened late.  And they serve food late hours. Ambience is great. Nice hip pop music. Upstairs. Super sweet waitress Kristine.  Food was limited options but again. It was very late. But it came out perfect. Then we went downstairs. Great music. Not crowded dance floor. And everyone enjoying themselves.  Recommend and will return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I will honestly say, one of the best nyc dining experiences i have had - from the fish to the apps to the chicken, almost everything was incredible. Service was 6/5 and i loved the decor. 110% will be coming back!!
No comment

Right off the bat, I gotta say the place looks great. Furniture, music, ambiance, servers, everything about this place looks nice. I came here twice just for drinks before, and this was my first time for dinner. And here is why I'm leaving a two stars review: we got food poisoned. We ordered steamed mussels, dumplings and a big red snapper for two. Everything tasted pretty good - besides perhaps a bit too seasoned - but definitely the flavors were good. Too bad the fish was not cooked well and probably even too old. We spent the night in the restroom you can imagine why. Be very careful, and perhaps just come for drinks and music, but I do not recommend the restaurant.
No comment
Great decor with trading company ambiance. Love the food especially the crispy fish! Server was very helpful in suggesting drinks and attentive to our needs. Enjoyed the evening with my friend .
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food, vibes, and service! Everything we had was amazing and the place is super fun and eclectic. Ordered the shrimp dumplings, glass noodles, and steamed shrimp and loved everything! The cocktails are super creative and tasty too!

Amazing ambience. Sat downstairs in the lounge area at a booth and it was really good. Drinks were great. Got a few tequila drinks that hit the spot. The dumplings were really good. I got the African Chicken and the Crispy Whole Fish. The chicken was good chicken but quite underwhelming. Needed the side of hot oil I got. The fish was the best thing. Definitely saved the meal. The vegetable fried rice was just okay. Also needed the hot oil. the ambiance alone is worth a recommendation.
No comment
No comment

Wound up at Macao for post dinner drinks before a night out....John Paul was the best, highly suggest his Mezcal Margaritas! Everybody including management was so attentive throughout the entire visit I will definitely be back (even though I was not even planning on attending this restaurant in the beginning of my night) And that's coming from a bartender!

Let's talk Macao restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown! An amazing gem in the city. The dim lights, the ambiance, the decor, everything about this place is so special (even the cool bathrooms lol). I'm giving this place five stars because of the service!!! The waiters and waitresses were so attentive. They were present throughout the whole dinner experience (asking if we want more drinks? Or, if we were prepared for dinner to be served?). Service was nothing like I experienced before. We had the pleasure of having Liv as our waitress. She was amazing! The food and drinks were also great! (see photo). I highly recommend the tequila drinks on the menu. I didn't take many pictures as you can tell because I enjoyed the experience so much. Please stop by if you're in the area and in the mood for Eurasian cuisine!

The lobster noodles were great! Everything else was average. Service was slow. Maitre'd was slow. Bouncer (for dinner?) was rude and a turn off. Interior decoration an orientalist's wet dream. Crowd was also very strange, a mix of tourists, finance bros, etc.
No comment
This place is tasty and great for groups or a couple!  I had my bday here a few years ago. Drinks are great, octopus is everything I dreamed it would be.
No comment
No comment

I love this place. The food is not the best. I do like the oysters, burger, and fried rice. The drinks were yummy. The place has a really cool vibe. I've been here a few times and I enjoy it every single time.
Great food great drinks.  Kevin and Alex (bartenders) are the best!  Very friendly, knowledgeable, and will definitely come back again.
No comment

The appetizer menu was a compilation of all of the best small plates I know and love. The wine was amazing. Our server was incredible and all of the staff went above and beyond to provide us with an exceptional level of care.
No comment

The service was a little slow, nonetheless, still decent. Spinach dumpling was amazing! The Lobster noodles were great too. The winner of this dinner were the cocktails. They were all balanced and had its distinct flavor combinations that worked so well. The interior was also beautiful. Would recommend to others.
No comment
No comment

Good atmosphere, friendly service and forward menu selection. We tried all 3 types of pies, chard octopus, blistered shishtis, and porter house for two, everything is so much fun. I was really surprised that the steak was so delicious. Small ones but a good restaurant for fun. Everyone enjoyed the cocktail.
No comment

This was an overall solid meal and dining experience. We ordered a couple dishes for the table and I liked them all except for the char siu baby back ribs. I LOVE cha siu baos, and have at least a couple stored in my freezer at all times, so I was really excited about the ribs. I felt like they just got the sauce flavoring wrong. To me the ribs were sickly sweet and tasted heavily of hoisin sauce. I wouldn't get those again, but very much enjoyed everything else. The dumplings (shrimp) were tasty, the bok choy was awesome and i loved the flavor. The bacon and shrimp fried rice was my favorite dish of the night. It was kind of unique and just really delicious. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice too. We went around 6:30 and it wasn't very crowded, which was nice.

My friends and I wanted to explore a neighborhood we don't regularly hang out in so we landed on TriBeca and started at Macao. When I walked in the atmosphere upstairs was cozy and sexy. Seemed like it would be nice to sit at the bar. However when it came time to seat the three of us they brought us downstairs to a less lit, less clean area of the restaurant and stuffed us in a corner despite there being an abundance of seating. We only had drinks and apps but had we stayed for dinner it would have been unreasonable. The apps and drinks were good but we got out of there pretty quickly...

The ambiance was really nice. Great for a date night. The drinks were good and the food was good but the menu was a bit limited. Waitress was very nice. Might be a bit overpriced but overall a good spot

Stayed upstairs at bar area.  This restaurant is very picturesque and decorated to theme. Their martinis were good and the staff was welcoming. A little quiet for a Friday night but it was also Easter weekend. Would come back again for food!
No comment

Lobster noodles uhhhmazing. Hakka noodles so so good. Shrimp and scallion dumplings solid. Malasadas with dippping sauce pretty good (as long as you don't compare them to malasadas from Hawaii). Service was A1 .

The most HORRIBLE Experience I ever have my  first time and the bartender was very rude with my friends and I, he was trying to be sarcastic but it wasn't funny at all I don't know he's name but he ruined my friend birthday, he insulted me compared me with other people that I work as a person who work in the service industry you never have tu assume that the everyone is the same way my friends order beers, then he told us that was the last call so he literally run to give me the check so I ask if I can buy i shot for my friend birthday and he say NO cause I'm tired for people like you that come and no leave tip, I was in shock first cause is my First time HERE I just ask for shots, I didn't come here after work get mistreated/prejudge like shit!! The bartender was a white bald dude! Irish looking guy.
The bouncers are so rude and unprofessional.  Once you get past ghetto vibe at the door and disrespectful comments you are greeted by much friendlier patrons and bartenders.

It was one of those afternoons where my friend and I just felt like hopping around to different spots to enjoy the NYC HH/night vibe. In the area and she recommended this gem of a spot since she often came here when worked in the area. First thing I noticed was the dim lighting which I am a huge fan of in restaurants and bars. We sat in the front where there is more of a bar setting but in the back is their restaurant. To be honest.... we did not eat but enjoyed a few of their drinks. One was a spicy style drink which was so good, but I sadly forgot the name of it. Our server was extremely helpful in picking out cocktails and had a funny personality which made the experience that much more enjoyable. I'd love to come back to this place for the atmosphere, drinks, and late-night partying which I hear is a VIBE!!!
No comment

Came here recently for dinner on a Sunday evening and had a wonderful experience! A friend had raved about this place and it did not disappoint. The interior decor is so cool and the place has a nice vibe. Our waitress was a doll and checked on us all night, she was so sweet. The menu is really eclectic and combines many international cuisines. We had the Ants climbing the tree (noodles), chicken & pork dumplings, mushroom croquettes and fried rice. Everything was delicious!! Oh and you must save room for the donut holes with vanilla cream and dulce de leche dessert! Also the drinks were amazing the bar is so cool. Would definitely come back to Macao!
No comment
No comment

Service was good... Not at the bar though. Food was pretty good. $38 for the steamed fish. Pot stickers were good. 3 appetizers, 3 mains, tip over $200. Pretty steep for Chinese food. Would I go there again... Nope.

Came here for a work event. We sat in the outside space. Beware not to sit next to the plants as there were so many bugs that I ended up getting so many bug bits during the whole dinner. The food on the other hand was really good. Would recommend the oysters and the lobster noodles. The noodles were seasoned really well and the lobster was super fresh!

The food here is amazing. You have to try the steam dumplings. They are huge and juicy. It tastes great in the chili sauce. The glass noodles dish is tasty too. The African chicken is my favorite. The coconut curry and tender chicken is amazing.  Served with a Cole slaw.  I like the cocktails they have here. The spicy margaritas is refreshing and addictive. On the weekends the djs are live from 11 to 4am. They have a low key room downstairs that is jamming. The djs there are amazing. They play everything so the vibe is very different. If you are looking for a late night meal, drinks and dancing, you got to come here.

the server kept telling them it was soup based and almost suggested they shouldn't order it. We were all confused as my friends still wanted that dish. I'm vegetarian/vegan and had the fried spinach dumplings. They were ok but would have preferred them without cheese. I did like the shishito peppers because they were vegan (I think) and the portion was generous. I ordered the hoisin noodles as it was pretty much the only entree available. It's called hoisin Hakka. To the restaurant, hoisin means seafood in Chinese so perhaps an update to the name would make it more clear. The noodles were disappointing. Very hard and I didn't finish them. Despite giving us a two hour dining limit our server was hard to pin down the rest of the evening. It took almost 30 mins to get our dessert and another 20 mins to process our cards. We asked for individual cards if possible and the server said it would take a longer "minute". Had we know it would take 20 we would have done one card. We left almost an hour after our allotted time so I guess there was a no show. From a sustainability standpoint it was generally fine but the disposable chopsticks swapped for reusable are low hanging fruit.
No comment

Ok folks. Don't bother. They think they are above actually seating you when you have a reservation. Major attitude from the dude at check in stand. Refused to seat us despite having a recent knee replacement and pointed us at the three deep bar and said go have a drink. Even more attitude and turning his back when told we needed to sit and asked why he wouldn't seat us. What a joke.  Maybe they think customers don't matter. Ok, clearly they don't. And no, I'm not out of town I've been in Tribeca for 15 years. Have frequented Macao often and had memorable experiences. Never again though. It's a shelling what it once was. They're dead to me. Plenty of other welcoming places around the corner.

Unfortunately my experience at Macao was not a good one. Despite having heard great things about the restaurant, their staff is extremely unprofessional. Coming from the industry myself, I understand the stress of having to deal with a rush and needy costumer however the way I was treated by the bar staff was repulsive. Not only did the bartender yell at me but he was talking about me to other coworkers right in front of me. The same night, a fellow costumer was also worked up about how he wasn't being served because he looked arabic, this is NYC and we have people from all over the world, definitely not a good look for your business! I suggest getting new bartenders!
No comment

The food is not bad, but just ok. Everything is overpriced for its trendy fusion style. Like the steamed fish dish we ordered, I myself can cook it better, so can probably some Chinatown traditional restaurants with the same price for a whole fish. Meh...

We got the kale salad, steamed pork dumplings and fried rice to share. It was a perfect amount of food. The steamed dumplings were to die for, highly recommend. The service was great as well. Will be going back here for another date night.
No comment

I really enjoyed the Mata Hari and everyother cocktail I had here. Not a fan of the wines by the glass though and 5he beer selection was quite  limited. Food was good. Loved the spareribs.

I had the WORST experience at Macao yesterday. I waited 30 minutes to order 4 drinks and the bartender with short hair  & tattoos just prepared 2 of them and refused to prepare the rest because she thought she already did. When i asked for the rest of my drinks ( which I already paid for), she was ignoring us, being rude & condescending because she probably though we were drunk which wasn't true. I had to go upstair and fill a complain to get what i paid for. Horrible experience
Amazing Food, delicious drinks, and by far the best staff around! Sat at the bar and had an incredible dinner / experience. 10 out of 10 would recommend.
No comment
No comment

What a night! I wanted to put together a dinner for my brothers birthday and we had the most amazing time. When I reached out to Stacey to help me organize this not only was she helpful with ideas but made the entire process seamless. She set up a table for ten of us and had it ready when we walked in. She knew the menu front and back , gave us recommendations and knew exactly how much food to bring out. We ordered perfectly. Not only did she help me coordinate a great night but she was our server as well. I'm so happy this worked out the way it did. And can't wait to come back for my birthday too!

We were going to stop by another restaurant/ bar for a drink one early evening but, because they had an event, a server there recommended we come here. The bartender was friendly and attentive and the appetizers we ordered were pretty good. We ordered the spinach and ricotta fried dumplings and the mussels. Both pretty good but not great. The bartender recommended a green tea vodka which I really enjoyed.  We would definitely stop here again for a drink if in the neighborhood.

Rude and dishonest bartender who provided terrible service and attempted to extort additional money than was owed. The other staff's service was equally as bad.

Came in here on a Friday night with some friends for drinks. While we were in the lounge, my friend asked me for my e-cigarette and took one small hit. Fifteen minutes later, the bouncer came up to me and told me that I was vaping when I said I hadn't after that one time and ensured him we didn't or wouldn't after that. He proceeded to grab my arms and shove me out of there, yelling at to me GET OUT. All my friends were in complete shock as I told him multiple times to get his hands of me and refused to listen, just continually yelling. He continued to shove me until we were all out and looked like a psychopath. I understand I was in the wrong but for him to not even listen to a word I was saying and rudely grab onto me to get me out is just sickening. Would not recommend this place for a night out, you're better off going anywhere else. They clearly don't know etiquette here.

The drinks and vibe were pretty cool but the bartender on the main level was one of the most rude people I've ever encountered, I think his name is Phillip. I ordered a drink and so did a random guy sitting next to me, after taking our order he just left the bar area, came back 20 mins+ later. Wtf.

Macao's hospitality is without comparison. Behind the bar Gabe Carney, Gabe Lehner and Nat are all beyond attentive and took great care of our group last night.  Brian and Alex at the door make us feel right at home. Drinks are always stellar and staff is the best in NY.  Macao is a gem because of the people working there. Thank you.

Bartender was clearly racist. He requested that my friend and I be kicked out of the bar because my friend offered him cash as a tip. After realizing that we weren't kicked out (because there was no reasoning for us to be kicked out) he berated the security guards and requested us to be kicked out again. I have been coming to this place for over 10 years and this has been a traumatic experience that I would have never predicted.

Trendy hipster place with overpriced food and drinks.  Nonetheless, they get four stars because everything was delicious! The service was attentive but also felt a bit annoying as they were too quick to want to clean up plates before we were done.  That's typical in most of the US.  They need to be in tuned when a party is trying to spend a relaxed dining experience.  Having said that, I still absolutely recommend this place especially for date night.
Hostess was rude. Food was ok not great. More of a touristy place. It's really not worth it. Will not go again
Great spot for drinks, food and catching up.  Cool vibe and good looking people. Conveniently located to other cool spots so perfect place to start or end your night.

Invited here  for appetizers and  drinks and this place did not disappoint. Great ambiance/decor; friendly and attentive staff; and yum yum shareable items. We enjoyed their mix of dumplings; fried rice and burrata cheese. Good portions and all hit the spot! The busters kept our water glasses filled and although the seating is a bit tight for this place due to it's floor layout, there are no real complaints. Would definitely return if I'm next in the area.

Food is great, service was great and the drinks were amazing. I'm surprised this place isn't more publicized with the likes of other Asian fusion spots in nyc. I had randomly found this place on google when I looked up exotic drinks in NYC and I took a look at their menu and it seemed different so I had to try it. The food was just amazing I will definitely keep coming back. I highly recommend this spot as it is like a hidden gem in NYC. Atmosphere was awesome too, perfect for couples and a gathering for friends. Ordered the pork chop, African chicken, sausage egg fried rice, octopus and dumplings (apps) and had some drinks as well. Prices are fair and overall just a great experience.

Great vibe, great service, great food. Didn't realize I had been here before years ago and glad to have made it back. Super accommodating with gluten free options and the waitstaff was SO pleasant the entire visit. Just overall awesome. We ordered the dumplings, shishitos (gf), whole crispy fish (gf), African chicken (gf), fried rice (gf), Hakka noodles (gf!!!!) and regular Hakka noodles. My favorite was the fish, the sauce was DELISH. Will 100% be back

I'm extremely picky for getting an Asian meal in Chinatown that isn't Chinese owned and I was so impressed by everything. The downstairs also converts over to a scene after 10 on Friday. Wished we stayed...

After a long flight from CA to NYC for a wedding, we just wanted to feel the city before going to bed. This did the trick! Live ambiance with tasty food, good music, great drinks, and fun people. There is a bar, restaurant, and nightclub below. We enjoyed the bar and restaurant--too old for the club. The blush maiden was my favorite drink--loved it!

Wow Macao used to be my favorite place they had great food and amazing mixologist drinks. Now dont know what happened! The menu shrunk to one page lost so many good food options and the Bar Manager refuses to make certain drinks at the fully stocked bar. Why? Because we just dont! I havent had a drink in 3 weeks and was talking Macao up to a friend and was looking forward to having a well crafted cocktail here but apparently they "just dont" make what I want. No explanation, no reason they just wont. The place was completely empty and its just me and a friend and they refuse to make me one Long Island. They also refuse to make Lychee Martinis. Didnt know since the name is Macao they adopted communist rules as well and decide what you can and cannot drink. Youd think during a pandemic thats forcing all the restaurants in NYC to close up permanently and the fact I was sober and just wanted one drink theyd want to make some money and make me a happy customer. But nope! Bad Management! I have been coming here for 6 years and will no longer return or recommend anyone ever again! Sad! Go next door to Antique Garage they will let you drink whatever you want and its beautiful inside.

My husband took me here for a belated Valentine's day dinner.  Its a very busy place but they have seatings on 2 levels.  The lights were very dim, a bit too dark, I couldn't really see the delicious food.  Now on to the food, for starters we ordered the burrata and the chicken and pork belly dumplings.  Burrata is always yummy and gooey.  Their dumplings were also very delicious, but a little pricey for dumplings ($15).  Main course: lamb shank and lobster noodles.  The lamb shank was moist and tender and spiced with 5 spice over a bed of hidden polenta underneath the massive shank.  The lobster noodles were lightly flavored with 2 big pieces of lobster.  Overall, it was a delicious meal.
Formidable service, food, drinks and ambiance

We went to the restaurant for my friend's birthday and service was terrible, they put our food on another table by accident and then tried to give it to us, my tea took two hours to get to the table, took an hour for us to get any food on the table. They forgot the tea bag for my friend's tea, poured water in my friends tequila. The waitress didn't even ask everyone what they wanted to order before trying to rush off. The dumplings were ok, we got the shrimp ones, I wanted to ask for chili oil but the waiter never came back to the table.

I don't do Yelp. I don't like Yelp and generally I think people who spend their time writing online reviews need something better to do. But I feel like I understand them now and this is the only way to vent my frustrations without being a Karen and calling the restaurant and having to talk to a person. A friend invited me for dinner here last Saturday and I will say the food and the vibe was exceptional. The Maitre' D was very personable and the hostess was gracious. Drinks were good. The only thing is that our waitress was downright mean. She was so aggressive and snappy that we felt uncomfortable. For someone that small she was the rudest angriest person I've ever met and she was the only reason I didn't have a blast here. She honestly made me want to walk out and leave.

Solid food, can't comment on the cocktails (we just ordered wine.) Dumplings are good and have a nice authentic flavor. Must try the octopus! Last, the bacon and shrimp fried rice is classic and very tasty.
Really liked the mushroom croquet and dragon cocktail drink, eggplant and baby ribs were average

A friend of mine picked this restaurant and I had no idea what to expect. We waited at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable. He chatted with us for awhile and it made the wait seem quick. The drinks were spot on. I rarely have food "experiences" but at this place I felt like I discovered new flavors. Each dish was unique from the last and offered something new. I was very impressed and can't wait until the next time.

Definitely want to come back here. We just went for drinks on a Monday night, but I was so impressed with the Dragon's Milk - a perfectly creamy and different coconut/green tea drink. I really think the atmosphere of this place would be good for a date even though I went with a friend! Also curious what dinner would taste like here. Judging from the drinks, and our amazing bartender, I certainly want to come back and find out :D

My favorite Saturday night / Sunday morning spot. I'm a Village gal & when I am feeling like I wanna be out but don't feel like gathering an entourage, I hit Macao all by myself. The crowd is mixed and happy. The music is a little something for everyone. Always a song I haven't heard in forever. I love sitting in corner at the bar and watch the energy onthe room... vibrant until the end. And the bar staff is a pleasure to watch in action. The way they make drinks is sexy  My favorite drink is the Odd Job. It isn't for the feather weight drinker  so don't order it if you're the Apple martini type. And be sure to put some grub in tummy. At 2am the kitchen is still open... I can't resist the  shrimp/ bacon  fried rice

Over the years, I've had many of the cocktails here. The Dr. Funk, the Gola Lola, and the West Side are all exceptional but my absolute favorites are the Kaffir Jimlet [kaffir lime-infused fords gin mixed with lime juice & agave nectar], the Drunken Dragon's Milk [green tea vodka shaken with young coconut puree, thai basil & their house specialty five-spice bitters], and the Ciao Rizo [chipotle infused espolón blanco shaken with lime juice, lemongrass syrup & a pinch of cilantro leaves]. The place is typically packed so arrive expecting that but the ambiance is absolutely magical and the host staff always do their best to attempt to squeeze you in somehow. The bar staff is exceptional. I've shared a couple of small plates with friends and they've always been nice but the primary focus for me has always been the extraordinary cocktail menu.

4 stars only because I didn't taste the food. Service was great, bartender was very attentive and knew the history of the concept behind the restaurant. Will definitely be back to taste the food but the cocktail and wine menu is extensive and enjoyed the quick stop.

On a night where getting a reservation was near impossible, Macao came thru. I met up with a few friends for cocktails and was instantly impressed. A sweet tea vodka fan for life, I always judge a bar if they have that offering. Interesting they did not offer sweat tea vodka but rather had Green Tea Vodka. Always willing to give something new a try, I ordered one of the specials and it was delicious. Our stomachs were driving our ordering decisions. We tried several small plates and of note, the fried rice is what I best remember. Oh, and the doughnuts at the end were a very good choice. The food and the drinks were the highlights. The downside is the music was quite loud and it made it difficult to hear my  friends at time. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking to have an intimate dinner conversation . . .

Went to this place for the first time a few weeks ago and have already been back! The drinks are really delicious and special. My favorite is the drunken dragon milk - green tea vodka with puréed young coconut and lime - amazing flavor. Although it's a heavier, sweeter drink than I normally go for - I may already be developing an obsession with this cocktail. The mushroom truffle croquettes are incredible with just the right balance of flavors. The scallop and chive dumplings also achieve a great flavor. The burrata and sautéed kale were good picks too. The interior is very soothing and dark, it has a nice way about it. The staff is attentive and helpful. I will definitely be going back.

Macao Trading Company killed NYE 2018!! Strongly recommend that others check it out next year! On nights that aren't New Year's Eve, Macao remains my favorite oasis in NYC. First and foremost, you will notice the great, low-key vibe and decorations, supplemented by conscientious good service, killer cocktails and creative food. I've taken many friends here on Mondays for their wacky jazz band/burlesque extravaganza. Come in and unplug from the city for an evening.
