The food here is amazing and the service is outstanding. The staff is wonderful and amazing, they attend to everyone needs and wants with no problem or attitude. This restaurant is a 5 star quality restaurant with amazing service. I recommend all my friends to go and check it out for some amazing soul food. The staff member Tashia is a sweetheart and she remembered me after my first visit. My second visit all the staff recognized me and are super welcoming which makes me come back every Thursday after school to get dinner for my whole house. I love spending my money in a place where I feel valued as a customer.
Food is good. Double check your ToGo order, seems like you're only given two pieces of chicken when you order three.
No comment

My coworker and I came to try this restaurant this past Wednesday to place our order to go. We had been anxiously anticipating it's grand opening and it finally happened. We were so excited to try a new soul food restaurant, unfortunately it didn't hit the mark. The restaurant itself is very spacious and clean (2 thumps up for that). We ordered the 4 piece fried chicken meal with a side of collard greens. 2 orders of the fried catfish with 2 sides (I got the mac and cheese and potato salad, my coworker got the Mac and cheese with yams). All 3 meals came with a piece of cornbread. For dessert we ordered the peach cobbler. The fried catfish and the chicken we felt were well seasoned and crispy, which is a plus. All the sides were mediocre, with the exception of the yams which were yamming according to my coworker lol. The cornbread was moist and on the sweet side which I did like. Lastly our peach cobbler dessert was pretty good, we just felt it needed more of the crust. Overall, I gave this restaurant a solid 3 and will probably not be returning anytime soon. Our grand total came to $82.65 for a to go order, which it's very pricey for the amount of food we received. This is also in consideration of their nearby competition, which offers so much more for less $.
No comment

The fried catfish was so well seasoned and crispy on the outside yet so moist and delicious on the inside as well. The fried chicken was so good. I don't usually do breast because It is usually dry, not this chicken breast. My fingers was wet from moisture when I took a piece off. The sides was absolutely delicious  . Not crowded inside so we were able to eat inside. The lines did get packed with to go orders, but the staff took care of it so quick it was amazing. Our server Elijah made sure we had everything we needed while we were there. Oh and we did order food to go home with too. We will make another trip from Westchester County to Brooklyn real soon

Ok let me start by saying Sunday brunch is put on by a very popular promoter and therefore the wait times are probably not the norm on a regular day. BUT, upon arrival there is no one who checks for your reservation. I walked inside to find the host to find out where we could sit. The promoter of the event (whom I know) advised me I could sit anywhere I wanted to outside. This was a B.Y.O.C. event but the wait for a server to come over and take our order was approx 30min. Had it not been for the vibes and the anticipation for the food, we probably would have left. But again, it's a Sunday brunch event with lots of people. When the server finally took our order, it took about 20min for the food to come. But where it did .....BAAAAAAABY it did not disappoint. I ordered the fried chicken, Mac n cheese, yams and rice with gravy and when I tell you the food was worth the wait. Geesh. My friend has the catfish, potato salad and greens; my other friend had the catfish Mac n cheese and yellow rice and after tasting their food, it was incredible too. The food here is so good. The cornbread was absolutely melt in your mouth good. If they could just fix the wait times, everything here would be perfect. So if you go on a Sunday, pack your patience and drink your champagne. I will definitely come back when there's no promoter on the door. We even had an opportunity to talk to the chef and we complimented him on his menu and tell him how good his food is. It's definitely a place I would come back too.

Yes it's great there everytime. They make you wait for a while but it's still worth the wait and they're very courteous and friendly. The food is good and it's always served warm and well prepared [though they may occasionally forget to bring you all of your orders] but it's excusable. But to sum it up if I had to give the restaurant it would at least have to be an 11 stars for the setting, environment, service and food and seating.

Food was good! Cornbread was some of the best I ever had. Portion sizes are also good. I had the ribs with yams super good. And another time I have turkey wings. They were sooo good seasoned perfectly.

I don't know where those other people ate at when they left those 5 star reviews? Im sorry it's over priced with under taste for me. I ordered 2, 3 piece fried chicken with 2 sides which were Mac and cheese and yams.I Also  ordered the turkey wings and turkey Garvey with white rice. Let me say for $25 for 3 piece and sides, at least give a nice size portion of chicken. The chicken they use looks like it's C or D grade because how small they are. The chicken is over fried . The only thing that was decent were the Mac and cheese, yams and the corn bread. The turkey wings gots to go! Whack! and the turkey gravy was whack as hell and the rice wasn't even cooked all the way. For $67 the only member of the family that will be enjoying this meal is my 8 pound Yorkie Butterz! I'm just disappointed because I just waned it to be good and finally find a good souls food restaurant in Brooklyn. Sorry guys.

Initially I came here after seeing a tik tok about it and idk if i was just so hungry that the food tasted delicious to me. Everything we had ordered was just so delicious! There was also some type of Auntie event going on so maybe they had someone back there throwing down in the kitchen. I then ordered from them off of Uber eats (one of them delivery apps) & the food was nasty. The waffle was NASTY, too dense and had no flavor. The collard greens are a NO , so is the cabbage. The Mac is okay and yams r cool too. White rice and gravy was good (I mean who can f*ck up rice) Fried chicken do be seasoned & the catfish as well. Ultimately I don't recommend as a place to go to but if u just happen to be hungry and u end up at this spot pick certain things to eat cause they ain't cheap
Ordered delivery for Christmas meal. Macaroni and cheese was spoiled. Never Again. Yuck.

Let's start by saying first time here out of town from Baltimore came to check out this soul food restaurant, parking wasn't hard to find street parking, Great customer service great welcome when you come in, not a huge menu but they pretty much have the true basics macaroni and cheese collard greens cabbage etc. I got the catfish with mac & cheese and yams which was pretty good the catfish was really good , and of course I had to judge the cornbread it's called cornbread so I would say I give it A  8 out of 10 when it comes to the cornbread, I got my food to go so I didn't get a chance to experience the dining in experience but they do have the option if you want, I would definitely go back try something different
No comment
Brandon was our Server. Food was amazing and came out in a timely manner. Staff is friendly and music is very good.
Food was great! Elijah did a great job, he was very attentive and made sure my order was correct!

Recommend by my girlfriend. Glad she made the recommendation! A bit of a wait but well worth it. Food was seasoned perfectly as the ancestors intended. Cornbread tastes like cake cornbread. I personally like it like that. Very moist. Sides were great too. Yellow rice was ok. Meal came out hot, as it should! Right out the hot grease/oven. Portions were great. Couldn't finish everything. Believe the hype!

Ordered from this place for the first time recently.  Thanks TikTok.  I had the fried chicken, mac and cheese and collard greens.  Everything was delicious!  The chicken was hot and crispy; which is rare with delivery.  I can't even imagine how fresh it must've been had I dined-in.  The mac and cheese and greens were really good as well.  Required minimal seasoning.  Cornbread was more cake-like, but very tasty.  Also had an Arnold Palmer which was good.  The only thing I didn't particularly care for was the peach cobbler.  It wasn't bad, just mid.  I really wanted to try the ribs, but there weren't as many reviews about them as with the fried chicken.  I'll def try them next time.

Friendly service, clean & spacious and most of all - delicious food! Had the catfish meal and the 3 piece chicken with mac & cheese, yams, yellow rice with gravy, and corn bread. Really large portions sizes and great flavor. Got the peach cobbler, but will have to save dor later. Also got the uptown and southern twang for drinks. They were little sweet for my taste, but it wouldn't be southern if it wasn't! Thank you Lala & team for the great service. Will definitely be back.
Ordered via UE. Catfish was delish as noted in reviews, collards were too. Cornbread was sweet and moist. Mac was ok. Will def stop in!

so it's Sunday and I'm starving I drive pass this place that looked good from the outside so I had to go in, it was empty which I loved I was hungry. The service was fast, Nicolette was my server she made sure I had all sauces I need and made sure I was enjoying my food I love when people like where they work. The food was amazing the fish was fried to perfection the baked Mac and cheese was a 10 the yams mouth watering. My boyfriend got the same thing but with the yellow rice and omg I want to eat all his rice. Definitely going back with a bigger crowd people need to know about this place!!!!
Bomb food. Great vibe. Extremely friendly staff.
Catfish was great, greens meh a bit salty and soggy also I waited 45 minutes for my food went to the front and found out they didn't start my order.....
Good food, service was excellent all the staff had good vibes and natural. The design and ambiance was cool too. Definitely would be back.

I've been meaning to sit and eat at this place for months because the outside is a fresh and welcoming look in the Crown Heights Neighborhood. This place didn't disappoint. Warm colors, spacious seating and the food and staff embodied southern comfort! The food is really good with satisfying portions! I would recommend this place to friends, family and the like. The name also didn't disappoint because the cornbread is a star. In addition, the waitstaff (Elijah was our server) was courteous and checked in with us to make sure we had everything we needed. 10 out of 10, will come again!

I've had a food from this location twice, today is my third so that is to say that I have no issues with the food the service on the other hand is a different issue. There is a specific female that works at this location that was extremely nasty and was not helpful when asked a question about an Uber eats pick up. This restaurant has potential and I would hate for customer service to be a downfall especially when the food is good. Please pull this young lady to the side and have a talk with her about how to talk to people who are respectfully asking questions to obtain their food. I'm sure she has done it to others.

Food and service was great. I had the Cat Fish and it was a little too salted. The Ambiance was comfortable. I believe they should have a visible manager, managing the lobby and seating area.

A gem! This is my second visit. The first was so great I had to bring a friend back. We both loved it! Food tasted great! Service was exceptional, from ordering to service while seated. Our server, La La, took care of everything we needed.

Phenomenal service and food. I was part of a large group and they promptly took our orders and served us just as fast! The food will blow you away! Definitely a must see and eat!!

the first time I ate here it was a really nice experience. I decided to stop in one night before going to work it was a bad decision i arrived before 9 didn't leave till 9:28. it went bad from I was having trouble with my card in the chip reader because I was inserting it the wrong way and one cashier had a issue with assisting another young lady came and I realized what I did wrong. our food order was missing waffles & chicken. we went back to the rep numerous times to tell them about missing food. the chef was told about the waffle but was conversating with a table in the dining area. everything was an issue asking for no ice in the drinks and the wait time was unbelievable
The food was so good. It was fresh and tasty. The only complaint was GrubHub. They should consider a better food delivery service.

The food is tasty. I'm very picky with fried chicken. Their fried chicken is delicious. The potato salad isn't my grandmother's but it's tasty. The turkey wings are soooo good. So is the baked chicken. They give adult-sized portions. I was expecting one turkey wing. They have me 3. Their cobblers aren't the best. If you're expecting Nana's, don't. If you have a sweet tooth, it will help. Other than that, the pies are mediocre. It's missing something. The cornbread is all things goodness. I am a regular here via takeout.

This Is Some Of The Best Soul Food I've Had In A While. Been Looking For A Good Soul Food Spot For  & I Found It. I Ordered The Turkey Wing Dinner With Mac & Cabbage & Babeee! Food Was Great, Atmosphere Great, Prices Great & Customer Service On Point. Absolutely No Attitude With My Food, Just The Way I Like It. Great Job. My New Fave Spot!
All u can say about this spot is make sure u double up on ur order. It's that good. Best thing they could have put here

Food was delicious, beautiful space and Monae our server was great. It's not your typical dine in. You order with a cashier and are given a table number and the food is brought to the table. This is a great way to go out with friends and have everyone pay for their own food as well.
Food was overpriced. Hiring had no flavor. Also wait time was kind of long. Also dining room wasn't cleaned often
So amazingly good! I dream about returning! The cornbread and chicken and waffles were great!

I visited this restaurant with some family members on Thursday, and we all had a good time. The food, service and the atmosphere was very nice. We met one of the chefs, Dwayne he was very pleasant he came and spoke to us at the table and Justin from the cashier was very friendly. Our waitress ??? was very accommodating, but I didn't catch her name. She was a slender  Afro American woman with short natural braids under her hair net. I look forward to returning to this restaurant

Okay. I must start this by saying I'm Black American with roots in Virginia, but born and raised here in nyc. Finding a good soul food spot in NYC is not an easy feat. This spot right here? You can smell the food from Bedford before you even walk in the door. They got Cheryl Lynn and El Debarge playing, like you know what ya mama put on when she about to fry some good chicken... and that's exactly what it was, some good chicken! We enjoyed our food, including black eyed peas, collards, yams, uptown(Arnold Palmer), lemonade, and apple cobbler. What they're most known for is their cornbread... I don't like cornbread but thoroughly enjoyed theirs. It's moist, buttery, sweet. The staff was warm and so kind. Please go support them. I'll be back for sure!
Brandon customer service guru. He's polite, courteous, very attentive, inviting, welcoming. Smiling all the time. He didn't miss a beat. Brandon we need more ppl like you. You'll be missed.
No comment
No comment

The food was great, music was nice, and very friendly staff! I will definitely be coming back the food was well seasoned and definitely worth it. Only negative I had was the slippery floors but other than that I really enjoyed my time there :)
No comment

I was excited to try this restaurant after driving past several times but was totally disappointed. The whiting was frozen bagged whiting i could have bought from the supermarket. And it was overcooked and dry. The gravy on the rice was salty and the mac and cheese was not good. The only redeemable thing was the iced tea and cornbread. Farm to Soul fraud.

Nah listen...this is literally THE BEST soul food I've had in my entire life!!! Lachelle & Justin were so amazing and helpful. They both suggested I try the peach cobbler and it was sooooo good!!! Y'all absolutely need to try it, you won't be disappointed at alllllll!
Food was hot and delicious; staff is very friendly and attentive especially Charen & Elijah.

Just ordered via Grubhub for pickup and waited about 90 minutes for two orders of fried chicken with mac n cheese and collard greens. The restaurant was busy chaos and very badly organized. The manager, Adinah repeatedly apologized for a catering ordering that should have been ready for pickup but was not even prepared. Over an hour after I got the Grubhub message that my order was ready, I finally hear my name, only to see that only one order is ready. When I asked about the 2nd order, the girl asked if the order was for me and if I wanted to wait for it as if the two items had not been placed in the same order and I proceeded to wait another 15 minutes for it.  It seems that orders via this type of app are pushed off to the back of the line and not serviced in the order received.   Overall, this place has potential and has decent food but the service is extremely disorganized and just not worth the inconvenience.  I will not return in the future unless I hear this situation has improved.

The service here is great. Everyone was very attentive, friendly and helpful. The restaurant is extremely spacious and clean. Good for small groups. I ordered catfish with Mac and cabbage, and turkey wings with Mac and yams. The catfish was fried very lightly and was a bit slimy and the turkey wings were tough. The seasonings were done right. I probably wouldn't come back for any mains. The sides were pretty good. The uptown drink was delicious.

Black own soul food  business in Crown Heights nice. Let's start from the beginning when you first come in, you have to order your food on the Kiosk and today guess what you can't pay with your card on the Kiosk. Ooh yea staff is not the friendliest, the kiosk not taking card payments is not the customer fault truth be told its no one fault. I said that to say the woman with the dreadlocks let's say don't have a pleasant attitude.  Now on to the food  DELICIOUS well seasoned, they give you the right portion of food. I will be returning back multiple times and I'm telling everybody to go.  The only thing I would change about the Turkey wings is that they have an option of smothered Turkey wings. I highly recommend this place...

Food just sit there for mad long before one of the employees packs it, about 10 minutes just sitting on the counter !!! In front of us ! Food is good but the experience of getting it isn't!! This happens like every time we come here too smh........

Food is really good!! But the people that work there are not well trained. We've eaten there a few times and they really don't create a pleasant atmosphere. We only do take out because of this.  But the food is really good, so I do recommend it for that only.
No comment

My dining experience at cornbread farm to table was amazing. Shout out to X who responded to my minor issue with the best customer service and care. If everyone had the same regard for their customers like X did for us the food industry would flourish. Thank you X for the amazing customer service and food. Best catfish ever!!

Cornbread Brooklyn was delish! I got the baked chicken and it was super moist. The tender meat slid off the bone when I dug into it with my fork. It didn't taste too salty. The cornbread was not dry and tasted just right with enough sweetness. Out waitress LaLa was sweet and friendly. She checked on our food and was very accommodating when needed help with the beverage fountain. I would surely come back and bring my kids here. I even ordered two meals to go for tonight's dinner.

I'm always looking for a good (Real) soul food restaurant. Real for me is southern cooks from the south. The food was tasty, I just have a problem with half a fish for $13.99 and one side. The ppl that work there are friendly, no attitudes. The yams are sweet potatoes sprinkled with a little seasoning, not candied. The collards were good, my catfish was a lil wet for me, I like crispy. It's just a matter of preference, all in all, I would definitely go back and try other foods on the menu. The restaurant is CLEAN, that's a major concern for me.
No comment

I want to love this spot and see it WIN Big but I've been there 3 times , the friendliest place so far (customer service)  but when you run out of Yams during brunch and it was 3:30 I was annoyed. There seems to be a disconnect between the counter personnel the ordering transition was not smooth not horrendous (needs improvement ) .  Once again the catfish- amazing, yams - amazing.. BUT there is a breakdown in the matrix. I want them to win & have nothing but exciting great things happening..improvement needed in the restaurant work flow
Within 2 weeks of first opening I ordered from this place 4 times , they are respectful and kind
No comment
The food is awesome and flavorful. Eli was a great server for our table and very attentive.

This place is a 10000/10. They have delicious food and amazing service! The staff was sooo good to us! Donna helped us out while we were ordering and and she was so sweet! She went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meals. Tyree, the chef, really did THAT. We ordered a little bit of everything on the menu and everything was sooo spectacular. Like I cannot describe the flavor, the crispness, the juiciness, the tenderness, just everything it was supposed to be, it was. I would HIGHLY recommend this spot if you're in the area! Definitely get the uptown to drink!!!
No comment
Excellent! Tried out this new spot and it was great. I've been looking for a go to soul food spot and I think we have found it. We had the catfish and it was two thumbs up!
The chicken was dry. Not a little dry...very,very dry. Potato salad had little flavor. The cornbread was good - sweet and a little crispy on top.
No comment
No comment
Found this place from Tik Tok.! Food is good and service is amazing.! Nikki was awesome.!

I've been to this restaurant numerous of times and haven't had any complaints. Usually I'll get the fried chicken or cat fish (Delicious). Today I decided to try something different so I got the whiting fish. It was mediocre and unacceptable for $23

This place is clean and the ambiance is so comforting. The staff is so friendly, Donna was our server- she made the experience soooo welcoming and checked on us several times to make sure everything was good. And it was- the food was served hot and seasoned to perfection. Will definitely be returning to dine here again. 5 Stars
No comment

First time dining at Cornbread Brooklyn.   The food is absolutely delicious... Met the owner who is very warm with a familial vibe and the staff (especially Brandon) is very friendly and hospitable!  Get your soul in at Cornbread Brooklyn -- you'll be happy you did!
Yum!!! That's all I can say. Food is great, staff is amazing - Photo helped me my first time there and I appreciate her! Clean location. Amazing spot!! Check it out!!

I saw this spot on Instagram. Decided to give it a try and I'm so happy I did. Literally everything I tried was amazing. But the cornbread, the cornbread was absolutely phenomenal! I had the fried chicken with 2 sides. The Mac & Cheese was mouth watering . It was filled with flavory goodness. The potato salad had potatoes and wasn't filled with just onions which I appreciated! Don't let me get started on the Southern Twang juice you have to try it. If you don't do anything else stop and give them a try because I promise you won't be disappointed!! Now let's talk about the staff. They greeted me with smiles and warmness. I asked for his recommendation and he gave me a suggestion (catfish) which I will be sure to try next time.  The chef even walked by and greeted me with a hello and a smile. This establishment was clean and friendly and I have to say 5 stars all around! I will be back with my family next time because they have to try this!
This Restaraunt is Absolutely AMAZING , Special S.Os to Hailey who took care of me and was extra patient with every guest. Please Go Here I Highly Recommend .
No comment

Visited this place on vacation and it has been the highlight of this trip so far! Food was absolutely amazing and somehow the service was just as amazing! The employees took amazing care of us and made sure we were completely satisfied. Thanks Donna and Tyree for the awesome experience. We will be back in real soon!
Amazing food and service! So happy that we found this gem while driving down Eastern Parkway. The food was so good we arrived right when they opened on Saturday.
No comment

Mediocre. The catfish & chicken were cooked well & nice & crispy but the quality of the meat itself was low. We had the collard greens & yams & they tasted like they were out of a can. The cornbread was good though.

We've going here for a few months (since it opened) and the food is always great. My kids love the mac and cheese, cornbread, and lemonade, and have become fans of the fried chicken as well. I'm also partial to the yams. But they have doubled down on service and the food comes out really quickly. Def a go-to spot for soul food.
No comment
The food was soo good!! Would definitely recommend! Great southern cooking in New York. a lil pricey but worth it.
Food was amazing, this is my second time in 3 days and I leave to go home today but I had to stop by.  This place is amazing and so is Monea, so make sure you ask for her!

I seen this restaurant on tic toc. So I decided to check it out with my girlfriend. It's a great atmosphere very clean everyone is so nice and very helpful. You can order on a screen when you walk in and you can choose to sit down or to go. And they will bring the food to you. No complaints from me.only thing it not happy with is the 12oz drinks. To small for me. Please make larger drinks.

Soooo I kept seeing this restaurant on TikTok and had to give it a try. Let me say on the walk in everyone was very welcoming. The music was also a vibe. I had to try the catfish with Mac n cheese and yams, which automatically comes with cornbread. When I say everything was a 10/10... and for the drink I had an uptown ( half n half) definitely a good choice. Everything was fresh and did not disappoint. I'll be back each trip to bk. Service was also 10/10. Didn't wanna eat all my food so I asked for a to go box so I can enjoy the rest at home lol. This is definitely a Gem in Brooklyn. A must try
Good fried chicken and collards and mac and cheese. Very happy to have a new spot so close.

I did NOT like this food at all. The yams were over cooked like they came out of a microwave. The Mac and cheese had no cheese and was crunchy. The ribs were tough and the sauce was flavorless. Not to mention it a very expensive. Oh and the CORNBREAD was dry and bland! Save you money! Go to Royal Ribs House instead !!!

I'm a black American patron at your restaurant.  I've been to both locations in NJ, NEWARK & Maplewood.  I'm very disappointed with my last order. I ordered 2 baked chicken meals and the seasoning was not like its been when i first came to the Brooklyn location. It has a Caribbean seasoning to it and that's not what it's supposed to taste like and it's definitely not what i wanted to pay for. No offense to the Caribbean seasoning of their food, but I'm a black American and i was looking forward to having soulfood. Whoever seasoned this baked chicken when i last was there needs to stick to the original ingredients. Please. I have referred many of my friends, coworkers  etc on how great the food is there  and how delicious the cornbread is and i was very disappointed in that as well. It was over cooked and hard.  Not tasty at all. Please keep the place on its original track. We need the soulfoood in Brooklyn.

I went back for more delicious food me and my family and was greeted by Photo what a lovely person and we were the last customers and service with a smile hard working employee thank you so much food was delicious as always. See you soon the Brown family
The food was cool.. music had me in a feel good vibe .. but our waitress monea was attentive, patient and a warming spirit. Thank you for your making our experience a memorable one
Food was great and the customer service (Monea and staff) was even better!  I will definitely visit again!

Great food and service. I had the ribs with collard greens and yams. I love the large portions. The service was awesome. Thumbs up to Elijah and Sharen for their great service! They definitely made my visit enjoyable and I will be back again.

Upon walking in, the ambiance feels like your grandmothers house on thanksgiving!!! I had the turkey wings with black eyed peas, macaroni and cheese with their white rice and gravy. EVERYTHING was a 10/10!!! My entire party was so stuffed we immediately went home and took naps!
Elijah was my server and he was amazing! I had the Mac and cheese and it was great. I'm from the South so this restaurant reminded me of home. so glad it's near my home will 100% be coming back!

Found this place on IG and decided to have lunch here and the food is delicious! Had the pleasure of meeting the owner also! The "uptown", a non-alcoholic drink, was amazing I think its 80% Lemonade and 20% sweet tea! Addictive as hell! The staff was very patient and polite as well! I have definitely found my new go-to spot for lunch! Worth every penny!

I was so excited to see a new Black Owned business pop up in Brooklyn. Cornbread was definitely an experience...a true millennial restaurant with order kiosks. Real easy to use/order but the staff couldn't keep up with the incoming orders! Iced tea - none, lemonade - almost done, and to top it off we left with our food and DIDN'T GET ANY CORNBREAD WITH OUR $80 orders!!!! Overall food and decor was good just need a redo of the order and delivery process.
No comment
The food was so good and flavorful. I ordered the catfish, Mac and cheese and greens. I wish I had a picture to share. I will definitely recommend this restaurant.
Food and service the best I've had in a long time! The wait was a little long but we'll worth it. Don't leave without having the collard greens and don't forget the peach cobbler for dessert!

This is good solid comfort food. It hit the spot for a quick, easy dinner pick up on the way home. The space is cool and contemporary with nice booth tables. Would also consider for a casual dinner with a neighborhood friend.

My husband and I have visited this location about three times. The food has always been good, but the customer service could use improving. The last time we were there (9/30) I had to ask two workers three times to clean off the table.  Food was cold, but the did change it. Even with good food, Excellent customer service is important to me.

I've been to this restaurant @ least 5 times. The food is consistently DELICIOUS, especially the fried chicken. I love that the pieces are a normal size and not those gigantic pieces which makes them more flavorful. I haven't tried all of the sides but the mac n cheese, collards and potato salad get good marks. Brought some cornbread home....can't wait to have it with some coffee!

The food is tasty. The price is reasonable our waiter ELIJAH was the best. Great customer service. Music is great..everything about cornbread was good. The fish. Chicken, turkey wings, yams, potatoes salad, rice collard greens

The chicken was good, but the mac & cheese needed work. Although if I got it hot, it might be a little better. Unfortunately, the management needs to fix their process of getting the food to their customers. It was just chaos. It was a ball of confusion, but the workers seemed nice, so it was not their fault; is managements fault. They need training.

Two nights in a row, we ordered meals. Both nights the delivery driver arrived and the restaurant didn't have the order. Both nights we never got the food. Don't order from here if you're hungry. Too bad, was looking forward to trying it:(
Great service. Food was hot. Catfish PoBoy seasoned well. Just opened on Eastern Parkway & Bedford. Definitely worthwhile trip.

Food was great and matched perfectly with the restaurant's setting. Tasha (new member) was our server and she was friendly, courteous, patient, and professional. I had a great experience and will be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with a group of colleagues for lunch during workday at around 12pm. We made a reservation however it was empty at 12pm. I got here earlier but the staff was friendly and let us in before business hours. Interior design was pretty pretty and classy.  This was my second time here, last time I came here for dinner and I had a great impression. Came here again and ordered the oxtail quesadillas. The meat was soft, juicy and not over cooked. They marinated pretty well. However, didn't know the serving size was this small, only two small pieces compared to other regular quesadillas. I wasn't full after the two small pieces, wish they indicated how small/how many pieces the order came with on the menu so I could order more next time. However, I recommend this restaurant!
No comment
No comment

Mixed reviews.  The food was excellent!  I had the guacamole and the chicken tacos.  My issue was  with my server.  When I first sat down at the patio, she told me that it was Happy Hour and instructed me to. Order off of the specials listed there for a discount.  Upon receiving my bill, I noticed I was charged full price.  When I asked my server she said that she was new and that the Happy Hour price did not extend to where I was seated, so she charged me full price for everything with the exception of 1 drink.  I don't mind paying full price, but this is something she should have informed me of DURING my meal and not when I questioned the bill.  Very unprofessional.
No comment
No comment

Food was good but not great. Ox tail birria tacos were good, but wish there was more flavor/seasoning & less oily. Also got some guacamole and chips which did taste very fresh, but lacking flavor. Happy hour drinks were a great deal! My friends and I got multiple plates and enjoyed the vibes (great music). Would definitely come back for happy hour but probably go elsewhere for tacos.
No comment

Great pre-show dinner at Las Santas last night. We were in and out in an hour and never felt rushed. We ordered the guacamole and chips (delicious and creamy) and I had the Caesar salad with shrimp, which was a healthy portion and perfectly dressed. Definitely will be my go-to before the next BAM outing.

For a quick yet delicious small plates, come to this place. The food is delicious and not rushed. Came to this place for a quick bite and had to see a show at BAM at 730PM, and the staff was accommodating and friendly.  Will come back to this place definitely!
No comment

This was my second time coming to this restaurant and it was just as delicious as the 1st time. My friend and I shared and enjoyed the pork, steak and fish tacos with a side of fresh chips and guacamole. I'm a sucker for frozen drinks so I ordered the Prickly Pear frozen margarita and it was delicious while my friend ordered the Rompe Corazon which he enjoyed. I definitely recommend giving this restaurant a go. The atmosphere and vibes are nice trust me you'll enjoy it.
No comment
When I got my food the proportions were really small but the food was amazing especially the sauces. Those made the whole meal enjoyable and not so upsetting about the small portions.

The food is not so great here & neither r the drinks. I think the busy downtown crowd overwhelms the establishment. I came for HH, ordered on margarita on the rocks & empanadas, $10 each. I wish I took the pic of the empanadas, they were small and unflavored. The margarita was ok.. probably wouldn't come back for HH or any other time.
No comment
No comment
Food and service is excellent! Beautiful intimate setting with a tropical vibe! Rib Eye Churrasco was tasty and cooked just right! Churros was a perfect ending! And washed it down with a Sangria!

Delicious food at pretty high prices TBH. The upside is that the interior is beautiful (especially the "outdoor" indoor patio outside the restaurant, and no one else was inside the restaurant the entire time we were there... (we ate at 5 pm on a Friday evening)... The cocktails were strong, which was a plus. They did forget one of our items (an app), however they caught the error themselves and asked if we still wanted it served prior to removing it from our check, which was gracious of them. Overall, probably won't be back, but a solid choice in the Fulton St area.
No comment

Came for brunch with a friend and there's a brunch menu but their dinner menu is available all day which is why I got fish tacos! I also appreciate their mocktails selection which had actual pineapple fruit in the drink. Overall, it was great enjoying the food and their outdoor space is great!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fun ambiance, great service, and delicious drinks! The food was just ok. The carne asada tacos were very cheesy but the steak was overcooked. The mole sauce was overwhelmingly smokey.

I know I came here just a few months ago but I feel like giving an update. When I came last time, it was for taco Tuesday and I definitely thought that this place gave off date night vibes. My bf wanted to take me out for my birthday so I chose Las Santas. I made reservations just in case--I don't think it's necessary to but I don't think we would have gotten the seats we did if I didn't. I liked our seating--we could sit next to each other rather than facing each other. It reminded me of that movie "Date Night" with Tiny Fey. Anyway, we were promptly seated. Our server came to take our drink and appetizer orders. I knew there was a drink called Not a Piña Colada but I didn't see it listed--it turns out that they took it off the menu but they still made it for my bf. I got the Rosada Negra--it's frozen and delicious (after taking a sip of my bf's drink, I decided to get one for myself). For appetizers, we got the chips and salsa and coconut shrimp. I like that they give a variety of salsas and the chips were not too salty. My bf was all over the coconut shrimp. For entrees, I got the churrasco with yucca fries and avocado salad and he got the salmon with truffle mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes and Okinawa mashed purple potatoes. My steak was cooked perfectly and the salmon was really good. I had a good time like the first time--it's a great place for drinks or a date night.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was a very cool place! The inside is very neat and chique, with dimmed lights and really queues a nice environment. The staff was nice and friendly and the food was delicious! I got the steak fajitas and the steak was cook beautifully- it was truly great.

very rude service. I just went there for lunch, I want to order my food, but the waiter ignored me, I call him "excuse me " a few time, he never answers, never come, there only one table customer there, and they already ordered food. I am the only one there and no body take care me because I am Chinese! I will never go there anymore

The ambiance of this place is fantastic. Behind the curtains is the indoor seating, which was beautiful. We each had the 3 tacos for $10. My fish tacos were great. My husband said his carne tacos were just ok. The nachos were truly the best nachos I've ever had. The pickled onions and jalapeños on top were the perfect flavor. We had the chorizo on the side for my husband, and he ate it all. There's no kids menu, but the setting is completely appropriate for kids, as long as they are pretty mellow. Mine is used to restaurants, so he was good to go. He had the cheese quesadilla, which came with some beans inside and was really delicious. Would absolutely recommend this place.

I was excited to try this place but was pretty disappointed. Staff was kind and relatively attentive but twice went to take away our plates before we were done. Ordered the spritzes with our brunch food and it was definitely flat not bubbly. (For how many amazing drink reviews are on here I was fully surprised how not good our spritzes were) Food came out so fast we didn't have time to hang out really. Space is suuuuuuuper cute though I will give them that and the food was decent. Not my favorite experience but not the worst, therefore, 3 stars.

Mexican spot with good food and good drinks, was able to come at 730pm on a friday and immediately be seated, which was nice. Food was tasty but didn't feel worth what I paid in my opinion. The burrito says "$16", but then you have to pay an extra $6-8 to add meat, so I expected a lot out of this burrito. All that for a burrito, I still ordered it hoping I would be overstuffed but it was much smaller than I expected, like the size of a wrap. What I especially didn't like was after paying $22, I asked if I could have any sort of hot sauce/salsa for the burrito, as most places automatically serve, they charged extra for that too! It definitely was a tasty meal but overpriced to me.
No comment
What a wonderful place to eat! For a busy night, the service was fairly good. Try the fish tacos  YUMMY

I came here with some friends right before a basketball game. I had high expectations for this place due to the reviews but unfortunately, I was really disappointed! I got the fish tacos and they were too salty. I definitely liked the atmosphere of this place! The inside was super dim. However, I will probably not be returning.
No comment

Eh, don't come here if you were looking for spicy Mexican food.. waitress wassssss not helpful and didn't check in with us nearly ever I had to flag her down every time we needed things. Food was aight but I was starving so

Las Santas mushroom tacos might be the best mushrooms tacos I've ever had. They are deliciously savory! I love the seasoning/marinate that they put on the mushrooms and you can't beat 3 tacos for $10 for taco Tuesday. Not only was the food amazing, but our waiter was such a great host. She was very attentive but gave us room to eat. The decor also made you feel like you were getting a full 360 dining experience. I would 100% recommend and will be coming back!
No comment
No comment
I loved the food, although the portions could've been better for the price. I liked our service. The ambiance and view of the street was nice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stepped inside of due to it being happy hour after the week I had I definitely needed a drink. The atmosphere of this place is amazing. Great decor, music selection. The menus are digital, the food is amazing though I only had multiple orders of the nachos (steak Nachos to be exact) I definitely plan on returning to this spot on another day.
No comment
No comment

Near BAM, tucked away on a side street. I went on a weeknight and it felt empty (but the place is, to be fair, huge). The food was surprisingly good! I suspect this place fills up on weekends and does a lot of local parties.

Ambiance was chefs kiss, the food was ehhhhh. One word flavorless. With this intimate, rich setting I was hoping to receive the same warmth as I walked in with my cuisine. Unfortunately that wasn't the case, though presentation was nice the food was pretty cold on Taco Tuesday and lacked the umami and spice I love from Mexican cuisine. I'm not sure if it was a bad day. I'll give it more shot but it for certain is not my go to for Mexican. On the upside drinks were an A++
1st time visiting this restaurant and the service was great. The food was great. The vibe was great.

If you are in the mood for good authentic Mexican food and want an awesome aesthetic this is your spot. Perfect for a date night! The decor is beautiful and there is even a banner hanging in the back that is perfect for taking pictures for your Instagram. The food was delicious. I suggest the coconut shrimp. Not a lot of batter but all the flavors of your typical coconut shrimp. My only issue was there was no waiters. The same person that greeted us at the door also took orders for all the tables. The poor guy was running around like a chicken with no head but he was able to make it work. Very friendly and sweet but they need to hire more staff.

I came in for lunch and will be back! This is an awesome restaurant. Great decor. Plenty of seating both inside and outside. Nice attentive service. Yummy food!! I ordered the coconut shrimp (great for sharing but you may not want to because it's so good) so hot and crispy and flavorful! I honestly could have ordered another plate of coconut shrimp for my entree, but I had the Pescado mini tacos instead (also yummy, but not a hot or crispy because of all the topping). Wish I had room for dessert. I bet Happy Hour and Taco Tuesday is amazing as well!!!
birriah quesadilla were so good i loved them. great service and cute cups! food came fast
The skirt steak queso fondido and tacos were amazing. The drinks were perfectly balanced, service was ok. We overall enjoyed our lunch here, thank you. My husband also really like the decor

I went on a couple's brunch since they had bottomless mimosas. When we arrived it took about 5 minutes before a host greeted us. When we were seated and placed our drinks, we were told that for us to get bottomless mimosas, everyone at the table had to get mimosas, which was a bummer.  As for the food, we ordered shrimp & crab empanadas, chicken chilaquiles, coconut shrimp, chicken quesadillas, steak and eggs. The coconut shrimp was my fave but did not taste much like coconut but more of a light flour beer batter.  The shrimp and crab empanadas were ok but I did not like the dough. It was made out of yucca and not your typical pastry puff dough. Overall the food was ok. As for the drinks, we had a couple of mimosas, long island iced tea, and mint mojitos which were all well-made drinks.
The shots are double poured! great value and good seating with outdoor and indoor options perfect for a warm day. music volume was great.
No comment
No comment

Great place to grab brunch before a show at BAM. We sat outside on their patio and enjoyed the space. We ordered the queso and ran out of tortillas but they were able to bring us some more to enjoy all of the delicious cheesey goodness. The brunch plates were very substantial as well, I left quite full.
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's Different Here Now. Drinks Are Good But The Food I Promise You Can Pass Especially With The Price
The food here is absolutely fantastic! Everything we ate was delicious. They have a lovely bar area as well as a more formal dining room. The staff is wonderful and attentive. Highly recommend.
The food was good, service was unmatched very attentive and the drinks are to die for. I would def recommend and visit again as well.Coconut Shrimp Churrasco
No comment
No comment
This place was great to have friends and family. The Food and drinks were awesome yhe services were great differently coming back to this restaurant indeed The chef did fantastic job .

It's hard for me to rate this place, because I'd probably be happier if I went with a different entree. I had the "mole de oaxaca" enchiladas. The mole sauce was so smoky and there was so much of it that it completely overwhelmed the dish. I found it hard to eat. The drinks & ambiance were great as was the service. I heard the fajitas were good. I'd give this place another try.
Great food and drinks.  Nice atmosphere for a group or private meal. Coconut margaritas are everything
Great ambience, great service & food/drink was amazing! We got the chicken quesadilla, and nachos. Margaritas were soo good!
No comment

Really wanted to like this place. The location is great and central to transportation and the space is nice   If you're looking to have drinks for happy hour this is your spot. If you're looking to have dinner this is not your place. The guacamole was cold and pre made looked more like a mousse or something you buy prepackaged in a store than something that is made in house for a Mexican themed restaurant. The sangria was watery and had more ice than sangria the liquor was almost non existent in the pitcher ($45) definitely not worth the price for the quality that was served. The pros - service was fast and attentive the staff was friendly. Will return only for happy hour (ie beer or wine but def not a cocktail bc likely expect it'll be watered down).

New Menu item alert!! This delicious rainbow colored "Elote" is actually ICECREAM and churros at the bottom. It is drizzled with caramel on the the bottom. It is the most exquisite dessert I have ever tasted! If you don't see it on the menu, ask. It just came out yesterday. It tastes like heaven. I couldn't understand why the corn was a dessert until I put my spoon in it and it tasted like heaven. I also had the carnita burrito which was satisfying as well.
No comment

Such a great place after getting off an airplane. The vibe is upbeat and there is great outdoor seating for small and larger groups. They were accommodating to my allergies and was an overall great experience!

Nice spot with plenty of outdoor seating although it's in a very noisy and busy area. Inside is also very nicely decorated. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Tacos here are amazing , chicken is shredded and very juicy (my favorite ) Summer guacamole with pomegranate is so delicious although now it's off their winter menu. I would NOT order anything off the happy hour or taco Tuesday menu as prices are just $1-2 less and portion is way smaller.
The food is great (so many salsas!) and we had a wonderful server, Evelyn, who really went the extra mile for us. Convenient to BAM and Barclay Center. Will definitely come back

The food was so good!!!! We were a party of 5, and each of us ordered different things. We had shishito peppers, nachos, enchiladas de pollo, churrasco, salmon, baja fish tacos, and churros for dessert. Everything was so delicious! Service was great, and so was the ambiance. It is beautiful and spacious inside. I would highly recommend this place, and will definitely back again for date night.
No comment
No comment
Excellent unusual Mexican food and cocktails, chic ambience. A bit pricey. Bern there twice, will go again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Visited this restaurant during the week, food and drinks were good, service okay. Unfortunately i'm always out with the family and they only offer happy  hour prices at the bar. Makes it hard for people with kids to go to this place, means we have to pay more.
No comment

Daniela was phenomenal. Worked very hard to service nearly every table in site. However the reality is we waited 10 minutes to get water and give our order. The manager with the suit coat and nice elbow pads sat at the bar and saw us but seemed to do nothing. Food was expensive given portion size. Perhaps they should have the manager do something besides sitting at the bar.
No comment

Arrived at nearby hotel late, walked to restaurant on a Friday night after 10 and were quickly seated.   Several large groups celebrating and it was nice to see so many people enjoying themselves.   Had to scan menu, service was good and efficient.  Food portions were small but everything we ordered was flavorful and high quality.

Came here for dinner on Sunday night recently and really enjoyed my experience! The restaurant was not at all crowded and our waitress was very attentive. The guacamole was great, had a nice kick to it and came with lots of chips. I ordered the shrimp tacos and my friend got the chorizo and potato tacos -- both were delicious! Highly recommend this place for the great food, ambiance and service.

Such a great experience! First time visiting and we will be back. We ordered the guac as an appetizer as well as the corn off the cob. Two drinks included the margarita and the white sangria. All in all great experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I just love it here, especially for happy hour at the bar. The drinks are strong, the tacos are awesome (and cheap on Tuesdays!). You can sit in the back for a more serious vibe, but I love to post up at the bar or in the outdoor seating. Also, everyone who works here is SUPER nice. I've taken a lot of friends here and they always come away saying they love it.

Great staff specially the manager Jay, the food is amazing, the decor is so beautiful, I'd definitely recommend this place for everyone who loves Mexican modern and innovative food, I can't wait to come back again ...

I came here for a quick dinner since I was in the mood for tacos. The host is really nice and I was seated quickly. I ordered mezcalita, pescado taco, carne asada tacos and tortilla soup. Everything was good but soup in particular was my favorite. I finished up with the home made churros. I'd definitely come back.
Forgot to mention that they also have an amazing happy hour. went back and got their $10 taco / quesadilla sets and can't wait to try their drinks!!

Came back here for dinner and again had an excellent experience. Started off with their mezcal mule, which was nice and smoky, a cool twist. Our table split the guac and queso to start. Guac was great, and they even give you fresh jalapeños so you can control spice level. Queso was delicious, huge chunks of chorizo and great flavor. It can get a bit tough to get a good dip as chips tend to break and cheese sticks together so you'll want to have fork and knife handy. Then I tried the cucumber mezcal which was even better than the mule. Super refreshing taste. Finally the star of the meal was the fajitas. I split a shrimp and chicken combined platter which was over flowing with huge pieces of shrimp and chicken, all super flavorful. Had an absolutely great meal, loved the environment and the TVs playing NBA and NHL playoff games and the DJ. Need to come back and try brunch sometime.

I came to this restaurant a couple weeks ago for a last minute date night with my husband and we had such an amazing experience ! I loved the  summer guacamole with chips ! It was so fresh and flavorful. My husband had the coconut shrimp and the chicken tacos and I had the Baja tacos. I love the fact that they have mocktails on the menu especially being a pregnant and my husband got the  Phoenix Paloma and it was strong the way he likes it. The ambiance is perfect for a date night and they have indoor and outdoor seating . Service was so quick which I really appreciated and restaurant manager, servers , everyone was so kind ! I will definitely be back

Only go here for drinks and chips and guacamole. Everything else is expensive and sub par. Tuna crude was old and coconut shrimp appeared so dirty that they replaced it. Our waiter also only checked on us when we waved him over. I would not recommend for anything other than margs and bar apps.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've lived in NY for 5 years and this was the worst meal and service I have ever had. No one checked in on us for 40 minutes - food came out cold, with hair, and under seasoned. To mend the issue, they brought out " hotter" food then charged us for multiple entrees. In addition, the drinks were pure sugar.

Decided to stop by this place when I was in the area and it did not disappoint. Great vibe and service. Was impressed that our guac appetizer arrived at the table while the waitress was still taking our order. The food and drinks were tasty as well.
Everything was amazing! Good, service, music! All on point. Our server, Vicente, was sooooo great with recommendations and he's hospitality! 1000% recommend!
No comment

I've been here with my husband, and it's simply one of the best spot to get real Mexican food. Recently, we made the choice to go out for breakfast. We were utterly astounded by the excellent and fantastic cuisine. Quesadillas and tacos were served to us. It had a lot of flavor and was delicious. The flavors had a good balance. The service was outstanding. My wife and I had a great day here and loved the cuisine.
Food is sub-par, drinks are decent but service is questionable. I do not recommend dining here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a decent Mexican restaurant and the food were well-cooked and prepare so much good. The food is really delicious and has so many wonderful great options. I love the tacos and Churros here, which taste so good. Their Tacos has casual flavor but it taste really so fantastic. The portion were reasonably great and the price was not that really high. The service is so good.
Nice date night ambiance! Staff was friendly and provided great customer service. Food was OK; tried guacamole, yucca fries, coconut shrimp.
No comment
So Far so great... taco Tuesday margaritas and $9 shots of patron. Bartender/ server named C really cared about our happiness! Thanks C!

This place is a vibe for happy hour and their happy hour is nice and long. Good prices, on a good menu with great food. Never had a mushroom taco before I came here but this place gave me the best introduction.

If you like mezcal, this is good go-to at night. Most of their cocktails on their evening menu have mezcal. My friend and I liked the drinks we tried. I've also been here for afternoon/brunch cocktails. Their drinks are refreshing to have in the humidity, but the taste was just satisfactory. Would probably only return for the evening drinks.

we got the queso fundido but it was super liquidy. the guacomole was pretty good but we found a long piece of hair in it as well. i mean, it happens and we weren't that mad about it but ._. ... the corn wasn't that good and was very bland. we really liked the fajita steak and shrimp combo. that was the one dish we really enjoyed. the service was good though, they were attentive and poured our waters a lot
Great food, fast service, reasonably priced, clean, good vibes, indoor and outdoor seating and close to public transportation. There's nothing to complain about. I'd definitely recommend to friends.
Nice place and good ambience! I love being in downtown BK and just exploring finding new restaurants to try. The chicken nachos and margaritas were a hit, will be back.

Went on a Friday nite ...staff was great nice ambiance drinks were great, food was excellent very delicious.  It was a tough day for me. I told the waiter make my drink strong and boy did he come thru for me lol. Try this place out has a nice bar area also

This Mexican spot is amazing! The food is to die for! I came in late and they were still very accommodating. The customer service was excellent and the ambience was breathtaking. It was a little bit on the expensive side but well worth it.

My boyfriend and I visited last night and were very impressed. We were looking for a nice sit down Mexican spot and they didn't disappoint. Service was swift and friendly. We both had a cocktail and both were delicious. We started with oysters and then had shrimp tacos and shrimp enchiladas. They were good sized portions at a fair price. The full length windows were open to create a large patio which was lovely on a hot summer evening. We will be back!
No comment

Came here last night for dinner with 2 friends and the restaurant is huge, we were able to get seated right away without reservations which was nice. However I was dissapointed in all the food, the carne asada was just weird.. wasn't a fan of the mushroom tacos either... I think the most decent one out of all the ones we ordered was the pescado fish taco... but these were expensive you get fooled by the big taco tueday menu in front  and think it's 3 for $10 but the fish taco was actually 2 for $16 or something like that and definitely nothing to write home about... the white sangria was okay and the steak fajita took a long time to come we were close to cancelling it total came out to be 145 couldn't tell if that included tax or not since they don't present you with a receipt even though I asked for a printed one it never came... regardless wasn't a fan of the food or the drinks but the servers were nice and the bathroom was clean.
No comment
Probably the best service and food combo I've had since Covid. Jeremy had amazing service as well as the entire staff. Couldn't have better words for this establishment.

Came here on a Saturday evening. They had heated outdoor seating, indoor seating by the windows and seating a little deeper inside. The menu isn't super vast but hits the basics of what you'd expect at a Mexican place. It's not the cheapest Mexican food but given the location and ambiance I'm not surprised. I got the Paloma which was very good and the have tap, still, or sparkling water. I had the camarones al pastor tacos and a side of rice and beans. The tacos were small... about 2.5 bites each and 3 total tacos. I asked for the pineapple in the side but ended up putting them on the tacos as they were a good addition. The rice was a little salty but I mixed it with the bens and it balanced out. The service was good and the bathroom was clean and tables were socially distanced.
Delicious! Great service, atmosphere, and food. We came on Taco Tuesday, which is a great deal.

This is my second time visiting and I do love Las santa's! My coworkers and I came here for happy hour! One Love the music here !! Great deals... Frozen margaritas for 10 dollars (wish it was a little stronger) We each had 2 each and I felt a small buzz. I will try the sangria or a non happy hour drink instead next time. We got chicken tacos, nachos w chicken, chips and guac (each was $10) and Queso Fundido w the chorizo( not happy hour but $15 and SOOOOO GOOOOOD and worth it!)  Everything was delicious and good quality! The ambience is beautiful and do not feel like your downtown! Our server was nice but then I felt like we were getting rushed out. Three different people ask to come take our plates when we were not even done. The servers are kind I do give them that, but as soon as they see people coming in they want to rush you out. Not a fan of that. Everything else was great.
Shrimp appetizer is pretty great. Summer guac is refreshing. We had delayed in service but the manager made it right. Overall, great food and experience
No comment

Where do I start, walking into a restaurant that was COVID compliant was great to see. We ate in the back room by the kitchen. The food  was amazing from the appetizers to the elote dessert. Chef Adrian has done an amazing job as always!!!

Stopped at Las Santas for lunch one day while in the area and what a great find! The drinks, guac, and elotes dip were amazing and the shrimp tacos were fresh and delicious! My friend ordered the huevos rancheros and it looked awesome too. A solid stop if you're in the area and looking for quality Mexican food.
No comment

It was okay. The drinks were mostly ice and the tacos didn't have much meat on them (also they used ordinary tortillas - not the 2 color ones in a few pics). The Al pastor looked pretty. The only substantial meal was the breakfast burrito.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: They have made their outdoor space so nice during Covid. The food was delicious, I believe the drinks are 50% off during brunch hours.
No comment

Everything about this new Mexican place is amazing. First of all, the bartender, Gabriel, is the best! Super friendly and great mixologist. Amazing food, super cool glassware for the drinks as well as dishware for the food. Super cool open kitchen concept; the flan is served as bite-sized pieces with a piece of popcorn on top that doesnt seem exciting until you put it into your mouth. Wow. What a perfect balance. All around good place!
No comment

Great food, great drinks, great atomasphere and a great staff! My friend found this place on Tik Tok and it didn't disappoint, we missed happy hour but we both had two drinks, an appetizer and our main entree and the bill without a tip was only $99 which isn't bad for two people
No comment

If i could give this a 0 i would, the guac was cold and had no flavor, the shrimp tostada also had no flavor, the steak quesadilla was similar to a deli quesadilla, honestly you can't mess a quesadilla up but they did anyway. The enchiladas were 22 dollars and came with just the enchiladas which did i mention that they also sucked? Yea well they did I'm baffled at how this place has almost 5 stars I've had some delicious Mexican cuisine and then there's this a completely mediocre excuse to overcharge people. Chelas in park slope is 50x better than this, do yourself a favor don't come here.

Wasn't too busy on a Tuesday night, would also be interested to come back for happy hour deals ($8 margs  and sangria, $5 beers M-F 4-6pm). Casual vibe, great music, storefront opens up to outdoor seating. During pandemic, QR code for menu

Fajitas are good but tables were too small for a build your own fajita with all the different plates of sauces and toppings. Disappointing they didn't have standard tomato salsa or lettuce--IMO juicy shredded lettuce is essential for these types of dishes that are spicy and greasy. No ice for the water, which came to the table lukewarm?! With size of entree, I took home enough for 2 more meals--would prefer a smaller dish not so pricey. Required 20% added tip is unseemly.
No comment

There are very few Mexican restaurants I can call exceptional in Brooklyn and this is by far one of the top! The food is not only so colorful and beautiful but it's delicious. Aside from the amazing happy hour which gives you three mini tacos and a MARGARITA, beer or wine for $15 (you can also get mini empanadas) the margarita is the true star! I love margaritas and I highly recommend you give this one a try. One of the best margaritas I've ever had ! It hit the spot. The vegetarian tacos were delicious charred broccoli, colorful presentation I couldn't ask for more. If you are not into happy hour the regular menu is also filled with options. My friend got the chicken tacos and said it's one of the best he's ever had. Everything is very CLEAN. Waiters are wearing gloves and a mask. They even offer a way for you to pay with your phone so waiters don't have to touch your credit card. Outdoor seating is great and everyone has a safe distance away. I can not recommend coming here enough. One of my top Mexican spots in Brooklyn. Get the guacamole!!
No comment

Service was very slow...waited 20mins for a server to come over and take our order for drinks. Drinks wasn't great i think its the taste of the tequila...food was extremely salty,which made it hard to eat...told the waiter and she was like yeah that because it was marinated its spices...overall just terrible and a waste of an evening ....also server said there under new owners and management so maybe why the food no good

Vicente was amazing! The food was absolutely delicious and the prices were surprisingly reasonable. The hibiscus drinks were my favorite because they were f**king divine. This was my first but definitely not my last visit!

Plenty of outdoor seating! It was packed on a weds for tiki night. Music is lively, Service is awesome and food came quick. Staff wears masks and gloves. The bathroom has a push door so no need to touch any door handles! I brought my little pup who sat quietly under our table and they were cool about it. The drinks are strong and tasty. I got the mango island (Rum base) and he got the sharknado (whiskey based drink). I'll be trying the pina colada next time since I see a lot of people ordering that with their meal. The corn and peppers are YUM. Guacamole portion is a bit on the smaller side but still tasty. The soup is FAB. Will definitely get that again especially as it gets chillier through the months. The tacos come with 2 in a order which is perfect for me since I can never finish 3 plus all the apps! Fish taco is . Not overly fried. Fish is flaky and not too much breading. The carnitas taco is heavier but good; with a lot of meat and fried pork rinds on top for a nice crunch! Flan is good but on the richer side. I'll try the churros next time. So glad this place is a short walk from our apt!
No comment
No comment

I recently ate at this spot for the first time this past Friday. The ambiance and vibe were great for a Friday night. There was a DJ playing a mix of good music. The menu was great with vegan option available. The wait staff was amazing. The food was tasty and serving size was more than sufficient. My margaritas were delicious. I ordered the margarita pitcher which served about 6-8 glasses. I will definitely be returning in the future.
Amazing spot- love the usual chicken soup, and fish tacos and fresh guacamole with my go to - guava margarita.

First and foremost, the owner was so accommodating and went the extra step to make us feel at home at Las Santa's; from allowing us to change tables and occasionally checking up on us to see how our meals were. The food was just as amazing. I recommend the baby back short ribs and the enchiladas de pollo. The ribs were so tender and the enchiladas were full of flavor and a great portion size. The atmosphere was beautiful as well. Will definitely be back! Thanks for having us
No comment
No comment

Vicente is a very caring and attentive server. He took great care of us even during Covid regulations. The mood and food were all amazing and consistent. Beautiful food on a tranquil Brooklyn city corner. Definitely recommend the shisito peppers and and corn! Love!! It's a whole vibe!
This place is great. Been here a few times and the food is always amazing. My server Vincente was awesome, great customer service.

My boyfriend and I had a date brunch here...so glad we did. The wait staff were attentive, the ambiance was awesome, and the food was fantastic! Not to mention the drinks were pretty good too. Definitely will return!

Pre Covid, this place was great, great food great atmosphere. I went back this weekend, not as good as before. New management, new menu. Bring back the house made tortillas, now your using cheap pre packaged tortillas. $10 bucks for chips and salsa is steep. Everything else we ordered was ok, not great.
Amazing steak quesadilla, empanadas and drinks  and service was so fast with our attentive server Vicente!!! Had a great experience
No comment

I cam here with my friend the other day (during covid). The drinks were really good, even over flowing. I had a mango margaritas which was really tasty along with the steak tacos. The service was amazing, we got seated right away and the tables were safely distanced. I loved how you have to scan a qr code to receive the menu so you aren't touching menus that have been touched. Also the staff gladly replaced my drink after a fly flew into it . I will definitely be coming back for more margaritas and tacos.

The drinks are good but come in a baby size cup definitely not worth the price!! I had the shrimp quesadilla and it was mostly cheese definitely not worth the menu price they could've gave more shrimps then 6!!! Staff was friendly!! Due to the prices I wouldn't recommend or come back again!!!

Average trendy Mexican place. Overpriced but nice outdoor seating option in downtown Brooklyn. Wasn't a fan of the watermelon margarita but I'm sure their other margs are fine (can't make a bad marg!). Had the fish tacos and didn't love them. We ordered the salsas with hopes that the peanut salsa would be awesome but it was weird. The other salsas were great though. Basic tasty guac. My friend got a quesadilla and she really liked it. Again pretty average but worth a try!
I am so glad to have come here with my friends! Food, drinks and music was so good!! Vincente was amazing as our server! Went above and beyond to make sure that we were all happy

Tried this place on a Sunday and it wasn't crowded at all. I ordered the steak fajitas with a side of guac and a spicy margarita. The steak was good but the rice was undercooked and the beans lacked in flavor(could've just been the cook for the day). My margarita however, was amazing! My server was awesome and attentive.

column3: Southeast Colorado Springs, Colorado Springs, CO
column6: Food is overly expensive and not great. I rather go to Taco Bell. Even if they lower the prices to 50%.

Went here the other night because we were walking by and it looked really spaced and not crowded- we didn't realize til half way through our meal it was because they were almost closed- even though they were closing they were so kind to us and the food was delicious, we had a great time and great food! The tacos are great as well as los esquites

This is for the mushroom tacos only. They are delicious unless you have a thing against mushrooms. Fresh, balanced, and juicy. 10/10 would recommend. Ordered one set of three and promptly ordered an additional plate of three after tasting.
Brunch time ! Outdoor atmosphere is cute and they have good music , excited to try the marg and the tres leches cake... i would come for sure when the weather is nice
Everything was delicious, shrimp enchilada and chicken tacos where on point. Fresh natural juices. We enjoyed the outdoors sitting.

My Husband and I were celebrating our fourth wedding anniversary and had such a great time here!! The libations are delicious and strong! We only ordered chicken empanadas because we weren't that hungry but they were delicious. Our waiter Juan S. was amazing and attentive. The outside is sexy, relaxing, and enjoyable!
No comment

If you want fresh authentic Mexican food you must try here. This restaurant is bigger than you think can easily sit 50+people. The complimentary salsa and chips was delicious. The chips were freshly made and their homemade salsa had a roasted flavor. The vampiro Tostada was delicious filled with an ample portion of charred steak. I just wished for its price it was two. The steak was well seasoned and juicy. The guacamole was fresh however,  I prefer my guacamole to be mashed not chunky. The guacamole had a nice zesty flavor from the lime juice. My best friend said the chicken quesadilla was good and that avocado crema ?? (light green sauce) was really good. I added that on top of my steak. I ordered the Paloma which was made with fresh grapefruit juice. This drink was so refreshing and had the right amount of tequila. For the month of January they have a pass you can get on Eventbrite to get buy one get one free drink. The decor is also pretty. I wished I took more pictures but I will definitely come back to try other foods.
No comment

Food was delicious and fresh. It seems like it's made to order. The drinks were good and the service was great! All in all this is a solid place. Not to mention that actual restaurant is decorated beautifully and the bathroom was clean which is IMPORTANT!

The food was delicious, but the impeccable service made it all that much better. From the moment we walked in - whether it was someone taking off our coats and bags and hanging them for us, or proactively replacing our order after a mishap in the kitchen, we felt truly taken care of during our time there and def would go back anytime!
Food was amazing and our waiter was even better! Thank you, Vicente, your service was magnificent. Great drinks too!!
No comment
No comment
Great food, amazing service! I would recommend this place as a great pre-game spot before a fun night out. Fuel up on some great food, have a drink or two, then you're ready for a great night

My boyfriend and I came here for my birthday weekend and we had a really great time! We had the Baja fish tacos, chicken tacos, Yuca fries, and coconut fried shrimp. For drinks we had the coco loco margs and dessert we had the churros with guava sauce. Everything but the chicken tacos were amazing(those were just ok but hey, they're chicken tacos)!! I'm going to dream about the yuca fries lol. The ambiance is beautiful, the waitresses and waiters are awesome, the gentlemen that sat us at our table was great, and the salsa music playing in the background really added to the entire experience. We will definitely be back!
No comment

Love Mexican food ?? Me too' can't go wrong  with Las Santa's .. i love the ambiance , it was lunch time so it was a cool vibe . The window seating  is great , drenched with natural sunlight , the bar has a wide variety of liquor . Our waiter  name was "Andre " he was a darling ! The food was great ! Parking is limited because of the busy down town traffic . But  the food is definitely  worth your while , i feel like this  place can  be family and kid friendly ! GOT MY VOTE

The food was awesome: guac, queso fundido, and fajitas. Surpassed my expectations. The four star is for the truly awful frozen margarita. No idea how they messed it up but I should have send it back. Don't order, just do a regular or another drink/cocktail.
No comment

Drinks were good. Great service. Love the decor and ambience. However the food was undercooked, mediocre, & had the most random ingredients m. My nachos had one piece of a chopped carton which I believe didn't belong there, but the waiter claimed they used "non traditional" ingredients in their food. Also the chicken in my nachos was cooked medium. I see the vision but the execution is poor. Glad I tried it but I won't be returning.

Wanted to try this place after reading  so many good reviews. Was not  disappointed with service And food . Our server and bartender Andre made a great guava margarita. The food was fresh and tasty.  Would like to come back for happy  hour and dinner next time.

I went here as an impromptu girls' night for drinks and a bite. The food was well seasoned.  We had the shrimp and carne asada tacos, guacamole & chips, shrimp fajitas and a burrito (which was tasty yet not enough). The drinks were flavorful and was balanced with enough alcohol. The service though.........was unsatisfactory. They were slow and not attentive. Mixed up our order and asked were we sure of what we ordered. Had to wait for drinks and again the wrong thing was brought. If they were busy, I would have given it a pass, but with limited sitting, few patrons, and full staff, it was very disappointing. They get a three star for food and ambiance.
This place is super cute! Love the vibe. Lenny and Juanes was our server and provided such great service! Definitely going to come back. Happy hour was amazing!

First time coming here and it wont be my last! Love everything: staff, bar, seating and most of all food!! Would love to throw a party or fundraiser here when it gets warmer! Def order the tres leches pancakes, absolutely love the strawberry compote (and of course the tres leches one!).

probably one of my favorite meals i've ever had in NY. the bartender was speedy and working her butt off. our waitress was amazing, food was ON POINT and the vibe was perfect. literally such a good experience. would absolutely tell a friend to go (often).
Excellent food, great service, beautiful interior, A+ presentation. Best kept secret in Fort Greene!
