Las Santa's was amazing. I came in at 6 and didn't know about the happy hour specials. I was greeted by the hostess with a super cute mini happy hour menu. The prices were phenomenal. I wasn't planning on eating but had the best 7$ nachos ever and 2 tacos. Mai the bartender made me the perfect margarita on the rocks and when she wasn't available I was served by James who brought out my food in literally 5 minutes and kept checking in on me throughout my meal. Both bartenders were so warm and friendly and I had a great meal at the bar for such a terrific price with drinks!!! Best spot in downtown Bk. I will be back !!!
No comment
Amazing fish tacos. Our table also had the chorizo and steak tacos, chorizo empanadas, churros and tres leches cake. All were great!
Went pre-covid. Nice decor, nice ambiance, food was okay. I can see myself going back purely out of convenience
The place is amazing, felt like I wasn't in New York but rather on a mini vacation  Vicente was so nice and attentive, the food and vibe was amazing, highly recommended!

I came here and was refused service for no reason and I was the ONLY BLACK person there. He claimed that I sounded drunk which I was not ! I told him that this is how I speak (I have an speech impediment) and he continues to refuse me service and told me to leave. I was so embarrassed and felt like this was a racial discrimination. This is unacceptable and I will make sure something get done about it
No comment

I'm so glad this place opened after quarantine. It is a great spot for delicious Mexican food and cocktails. 100% recommend churros for dessert. Our waiter's name was Vicente, a very pleasant person who provided great service and made sure all of our food needs were met. Definitely will be back!

Decided to go here last night.... very spontaneous move after walking home from target. We walked in and it looked super cute so it was an instant YES for me. The waiter was amazing he gave us time to look at Menu and informed us of their daily yes DAILY happy hour specials. Everyday  2-6 you can pick from 3 empanadas 3 tostadas or 3 tacos. Your choice of filling chicken, veggies or chorizo plus a alcoholic beverage for only $15. Don't even have to say how amazing this is. The food was amazing. I ended up getting 3 chicken tacos and a marg which made the tacos even better. We also got guacamole & chips and it was super fresh and delicious. Would recommend this place in a heart beat & for sure going back again.

Such an amazing find!! Came here for happy hour after work on Friday! The space is amazing as the restaurant has an indoor/ outdoor feel and also tables outside. Happy hour ends at 6pm and they have great (somewhat small) margarita specials. My husband and I also both ordered the chicken tacos which were so delicious. We ended up ordering their entree size once happy hour was over since we really loved it. We also had chips and guacamole for the table. Great scene! It was pretty packed so the waiter didn't come around as often as I would have liked but what can ya do? Highly recommend this place.
No comment
Vicente has been amazing tonight! He was very attentive and the food and drinks were amazing. They will have outdoor bubbles and heat lamps soon so get ready!

The restaurant was super clean and organized. It was our first time here and we had the pleasure of being served by Vicente. He was really friendly and attentive in helping us choose an app, course and dessert. He was really prompt with making sure we got it all perfectly. Everything was delicious. We cant wait to come back. Thank you so much Vicente!

Excellent menu and high quality ingredients packed with old and new world Mexican flavors. The energy and service reminds you of a good home cooked meal with attention to providing a seamless experience. Salsa music is also trendy and fun!!
First off, thank you to Vicente for making my birthday brunch so relaxing and fun. The food was absolutely delicious. This is definitely a place to go for a good time :)

Trying new restaurants can be daunting with a garlic allergy. When I saw Las Santas pop up on Caviar I decided to give them a call to see if they had any garlic free offerings. The gentleman who helped me was  kind and thorough, he checked with the kitchen and they offered to make me steak & chicken fajitas with vegetables. He even called backto let me know I could not eat the rice & beans but they would send me plantains. Everything was delicious and I'm thrilled to have a new neighborhood restaurant I can trust.

I love supporting new places in the neighborhood and was so happy to see a Mexican restaurant open up so close by, so knew we had to try it! The space is huge, which you don't often see in the area, so we were able to sit immediately on a Friday (it was crowded too, which was great to see). In a nutshell, I was not impressed. The drinks were good, but the food left a lot to be desired. The guac was tasteless, chips were stale. The tacos...we had the steak, chicken and baja fish. Would say the fish was the best and the steak was awful. I was happy to see a lot of meat in it, but the taste just wasn't at the level it should be, and there was a lot of fat. The service was also extremely slow. Perhaps we hit it on a rough night.

Stopped by las Santa's last night before I had a show across the street At bam. I just have to say this from the time me and my partner walked in the entire staff was friendly. Jose was our server and was  attentive through our meal. The food was excellent me and my partner-although enjoyed the dishes. I would recommend a little more salt  however. shared a few different tacos, fish, chorizo & chicken. Also had the guacamole which was very fresh. I would definitely come back and bringing some of my friends !
Amazing service by Vicente , the food is delicious and everyone was very  kind. Definitely I recommend the Mango Margaritas and the fish tacos. For dessert the delicious churros with chocolate.
Vicente the best server in this place . Great environment great food . Awesome service.  Vicente is the best . If I can give 10 starts I would.

I went to Las Santas after work with some friends for my birthday. The happy hour prices are very fair and the drinks were great! Our server, Vicente, was amazing. Very personable and fun. Definitely plan on going back.
We just moved into the area, it's our first time time here. We came for lunch. The lunch and drink special is amazing and our server Vicente was so quick, efficient, and fun! Definitely coming back!
SO happy this place is UP AND RUNNING! Vincente ALWAYS makes my night!!!!!!! Food is BOMB too

So this is instantly my favorite spot. The fish tacos with a side of chipotle is the bomb. And the bartender Gabriel is sooooo bomb and personal!! We click immediately and then the manager James came over and you would've thought we were all family how we all just vibed. I think this spot might be my go to.
Such a great atmosphere! Lenny and Juanes were such great servers! He was so fast and kind! A really enjoyable happy hour
My sister and I had a wonderful time!! The carne asada special was amazing!!! Good music and great service! Our waiter Juan S. Was the best! We really enjoyed having dinner here!

Vicente he is an amazing waiter and so happy when he serves me. James is an amazing manager, he always bring laughters when I come to order. La Santas is just an all around amazing spot to be at, music is great and vibes are amazing.

This is a great addition to our neighborhood. From the margaritas to the queso fundito to the chicken enchiladas to the fish tacos, everything was great. The service was fast and friendly. Our waiter, Ben, made some excellent recommendations on the different salsas and entrees. Going back tonight.

The menu had so many unique and delicious options. We had the tuna tostada, the bacon wrapped shrimp poppers and the whole fish. All were 5 Stars! The interior is simple and stylish, with a spectacular open kitchen the length of the dining room. The service was friendly and professional. Go!

I got the chicken quesadillas and the shrimp tacos and they were pretty close to inedible. Extremely salty and lacking in flavor for a $50 dollar delivery. Giving two stars since I'm hopeful the other menu items are better but if you are thinking of ordering the items I ordered above, I highly suggest making them at home or going to a local deli for higher quality at a fraction of the price.
Great evening, good meal, and perfect service! The tacos were amazing highly recommend the fish tacos they were delicious

Juan S is the homie! Awesome happy hour, 3 mini tacos and a drink for $15! You can also get 3 empanadas or tostada's, totally worth, and the food is very fresh. This Yelp review got us free tequila :)
No comment

worth the trip. Shared the Jicama salad and the shrimp fajitas with my mom. I would have been happy with a full order of either but so glad we shared and got to try both. The salad was so good- full of different kinds of extremely fresh greens, jicama, pomegranate, thin sliced cucumber and a refreshing lime dressing. The fajitas were served with homemade tortillas, yummy beans and rice and these perfect roasted veggies. The shrimp was delish but the veggies- wow! It was this combo of cauli, zucchini, beets, peppers, onion, greens but they were roasted and seasoned to perfection. Ended with the bananas foster. It was as good as the meal. Love that this is fresh and healthy. The portions are right sized and seasoned well. Not a bunch of cheese on the food . Definitely on my list of places to come back too.

Dinner at the end of "happy hour" was noisy, as it should be, and the food was very, very, very good, - real Mexican cooking, a rich blend of smoky/hot spices in the  chicken enchiladas and tang in the shrimp enchiladas.  Go there, eat well.  I'm going back.

It was my first time at this restaurant and I got food poisoning from their salmon and rice dish (I don't know which part of the dish caused the food poisoning). Spent the entire night after dinner vomiting and I still feel pretty terrible. The staff was polite and the manager said they would process a refund. I wasn't planning on writing anything but I'm worried for other customers. Please take steps to ensure food safety.
Great decor, solid queso, terrible chips, and average fish tacos.

Love a good Mexican food restaurant and this one hit the spot! Let me start with the most important, tequila! Very good selection and great margaritas. I didn't try any other cocktails but they looked really good. Food is super fresh and authentic which is a big plus for me and the family.

This is not your typical taqueria. This is Mexico City at its best. Authentic food, natural ingredients with the right spice and heat. The tacos are pressed and grilled by hand in a beautiful open kitchen and dining room. The meat and chicken are grilled to perfection  The margaritas are perfectly simple, 3 ingredients, as it should be. There is no shortage of handmade guacamole. Try everything, because there are misses.

I made reservations for Thanksgiving for a  group of four days in advance. I received confirmations, emails, and alerts about my confirmation. I was told that a table for four would be reserved for 5:30 P.M. . When we arrive some lady comes out and says we have to leave because they are having a private party. I showed her the reservation and she gets upset and calls the bartender over. He tells us that we have to leave because they are technically closed and I tell him that we have reservations. The bartender tells us that we are mistaken and that we have to leave. I asked for the manager and minutes later some guy comes out. I ask if he is the manager and then ask for his name. He tells me my name is Robert and I am the manager what's the problem. I asked him for his last name and he tells me that Robert is sufficient and we must leave because they are having a private party. I tell him the website says the restaurant is OPEN and I show him my reservations and the emails, confirmations and alerts. Robert tells me that's a mistake and we cannot stay that we have to go somewhere else and he would call me later, what ever that meant. I made reservations to avoid the shopping, preparation, cooking, and cleaning this Thanksgiving. I traveled with my elderly mother, my pregnant fiancé, and our eleven year old son to eat on Thanksgiving  and had to eat McDonald's because the place could not get it right. WTF!
Loooove this place! Drinks are amazing, food is delicious, must try shishito peppers, guacamole, takos, steak fajitas and fish !

This location must be cursed - every restaurant that occupies the space is truly inedible and this restaurant might be the worst one yet. We received nachos with literally no cheese that were freezing cold, steak fajitas that were chewy and a meat that was a taste I've never experienced in any meat form of even mediocre quality. The one star is for the vegetables that came with the fajitas that were decent. Not to mention, the service is horrible - especially for an empty restaurant at 9pm on a Saturday night - the poor bus boy was the only person who visited our terrible ever. What a shame this prime location and nice space is so horrible.

The staff is really nice, so there's that.  A decent looking space, as well.  Unfortunately, service is poor (25 mins for drink, 20 mins for the check), the sangria tastes like cough syrup, and the food tastes cheap (calling it Mexican food is a bit generous, the dishes feel more like generic Mexican options at an American chain).  Better off going to Tacombi across the street if looking in the immediate area, or Ojala a half mile away for more authentic Mexican.

Such a great place to grab a drink after work with friends! The cocktails are incredible and the service is very friendly and efficient. The nachos got demolished as soon as they came out and their happy hour specials are phenomenal. This is absolutely going to be the new regular place to come to!
No comment
Food is mediocre at best and yet incredibly expensive. Come here for a drink, but that's it. No, don't get the guacamole either.

Such a great atmosphere, lively, fun and you can still have a conversation. Service is so friendly and the second time visiting, we were warmly acknowledged straight away! Food was also great, fresh, and cocktails also refreshing. Looking forward to trying their brunch!

Super cute place. The back is adorable. The food is great and the servers are very friendly. Attentive but not overbearing and very patient. We were there until closing and didn't even realize as they let us enjoy ourselves without rushing us. Thank you!
Great food and great service! Better vibes than Tacombi if you're looking for a pre-BAM dinner spot.

Absolutely exceptional and one of the best Mexican restaurants in the city. The food is very flavorful and delicious with great service to boot. The chef came out and recommended his personal churros recipe with bitter chocolate to dip, phenomenal!

I have been here multiple times and this is by far the worst experience. The food lacked seasoning and did not taste as good as it did in the past. We noted our concerns to the manager and he took it off the bill. Kudos for customer service.
My family and I decided to try a new restaurant to spice things up. Outstanding service and delicious food. The decoration was beautiful, I highly recommend this restaurant. I will be back very soon.
Really nice place. I've eaten there twice now.  Unique dishes - some good vegetarian options.

Finally a refreshing experience I truly enjoyed!!! As a person who loves to try new restaurants this one is  definitely a "GO TO" for great food and amazing drinks. Ambiance is also beautifully set up. Now all they need is a dance floor!!! Go LAS SANTAS I am hookedd!!!

Had an amazing time here last night. The food, decor, service and drinks were outstanding! This spot is literally perfect for any occasion: date night, group dinners, or popping in for a few drinks. Wishing this place a successful soft opening and I definitely hope Las Santas is here to stay!
No comment
No comment

Great customer service and food! Vicente took care of us with a very pleasant and friendly manner. Definetely going back to eat more tasteful and delicious guacamole, taco fish and churros! Ohh and the  frozen mango margarita was delicious too!
Received these laughable products in return for $50.  Inedible, late, missing items.  Stay away.

We were eager to try this new restaurant that opened just down the street from us.  Started with the chorizo nachos to share.  Chips and salsa are complimentary.  Sister and I shared the whole fish and Mayan ribs, both of which were really good.  The fish was particularly juicy.  Others had the fajitas, chicken and shrimp, which also looked good.  Didn't have any drinks but others ordered the habanero margarita, guava margarita and michelada.  The tequila in it was tasty and actually spicy, likely due to the hot sauces that are made in house.  Tortillas are also made in house by hand.  Probably due to the first month opening, but the flow of service is a little slow but nothing terrible.  All in all, really happy restaurants are finally opening up in these new construction retail spaces along Fulton, and hopefully las Santas is an indication of what's more to come.
One of my new favorite Mexican restaurants! Food and cocktails are so authentic and delicious! Loved their tacos, guacamole and enchiladas. Will definitely be back
This place is great! Mai (the bartender) took very good care of us. James (the manager) did as well. Food is really good! Definitely a must go
No comment

Great place! A bartender made 2 different cocktails that weren't on the menu and both were delicious. Food was great, tacos were extra delicious and a waiter was the most pleasant human ever. The entire vibe was great and very much needed during the pandemic

Las Santas located in one of the most hottest places in Brooklyn, is run by a fantastic staff and the food was great. The bartender Gabriele was nice and gave a bunch of suggestions on what I should get to eat. I ultimately had a frantic pork taco with a side of chips and a fantastic margarita. The manager James is a kind, he came over to check on me a few times throughout my visit. I can't wait to come back & try more some different dishes.
Came here tonight and it was amazing !. They had a DJ playing great music, the food was amazing & well balanced. The staff was also friendly and quick. I will certainly be back with some friends.
No comment
Vincente is the sweetest and super attentive. The passion fruit margarita was so fresh. Will definitely be coming back for happy hour.
Great food ,went for Happy hour on Tuesday dinner was great ,drinks were great got some shots Casamigos .,it was a great night.Recommend for  a good girls nite out
Amazing service, delicious food, beautiful atmosphere. They really made my visit wonderful. It's a good place for a date or fancy occasion.

We dined at Las Santa's on Sunday for Brunch. Vicente was amazing. He was upbeat and knowledgeable. The restaurant followed COVID precautions and was safe and not crowded. The food was amazing and I will definitely dine here again.
Vicente OMG  He Was Great! Very Attentive. He kept checking in to make sure we we're okay and well taken care of! Come here you will be Pleased! THANK YOU VICENTE!!! SEE YOU AGAIN!! KAY

I ordered on the Yelp app, which was super easy to begin with. By the time I got there, my food was ready and bagged. The bartender was really friendly and let me eat my take out at a table. The food, which I'm still eating, is absolutely fantastic. I couldn't wait to write the review because it's THAT good. I'm eating empanadas, quesadilla with chicken, and plantains. All of it is insanely delicious. Well done Las Santas, I'll be back for more!
Vicente is amazing!! The wait staff are great and friendly and the food is AMAZING!!!!

The tacos and margaritas are soo goood! The ensalada verde is also amazing! The atmosphere is so chill! Definitely one of my faves and Vicente was amazing!! He went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience.
Great service.  Little to no wait time.  Jose the waiter was professional, kind and a good vibe in all.  Enjoyed the food and drinks.   Definitely coming back soon!!
Las Santas is amazing. Make sure to request Juanes or Lenny as your server they are awesome!!! Great service and so much fun

Impeccable service and the food was amazing!! Thanks to ur waiter and his recommendations on the special for the night!!! Finished the night off with free tequila shots!!!! A definite go to! Good food! Good drinks and good music!

I absolutely loved this place from my very 1st visit. The location,  the atmosphere, the vibe, the music and omg the food and drinks . The staff is very welcoming,  friendly, and attentive . My personal fav is VINCENTE. He's such a sweet and bubbly soul. If you ever visit ask for him and you're gonna understand exactly what i mean
Our server Vincente was simply amazing. The food was absolutely amazing and the drinks to die for! My fave was the passionfruit margarita !!!

We had a really great night and the food was delicious. Shoutout to the most excellent server Vicente who was busting his butt to grab us food and drinks so quickly and with a smile on his face. Great margaritas and the queso was awesome. Highly recommend. Loved it!

What a wonderful place. I came here last weekend and the outside was beautifully done with plants and tiki torches, it really give a great vibe. The service was great also they were very attentive & always nearby. The food & drinks were great as well. this place is literally immaculate, the servers are wearing masks and gloves (which I saw them change often) & the establishment itself was also very clean. I spoke to the manager (John or James) I think & he was also very pleasant & knowledgeable of the menu & drinks. I will certainly be back and recommend this place.
Went here for the first time during covid even though I've lived across from it for three years. Vicente was amazing! The service was fantastic. Will definitely be back.

WOW WOW WOW. We were looking for a place to eat out on a Saturday and found Las Santas in Yelp. We decided to give it a try even though it was new and were we happy we did. This was one of those kinds of meals where after every single bite you put in your mouth, from beginning to start, everyone can't stop saying how good it is. The food and drink were SO fresh and the flavors were out of this world. Some standout dishes were the empanadas, shrimp ceviche, tortilla soup (best that I've ever had) and the enchiladas with the dreamy mole sauce. We cannot wait to bring others back with us!! The best part of it all was that the prices were so reasonable for such top notch, authentic food. They also have a really cool bar in the front and will be starting HH soon!

Please save me from over the top Mexican restaurants Where the decor overshadows the food. Huge dining room, very gaudy and loud. Food was Mostly bland, small servings and lacked authenticity. Served a thimble size of salsa with small saucer of chips. Drinks were watery. More splash than substance. I give them 3-6 months at most.
Great brunch spot! Nice drink selection and tasty brunch options! Great service with an accommodating staff.
Great service, nice bartenders, fresh, delicious food! My after work go to spot! Mai was great bartender!! Friendly owner!

Came here for Sunday brunch with some friends for my husbands birthday. We were surprised to find how empty the restaurant was for that time slot... Including ourselves, there was only one other table of guest. First I want to say that the service was good and the overall decor and cleanliness were nice. However the food on the other hand was a little lackluster. Our bowl of guac which was $13 (a little pricy even for NY standards) was 75% tomatoes and onions. There was barely ANY actual avocado! I reminded me more of a salsa than a guacamole. That is NOT acceptable in the slightest especially for how much they charged! I have honestly never experienced a restaurant to be that cheap with their guacamole. For entrees two people order tacos and the other two ordered quesadillas, both of which were bland. I was able to taste more cheese than actual steak in my quesadillas :( Overall I wouldn't come back as there are tons of better Mexican restaurants in NYC.

Beautiful new spot just opened near Barclays Center and BAM. Good food, fun service. We had the fish tacos and the queso and both were fantastic. Our server Abby had a great sense of humor and was very helpful. I would definitely recommend a drink or bite before or after a show!

Amazing restaurant, great presentation and quality service.  We wandered in her on Christmas Day and the experience was amazing!   Alessandro is all kinds of awesome.  Go here.  You won't be disappointed!

Came here tonight with my friend, we ordered the nachos and they were the best we've ever had? Bartenders were so friendly and we felt right at home. Gabrielle really made us feel welcome with his charm and hospitality, we can't wait to be back tomorrow!

A great spot with incredible food and delicious margs. Gabriel, the bartender, was incredibly friendly and full of wonderful recommendations. They've got a great weekday lunch special for $12 that actually comes with a surprising amount of food. Will defiiitely be planning to stop in regularly.

I enjoyed this place so much. The baja fish taco was to die for. Definitely authentic, which is comforting to find. I also enjoyed the service. Mai was attentive, sweet, and made sure everything was going well. Definitely recommend!
Food is incredible- super fresh ingredients and delicious cocktails! Have been back multiple times since opening. Staff is incredibly friendly.  Such a great addition to the neighborhood!

I grew up in San Antonio and have always had a hard time finding good Mexican food in NYC. This place was so great. Some of the best guacamole I've had. Amazing, thick tortilla chips. I had the nachos and they were really great. Super friendly waiter. We went on a Saturday night and there was a DJ playing reggaeton that I could have done without... But otherwise great night!
No comment

Great casual bar with fantastic drinks and friendly service. Very welcoming staff and upscale cocktails. We were looking for a pre-show drink before heading to BAM and this was exactly what we needed. Thank you!!

Valentina was such a lovely bartender! And Ben - I think that was his name - made extra laps around the restaurant just to make sure I was taken care of, so definitely would recommend! Oh - and the food is delicious, most importantly! Yay for new restaurants !

We had our staff holiday lunch here yesterday and all of us from the Center for Fiction loved everything. The room is beautiful, the people are all welcoming, and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. The guacamole is especially good. I plan to become a regular and hope lots of other people will as well, so that this place stays open and thrives. The neighborhood desperately needs it.

Great food and service. If you're in the mood for authentic mexican food, this is one of the best places I've found and I visit NY, Chicago, Miami, etc... The service was quick and efficient and everything I have tried on the menu has been top top notch
Nice place clean and creative food , need salt on table though food needed a little salt for my taste drinks were good but was disappointed with mimosa when it came with ice in it

Visited this place on a Tuesday night. It wasn't very busy so we had a secluded booth or ourselves. We took our time with apps and cocktails.the mango and classic margarita were both very refreshing. Loved our tacos and even got corn flan as a dessert on the house courtesy of management. The service was excellent, I wish I could remember our server's name because she had such great suggestions and was so nice. Would definitely recommend.
Delicious food, super fresh taste.   Excellent service and very attentive personnel. Highly recommended

My first YELP review. I was eagerly anticipating this restaurant opening and I can say that I was not disappointed. The food and drinks were on point. I stuck with appetizers this time around but will be back for entrees.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went to Oxomoco after craving for some latino food and I was not disappointed. we got seated in one of the booths. right between the bar and the open kitchen and we were able to see the entire view of the beautiful restaurant. I ordered one of their recommended tequilas and it was so tasty! the waitress was super sweet and so friendly and informative. she definitely made our meal very welcoming. the tacos were stuffed well and the flavors were delicious. subtle and not overpowering but leaves you satisfied. highly recommend coming here!

Michelin Star Mexican Food. The Guacamole was awesome. The smoked tomatoes add a lot of flavor to the dish. I highly recommend the shrimp tacos and lamb tacos. Finish off with the date cake. It's well worth it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We ordered the tuna tostada (so delicious!!), lamb and swordfish tacos for 2 people. I came on a Monday night and was able to get seated immediately without a reservation. Service was great and aesthetic was really cute. I wouldn't come back again because the food seemed a bit underwhelming for the price - prefer getting authentic street tacos!
No comment

What's not to say that everyone else has covered? Except- I actually recommend coming here and eating alone. Come as soon as they open, sit at the bar, order a drink and a meal. The hostess and my bartender were so warm and friendly. I got special attention because it didn't get so busy at that bar yet (give it 30 mins and it will). Michelin star restaurants can sometimes give a pretentious vibe but this restaurant felt very homey. You can tell the staff enjoys working there and enjoys who they work with. At least the staff I witnessed. And of course the food is one of the best meals I've had this year. I can't wait to go back and try something new.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Honestly I don't think I can put into words how amazing this place is. The staff is wonderful, friendly and informative, as soon as you walk into the place you feel relaxed and joyful. It's bright, clean and beautiful. I wish I took more photos of my food but everything was absolutely delicious. These are the beet "chorizo" tacos pictured and even if you enjoy meat in tacos, you will LOVE these. Extremely flavorful! We just stumbled upon this place randomly for brunch and I am so thankful! We will be back during the summer for the patio!
No comment
No comment

First off getting a reservation here is difficult. It's not a place where you can book for the same day at least in my experience. Make sure you plan in advance if you want the date and time of your choosing. The restaurant is large and had plenty of tables. There is an outdoor area and dining area. The service was friendly and knowledgeable. I wasn't too crazy about the tuna tostada or the lettuce elote. The barbacoa lamb tacos were delicious. I also enjoyed the chips and salsa + guacamole. The cocktails were also amazing. The music was weird too, it just didn't fit the ambiance. It went from Lady Gaga to some Latin songs and other random songs.  The bathroom was a vibe though! It was like being in a disco. The food is not authentic Mexican so that was disappointing for me. I really wanted to like this place and I heard many great things however it didn't live up to the hype for me.
No comment

Surprised this place received a Michelin Star. Even after booking a reservation, the table was not ready. Beautifully decorated interior. Prices are higher than your average taco shop, but the tacos were all unique. We started with a fried tortilla with several dipping sauces, which was flavorful and went well with the tacos as well. Each order of taco comes with 2 servings. 3 tacos per person was fulfilling. The arrachera flank steak taco was the showstopper with charred thinly sliced steak, cubed cheese and salsa which all paired perfectly. Flavors were smoky and delicious.
No comment
No comment

Everything about this place was amazing! The staff was so nice especially theIr General Manager! They were all so accommodating and welcoming since it was our first time in the city. The food was absolutely delicious. I enjoyed everything we ordered but my favorite dish was the strawberry aqua chile. It was so fresh and all the flavors complimented each other so well. I can't wait to come back to such a cute restaurant, definitely a little gem in Brooklyn that you much check out!

I was super excited to try this place cause it's hard to find good Mexican in New York. Overall our meal was pretty good. I got the classic margarita, which was strong and decently large for a margarita in the city. We got the chilaquiles as an appetizer, and oh my goodness it was delicious. Hands down the best thing. You have to order this. For our entrees, we got the steak tacos and the egg/chorizo burrito. The steak was super tasty, but it had some type of oil (I think chili oil) on it and that made the taco super soggy. I wasn't a fan. I ended up eating the taco contents with my fork and skipping out on the oil saturated tortilla. My fiancé liked the burrito, but it was nothing special. Our lunch was around $100 with tip.
No comment
No comment
3.5 stars. I expected better to be honest. Didn't try anything with meat bc vegetarian. Cute place though and good horchata
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here was good, but I don't think I would have been able to guess that it had a Michelin star just from tasting and experiencing it.  I got the Verano En Sonora cocktail, which was a bit too strong and smoky for me. The Duraznito on the other hand was quite tasty and sweet. As for the food, the beef tartare tostada with grasshoppers was unique, but not my favorite. The summer squash tacos were tastier, but honestly not worth the price to me.  The Pollo a las Brazas was tasty, but the crispy rice that came with it was way too salty and the tortillas were just alright.  Overall, a bit pricey and not as tasty as many other Mexican restaurants I've been to in NYC.
No comment

The food was tasty, but we felt overall it was a little pricey for what we got. Two margaritas, guac and the open faced quesadilla was $76 before tip. The corn dish was definitely the better of the two dishes we had, but the guac, although not traditional style, was also enjoyable. Both drinks were fine, but we felt they had a little too much ice so were watery by the end.

The tuna tostada is incredible. It's spicy, crunchy, creamy! It's everything that you would wish for. The sweet tlayuda was amazing as well. Don't skip out on the Oaxacan chocolate dessert with espresso ice cream - to die for!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was amazing!! The ambience was very cute and cozy. Our waiter was super fun and friendly! Highly recommend the tuna tostadas and frozen margaritas.
No comment

Super delicious fusion of flavors at Mexican contemporary restaurant Oxomoco. Everything from the drinks to the dessert were unique and mouthwatering. Definitely coming back to this one to try the rest of the menu.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant. Good food and service, the staff is really nice. Small portions and hard to make a reservation due to popularity. I also feel like the Michelin star status isn't really deserved. Definitely Michelin guide worthy but Michelin star is questionable. The food is good but you can get better tacos/latin food deeper into Brooklyn and in Queens.

Run of the mill Mexican food with interesting condiments (dipping sauces) that add more value to the food than anything else. Flank steak tacos is the dish of choice but overall place has a Michellin Star which is a little hard to believe. $17 a dish. 3.25/5 stars as a lunch spot.
No comment

The place looked closed at first, but we were looking for a lunch spot so decided to check it out. They were able to seat us at the bar right away. I was pleasantly surprised to see vegan and vegetarian options on the menu. We got the chips and guacamole (best guac I've ever had), celery root taco (vegan and absolute FIRE), and the custard dessert with shaved ice on top (sounded weird, but wow this worked so well together!) We haven't stopped talking about the food since we've been. The service was a little slow, but we weren't in any hurry. Our server comped us 2 drinks to apologize. If we had a location near us, we'd be there every weekend.

I feel like Brooklyn has some of the best restaurants lately (I live in Manhattan) and Oxomoco is no exception. I used to live in LA so I'm always looking for a good Mexican place. We went for brunch and the tacos had so much flavor and different textures. Cocktails were great as well. The place is beautiful and service is nice. I guess the only thing that could improve is the tres leches... but I can't wait to be back! Highly recommended!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed my experience here. Staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was truly amazing! I highly recommend the guacamole and lamb barbacoa tacos. The drinks were not only aesthetic, but had enough alcohol to get me buzzed after just one and also tasted good. Definitely recommend!
Amazing recommendation from a client while my colleague and I were in New York for a tradeshow. The guacamole was great as was the service.

Food is fantastic and so are the drinks. Great staff! I wish the outdoor "heated" patio was a bit more heated because the outside chill comes in through the sliding doors. Also had a stubborn pigeon who kept making his way inside after our server and a few of us had chased him out a few times haha

After we finished eating, we asked for 2 shots of tequila and a shot of water and instead, they brought a shot of nasty vodka and charged us for it. The food is below average - I'm shocked it has a star.
No comment
If this place could get more than 5 starts it would get them. I tasted the food before it even set down on my tongue. That is so special. I cried when I bit into their taco, no lie.
No comment

I liked every single thing we ordered, even the things I didn't think I'd like that my table wanted. The swordfish tacos were incredible. Couldn't get enough of the Caesar salad or the sweet potato flatbread dish. Our servers were knowledgeable and friendly -- overall such a positive experience.
No comment
No comment

Superb. Each dish had depth of flavor, from the mango/peanuts snacks to the entrees to the flourless chocolate cake dessert to even the espresso. awesome people & service. Really enjoyed sitting at chefs counter. Only area for improvement: some of the cocktails had too much sugar, which overpowered some of the other flavors
No comment

I've been here twice now and I think would describe the food as innovative and higher end Mexican cuisine. This place was awarded a Michelin star shortly after they opened and I can see why as they serve an upgraded modern version of traditional Mexican food. The food could be improved by adding just a bit more seasoning to enhance the flavor of the food. The lamb barbacoa tacos were really good as well as most of the seafood appetizers we tried. The tuna tostada was one of my favorites. The tuna with crickets was an interesting concept but the crispness of the insects did not really go well. The drinks were all really good and the service was friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend trying this place out as it's a nice change from the typical Mexican restaurant.
So many unexpected flavors in this meal it was amazing. My favorite was the sweet potato tlayuda which I never would have chosen if my server didn't recco it. Everything was really great
No comment
No comment

Great place for casual fine dining! Came on a Monday evening and still needed to make a reservation because they're so popular lol. We split 2 different tacos (the lamb one and swordfish) very well done like I love the corn tortilla. You must try the guac and they offer to give you more chips too! I had a mock tail which was guava based and citrusy (more of my favorite flavor) and their dessert which was this delicious brownie with espresso ice cream haha. We were so stuffed by the end of it all. Great service and I even got the Lamb taco to go cause I wanted it to have it for later. Definitely check it out if you haven't!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I LOVES oxomoco. The staff was so kind, the space was so lovely and special- and every single thing I put in my mouth was incredible. The salsa spread was so cute and fun, the Caesar salad was unique and delicious, one of my favorites ever, the Paloma blew my mind. I would recommend it to anybody- especially someone who is looking for good veg options or someone looking to have a really *nice* meal. So worth the price.

I was here for my birthday with a friend during an overnight stay in Greenpoint. Wow, has Greenpoint changed since I left in 2010. I was NOT expecting the food to be THIS good and I have recommended this place to so many people since my visit. It was modern, interesting, everything perfectly cooked, drinks were yum, excellent service and beautiful setting (we sat in the front outside enclosed patio). I imagine this would be fun for groups! The tacos were divine!

I picked Oxocomo for many reasons, one, was celebrating a birthday, two, we were en NY for the weekend and three, a Michelin star restaurant. Wait, what?! Yes, I wanted a special place for a special date and a special person.  What an experience! Our server Peter was delightful! Took the time to explain the menu and made recommendations.  Very engaging. There was not a minute that we did not see a person by our table, replenishing water, cleaning or simply asking how we were doing. No wonder why they received their Michelin star.  Amazing job Oxocomo team! So tasteful and delicate at the same time, Elegant but simple. A great combination and very well measured. Oxocomo we will come back!
No comment
No comment

Mexican restaurant in Greenpoin Brooklyn. Very nice looking restaurant a lot of seating area outside that's also looking very inviting. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Some choice of different vine and small amount of house cocktails. Food we got was not that positive. Peanuts is just peanuts nothing spectacular. Pints Verde Caesar salad with no flavor and very little dressing that I have to ask for more it was very dry. Oxomoco Guacamole was just avocado no lime no seasoning  and  Soya Marinated Tuna Tostada was not bad but super small and looking super lonely on big plate not even any garnish just boring. For price they charge you can find something much better in the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Service, fantastic. Cocktails, delicious. Ambiance, so nice. Food however, tasteless. Shrimp tacos need seasoning. The chicken was incredibly dry. They have so much opportunity to make this place a home run, but the food was like eating paper- tasteless. Especially as a Latina, I was just expecting so much more.
No comment
No comment

This place has a nice little vibe. Not your typical Mexican spot, the food elevated. The gauc is amazing, the smoked tomatoes is a nice twist. I had the Lamb Barbacoa tacos. Surprisingly filling! I also ordered the frozen Paloma because of course, it was a typical hot summer afternoon.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We got a last minute same day reservation for Sunday dinner indoor dining. We had three drinks, beef tartare tostada, market fish tacos, lamb barbacoa tacos, and lychee sponge cake. My favorite dish was lamb barbacoa tacos. It's tasty and a little spicy. The market fish tacos were all's delicious. The beef tartare tostada is a bit too salty. The dessert was ok. I like the ambience, and the service was good. Oxomoco is similar to Casa Enrique to some extent - they are both Michelin one star, both are Mexican food, and both are affordable; they are also not far away from each other. I like both restaurants.
No comment
This review is based on the service of the hostess who also appeared to be our waitress alone. She was pretty rude and inconsiderate. We ended up leaving before ordering our food.
Amazing food, tuna tostada and arrachera tacos were our favorite so far, I wish we lived in town, but will come back when in the city
No comment
absolutely adore this spot, such a good brunch spot it intimate evening dinner. great cocktails, delicious bites and such unique dessert. 10/10
No comment

Went for brunch this afternoon. The food was amazing. The lamb tacos were my favorite! By far the best tacos I've ever had (I've eaten a lot of tacos). The tortillas tasted so fresh. I had el mariachi cocktail and it was sublime. The watermelon desert was unlike anything I've ever tasted. This is a MUST. Alyssa and multiple members of the team checked in on us (at appropriate times when I was not stuffing my face with all the deliciousness). The service was exceptional from start to finish. Everything was clean and sanitized. The restaurant had a boho light and airy modern aesthetic. The bathroom had beautiful art work and a disco ball which was very groovy. Definitely coming back!
No comment
We had a pleasant, not rushed meal here! Really pretty and super cool vines. Our lunch was divine! Margaritas on point too

You need to give this place 5 stars but I would still say it's a tad overrated. The tuna tostada is definitely the best thing I've had there and go back just for that, but the rest of their menu items are nothing jaw dropping. The vibes are perfect and the drinks are awesome definitely is a perfect date spot if you can land a rez.

Wow. Each dish was perfection - loved the bavette steak with warm corn tortillas, guacamole with smoked tomatoes, and lamb and fish tacos were outstanding. Oh and the corn dish was amazing! Excellent service and warm ambiance. Wish it was slightly quieter! But overall incredible
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was great but service was all over the place. This was a total shock given the recent Michelin star award! Drinks took forever despite the bar being empty, and food continued to arrive to our table while some members of our party were still waiting for their drinks. No one really came by to check in on our food or drinks to ask how everything was or ask if we'd like anything more. The only time people came to our table was to drop the food we had ordered at the start. We never even had a chance to order more drinks or food and had to hunt someone down to ask for the check. The food was delicious but presentation for some was strange - the tuna tostada (while delicious) looked weird and off-centered on a too-big plate with no garnish. We left confused and disappointed and I can't recommend this restaurant going forward.

This was our second choice restaurant and we are happy. They were able to accommodate our large party. The fish taco... soooo good. The chicken with fried red rice was soooo yummy. The guacamole was good. The lamb taco wasn't bad. It was just to much for my palate. The only thing I wish is that the had a ginger ale or sprite on their beverage menu. Also, if you're expecting their hibiscus drink to taste like sorrel... it won't. Theirs is not sweet and doesn't have a hint of spices in it. I would definitely visit again.
Really wonderful atmosphere and attentive staff members.  Food included new and really wonderful combinations of flavors.  Couldn't stop eating.
No comment
Freshest Guac in Brooklyn hands down!!! Had an amazing dinner experience here. My friend and I still talk about the lamb tacos to this day!!

Delicious food and drinks!  The place looks amazing ,  great for birthday parties.  It was very hard to get a reservation though,  I'm fact, I've tried but I haven't been able to book again, the place is that good

We really enjoyed our lunch at Oxomoco -- a unique one Michelin star Mexican restaurant. The corn tlayuda was my favorite. It's crispy, cheesy, and a little bit spicy. The "chorizo" beet tacos with crispy potatoes were also solid. They serve two tacos per plate, which coupled with an appetizer, is definitely enough to fill you up. Great outdoor dining space, and unique interior design. Check out the bathroom for an unexpected surprise :) All in all, a great meal.
No comment
Excellent food, great atmosphere and service. Tuna appetizer was outstanding. We look forward to returning.

Not sure how this is a Michelin star restaurant. There was nothing extraordinary about it. My local Mexican place has WAY better food. I ordered the chorizo burrito which is supposed to have chorizo, scrambled egg and potatoes. There was no sign of egg or chorizo in my burrito - all I got was a flour tortilla stuffed with potatoes and a spicy sauce. This is outrageous. For the restaurant to try to pass this off is completely unprofessional and I'm writing this review so that you do not waste your time and money eating here. Don't buy into the hype. The one star is for the tuna tostada, which was the only decent thing on the menu. Making everything super spicy so your mouth burns is not cooking with flavor - obviously this is what Oxomoco does to mask the fact that their food actually has no flavor. And they only had five actual entrees on their menu - five - that's all you have to choose from. I had to order a hot drink (Dulce Abuelita) because they sat us by the door and it was frigid because they kept opening the door to their outdoor seating every 30 seconds. What's the point of indoor seating if it's as cold as outside. This would be a simple fix for the restaurant if they actually cared and bothered to install a two-door system so the cold air wouldn't rush in every time the servers opened the door. We asked to be moved and there were at least three two-person tables open, but the waitress told me they'd have to clean one of the tables and then never followed up to actually move us. What a miserable experience and I spent $55 on Uber to get here and back and $59 on the saddest brunch I've ever had. I could've made a better burrito at home.

Pam and I had such a mind blowing experience at this restaurant! We decided to sit at the chef's counter to get the full experience from start to finish. The ambience is neutral color tones, naturally stained wood accents, and greenery which was very harmonious. Looking at the menu we wanted to try almost everything but we decided to be reasonable and select only 7 hahaha. Our dishes consistedPunta Verde CaesarPunta Verde Caesar of guacamole and chips, Punta verde Caesar, monk fish tacos,  Carne Brava, and oaxacan chocolate cake. Our favorite dish was surprisingly the Punta verde Caesar salad, the dish is unexplainably delicious! You have to experience to understand our obsession for it. This spot has made it to our top 5 favorite restaurants. Definitely going back again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This restaurant has a very inviting and nice interior.  I loved the hanging ivy.  The staff were kind and helpful.  The drinks were great- definitely get the ultimo adios.  Most of the food knocked me out with their incredible mix of flavors.  Don't leave without getting the tuna tostada and beet "chorizo" tacos.  The lamb barbacoa and skate tacos were also wonderful.  The hamachi crudo was the exception- it was so off-putting that I didn't finish it.  And be warned- it's freezing.  The door is constantly opening for both patrons coming in and waiters going out and I ended up putting on my winter coat midway through the dinner, even though we were inside.

Wonderful spot for dinner, a little noisy for my preference but the food makes it worth it. Chips & salsa is amazing; they give you a variety (5 salsas) from mild to very spicy. The beet chorizo tacos are so delicious, an incredible vegan option.

TLDR: All around stellar restaurant! Highly recommend a visit if you're looking for elevated Mexican cuisine. We started with a round of drinks and the Guava Margarita in particular was delicious. I normally strongly dislike tequila but this was a light, smooth and perfectly blended drink. The mango appetizer was one that I could have done without but was still tasty. The Tyaluda was a very unique dish with the best mole that I have ever tasted. The beet tacos were simple and done well but I felt like it had a bit too much parsley. The lamb tacos were definitely the best lamb tacos I've ever had and the barbacoa style came through wonderfully. The squash blossom on top of the lamb tacos was the perfect touch to balance the richness. But what really put this meal over the top was the chocolate ganache cake. The slight bit of sea salt and rich chocolate blended together beautifully. Completely worthy of the Michelin star and will definitely be coming back!

Peter. Wow. Somebody give this guy a raise. Have been here many times for many occasions but today was just a casual early dinner. Food is always exceptional and consistent. And the service is always great too. But Peter, the server today, was phenomenal. Friendly and checked in at exactly the right times. Recommend some new dishes and a great mocktail. A simple mixup with our drinks and he brought us out this amazing dessert, which we never would have tried otherwise.

Such a unique dining experience. We traveled all the way from the sunny San Fernando Valley in CA to New York, just to check out this Michelin Star rated restaurant recommended by Bobby Flay on Food Network. We tried a variety of dishes from their smoked dried mango, a guava margarita (glass was rimmed with tajin), a salsa flight (basically) with delicious house-made tostadas. The salsas were all delicious!!! We tried the Caesar Salad which was so good - the romaine lettuce was grilled and it added such beautiful depth of flavor, honestly I could go on and on...it was an experience that was a highlight of our trip. This wasn't your usual Mexican food but a creative take on dishes done with finesse. Highly recommend!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Not only is the food to die for our waiter John went above and beyond! He gracefully guided us through the menu explaining each dish as an full experience. His recommendations sent us into the most enjoyable food coma that I'm already itching to go back. This will be my top recommendation for anyone who asks and hope they are lucky enough to sit at one of John's tables.

I'm amazed by everything Oxomoco has to offer. From service, to dish presentation, interior design to the wood fire open kitchen. Everything down to the smallest detail is so well thought out. The guacamole was probably one of the best guacs I've had, and the tuna tostada flavor will live with me forever, not to forget mentioning that beautiful grilled pollo served with the fried rice and yummy tortillas. I didn't drink tonight but I could tell by the drink presentation I definitely missed out! And to end our dinner, Chef sent out 2, not just the one dessert I order but was generous enough to send a complimentary chocolate cake dessert to our table which Was something out of this world! The whole experience was incredible!

Ambience is gorgeous in this place. All the walls are white, with plans everywhere. We were seated indoors. After seeing all the Yelp reviews, we decided to start off with the tuna tostada which was sooo good and def my favorite dish of the night (and I'm veryyy picky about fish). Next, had the lamb barbacoa tacos which were so so delicious and flavorful! Last dish was the buvette. A bit Chewy but still good. The chipotle sauce on it was really good. Reason I knocked off a star was for service. When our waiter brought us the buvette, we asked him if we could run through the dish and tell us what was on it, to which he said "I'm not familiar with this, let me get you your server to explain to you." Uh... aren't you one of the servers? Anyway, one of the other servers comes and in 10 seconds just summarizes that it's beef with a chipotle sauce. This is a Michelin star restaurant. There's usually so much passion and detail when servers explain what's in the dish. This was totally lacking which was a bit off putting.

Crickets, we ate them, they were ok but weren't enough to compel us to a second visit to the Brooklyn upscale Mexican scene.  It seems that on or off the island  this style of cuisine struggles balancing between haute cuisine and the fear of being associated with their lowly regarded, in their eyes and probably some of the guests, cantinas. Tacos seem to always require some sort of pinkish mayonnaise sauce to set them apart from just three tacos. Well they come in pairs at Oxomoco so mission accomplished. So we hopped back into town, our town, to get ready for the winter. Shalom.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
One of the best meals I had, great service, unique and surprisingly large dishes, and not expensive at all. Highly recommend

The service was attentive, helpful in making suggestions on what to order and very friendly.  Go ahead and do yourself a favor and order the El Mariachi to start while you ponder the menu. The tuna tostada is a must have.  We couldn't make up our mind on dessert and ended up ordering them all.  Thank you for a great dining experience!
No comment

Came for brunch. Favorite thing we ordered were the lamb barbacoa tacos. Lamb was really tender and the greens and sauce paired really well with it. The smoked tomatoes in the guacamole were delicious, but it was still just guac. Tuna tostado was good but a tad too oily. The black sesame horchata was amazing, and the frozen Paloma was just decent
No comment
Absolutely delicious meal and service. The ambiance was super beautiful, and the food was plated very nicely as well. Highly recommend any of the tacos and their frozen drinks

My boyfriend and I decided to come here for my birthday dinner and it was the best decision ever. We came earlier than the time we placed a reservation for so we waited at the bar until there was a table available for us. One of the bartender greeted us and I really enjoyed the la diosa while my boyfriend got the mango mez. My favorite items on the menu was the smoked mango, the guac was AMAZING and also the fish tacos were really good. The music and interior was nice and overall a wonderful experience. We would definitely visit again. A big thanks to our server Peter who was very helpful and knowledgeable when it came to questions and recommendations about the food.

What an exceptional and special experience through and through! You definitely need a reservation- we had one for late Sunday night and still ended up waiting 15 or so minutes - but that is really my only gripe, if you can call it that. We split pretty much everything among our party of 4, even the chips and salsa. Additionally, we ordered 2 tuna tostadas, 2 lamb barbacoa tacos, pollo a las brazas, and bavette. Truly, there was something about everything that was memorable. The chicken was actually my favorite. It was at least half a chicken and still so tender, and the crispy rice it came with was super unique and made for a yummy bite in the taco. But the lamb barbacoa was also special with the squash blossom and watercress. This is incredibly well done, elevated Mexican food and I will be thinking about this dinner for a very long time!

Food here is great! If you have a nut allergy please please mention it to the server. There are a number of dishes here that have nuts and it's not noted on the menu. The individual who brought out my food accidently brought me the dish that wasn't adjusted for my allergies so please be alert and double check when the dish is brought the your table. Overall they are very accommodating when allergies are involved.
No comment
Oxomoco is the best restaurant in Greenpoint. Get the lamb barbacoa cocktails. The service is incredible.

This place was so disappointing. Agree with most that the drinks were good - well balanced, some creative, etc. The food, however.... -_-  very surprised about how bad this was. Stale and cold chips to accompany decent guac, underwhelming tacos and dry chicken. The interior was nice and the drinks were good but will not come back or recommending this place to anyone. Plus the servers started cleaning the bar in front of us during the dinner service... pretty gross
No comment
No comment
There is no better place than Oxomoco for amazing Mexican cuisine, fantastic cocktails and a great atmosphere.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Mediocre gringo hipster mexican where you pay 10 bucks for chips and salsa. Sound appealing? Then Oxomoco is for you. We spent 90 bucks on a lunch for two: chips and salsa, guacamole, and two orders of beet tacos. I don't generally bitch about price, but that is insane. Food was fine, but I won't be back.

My experience was extremely disappointing. Not only was the service subpar, but we were seated outdoors next to the trash and it smelled like a zoo. The smell was nauseating and it completely ruined my appetite. The food was great but the portions were small and nothing special. We ordered 6 dishes and they were not filling -  2 hours after my meal im already hungry.
No comment

Worst customer service ever. Want to host a Rehearsal dinner there. Are 8 emails kindly requesting information enough? Try calling them and always getting a voicemail and unsurprisingly, the mailbox is always full. We are also from Mexico and it shames us that you project that level of low service. To all readers please bear note that that is not the normal case. Don't know what happened to Oxomoco... the arrogance of success? Lost us as customers.
No comment
No comment

This place was outstanding! Definitely a great place to bring people that you'd like to impress. The lamb barbacoa tacos were phenomenal. I had to close my eyes while eating to tune into all the yumminess going on. A MUST HAVE. I'd also highly recommend the pollo a las brazas. The chicken was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside and had such a delicious flavored sauce. The crispy rice that came with it was fantastic! Really loved the market corn tlayuda for a cheesy app. The agua fresca was a sweet and tasty beverage. Can't wait to go back and try more!
No comment
No comment

Not sure why I waited this long to visit, but I'll never make the same mistake again. The tuna tostada was so good we ordered a second. I learned that not all patatas bravas are created equal because Oxomoco perfected it. I can't wait to bring family and friends here and make this a monthly affair, and sip frozen margaritas on their patio all summer long.

Phenomenal atmosphere, cocktails, service and food. Drinks - highly recommend the Sin Fronteras for whiskey/mezcal fans. Food - Guac (amazing, best restaurant guac I've ever ordered), Black Bass (yes), Tuna Tostada (yes yes), Ceviche (yes yes yes), Bavette (yes but no if you don't like mole) and Spring Pea Tlayuda (my favorite dish, have never had anything like it). Would come back in a heart beat next time I'm in Brooklyn.
No comment

column3: Racquet Club West, Palm Springs, CA
column6: i'm not quite sure why this place has a Michelin star and llama inn does not. Definitely a good restaurant, but does not quite live up to the expectations I had for it with that rating. Pricing seemed a little high for what one received, and service could be a touch bit better. Cheers
No comment

We came here for dinner and the first thing that struck me is how nice the space is. Three skylights and plenty of greenery make for a very visually appealing setting. We started our meal with the spicy mango margaritas and the smoked mango appetizers. Both were amazing and I would highly recommend both for anyone who is a fan of the fruit. For our entrees we got the Bavette, Sasso Chicken and the Prawns.  All three were delicious; flavorful in different ways, cooked to perfection, and made for sharing. My only complaint was that the meal felt a little pricey for the size of the plates. Other than that Oxomoco was pretty much perfect and I'd recommend it to everyone.
No comment

This place is gorgeous. I loved the brightness and all the plants in the restaurant, but...that was the only thing that was good about this place. The servers were very rude.  The food took like an hour. Not sure if they forgot or not. When the food came, we were very excited but were greeted with oil on top of oil. The food wasn't very flavorful. It was dripping of oil. Would not come back.
They have a small outdoor seating area you need reservations for. The servers were sweet, the food 2was unique and tasty! A little pricey but it was a good experience. Street parking only.

I was so excited to try Oxomoco as I had heard many great things, I was not disappointed! My father was visiting me in the city a few months back and I thought this would be the perfect place to try together since he is a major foodie. We had the Oxomoco Guacamole, Punta Verde Caesar, Beet "Chorizo" Tacos, Lamb Barbacoa Tacos, La Flama Blanca, and the Paloma. Everything was amazing!

The atmosphere is prefect. The food amazing, the staff was top notch.  And the drinks!  OMG!   We sampled many of the appetizers, and they was amazing.  The main course was outstanding.  Definitely a place to return to.

Phenomenal place. They definitely deserve their Michelin star. Get the guacamole, the tuna tostada and the lamb tacos. Wash it all down with delicious margaritas. The service is amazing and the disco bathrooms are a nice touch.

I went with a couple of coworkers. We shared the burrito , potatoes w/aoili , & lamb/steak tacos. The food was pretty tasty. It has a cute ambiance and the service was great. I think the menu could be slightly better. I would probably not go a second time.

Delicious! This is worth the trip to Greenpoint. Our server was on point, and the drinks/food were remarkably good without any pretension. Extremely fresh flavors from the tuna to the lamp to the peas. Also, the cocktails were well-conceived and executed. This place is nicely informal but manages to pull off dishes that take staples of latin-americas cuisine and refine them without fundamentally changing them.

I'm so glad I called for a reservation. Resy didn't show anything so I called and got a brunch reservation for the next day. When we arrived, we were promptly seated at a beautiful booth area outside. Plenty of space heaters and lots of space to feel safe. I love that they aren't trying to optimize for every seat. For ex they sat us, a party of 2, at a table for 3 and I saw other groups of 2 seated at tables that could accommodate 4. We started with some cocktails and my margarita was delicious. We got chips and an array of salsas to start. The chips were huge, clearly home made and omg the salsas and sauces all tasted so fresh. Next we shared the breakfast burrito and lamb tacos. They were both good but the Lamb tacos are a must have!! They were out of this world, so much flavor and the meat was well cooked and very juicy. The staff were all so friendly and down to earth. We didn't feel rushed and food came out quickly. Can't wait to come back!!
No comment

I've been meaning to try this restaurant for ages and in the meantime I've been enjoying their beautiful instagram posts.  The blood orange cocktail was delicious and all the food delectable.  The chocolate desert was literally the best dessert I have ever had. Period.

Ambiance was incredible. The crowd was mixy. Loved it. Food was very satisfying, I didn't feel hungry leaving but I didn't feel heavy either. The staff is will spoken and knows the menu well. Great food. Will highly recommend.

We came for date night the fiancé and I and wow is all I have to say we had several plates from the fish tacos to the Caesar salad which is to die for so fresh and delicious we had the chicken which is a must hands down the best tuna tartar I think I have eaten

The service was impeccable, the food/drinks were absolutely delicious, the atmosphere was soothing, yet lively. We got lucky and were able to walk in without a reservation around 6pm in a Wednesday. We got the asparagus tacos and beet-chorizo tacos to start. Seems simple, right? Yet the flavors were so rich. Very unexpected. The tortillas were so flavorful you could tell they were freshly made, and the sauces were so complex. Then we moved along to the main course - roast chicken with crispy rice. Incredibly well done! Also ordered both frozen margs, which we were great (see pics). Now unlike some of the other Greenpoint establishments (Naked Dog, I'm looking at you!!) their menu is constantly changing. So impressive for a restaurant of this caliber. Now for the most important part - try their dessert! Really. Best part of the meal and you'd be a FOOL to skip. Went there a month ago and I still think about this strange custard dessert we tried. Not too sweet, perfect texture. No idea what it was but WOW. See the picture - totally worth it.

No comment

My husband and I were so excited to go to Oxomoco, as it was referred to me by a friend.  We were able to get in this past Saturday, and the food and the service was amazing!!  If you get a chance to go to this amazing restaurant, you must try the Soy marinated Tuna tostados, what a way to start a fantastic meal!  Everything we had was so full of flavor.  Each dish was just an explosion in your mouth.  We can't wait to go back again!
No comment

Truly the best! I'm blown away by everything I eat here. My favorite is the steak with salsa matcha either in taco or burrito form. I think they are only available for lunch so I hope they bring it back for the dinner menu. When I sip their cocktails I feel like I'm on vacation - they are sooo delicious! The talyuda is another favorite. Try to go with a group of people so you can order many things on the menu and try it all.

My wife and I ate at Oxocomo for our Saturday date night and we both enjoyed our experience here. I made a reservation on Resy a week or two prior and they had our table ready for us when we arrived. Upon arriving we noticed the beautiful interior and great ambiance. For we food we ordered the guacamole, lamb barbacoa tacos, and pollo a las brazas. Everything was delicious and tasted refined. Highlights for us were the tacos and the chicken.  The service was exceptional and super friendly. Overall, I understand why this place received a Michelin star and I highly recommend checking this place out. Pricewise, this is more expensive than your typical Mexican restaurant but I believe it is well worth it. I will be returning soon to try the brunch burger.

This was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Other than it being a bit cold outside, we had a wonderful time. The service was extremely attentive, and the wait staff was very knowledgeable about the menu and the preparation of the foods. They were extremely accommodating with my nut allergy, and made an effort to make everything perfect for us. I won't go into detail about each individual dish because they were all so amazing, but out of the things we got, the lamb Barbacoa tacos were probably a favorite. For dessert, they forgot to exclude the nuts on one of the dishes, and even after replacing it and having three different people apologize to us, they even took it off of the bill for us. The only note I would give is that we felt the dishes came out too fast, overcrowded our table, and our experience ended very quickly. We were out of there in a little bit over an hour, and that was with coffee and desserts. Would have liked it to have lasted a bit longer. But overall- wow this place is amazing. And relatively cheap for a place that has a Michelin star!!!!

Yummy combination of flavors, including little surprises that make this Mexican just a bit more special. Recommend the pork carnitas tacos with little crispy chicharron bits, brisk hibiscus tea. Taco filling is generous, would be nice if they provided a doubled-up tortilla for folks who like them slightly less filled, and could divide it up. Wish the location was a bit warmer. Mexico and its cuisine are humble, homey, unpretentious. This place and the staff both a bit too cold for me. Would come back just for the food, nothing enticing about the environment.

Wonderful service - our server was attentive, friendly, and gave great reccs. Restaurant itself had an airy vibe with lots of greenery. The food was delicious! Also recommend the agua fresca. I'd absolutely love to come back here!
